loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha Elizabeth H. L. is a 39 year old single mother. She completed her studies through high school. She has 2 children, one in primary school, the other in high school. They live in the District of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad. Since her husband abandoned her she has had to support herself financially. She decided to participate in the Grupo Mientras Tanto SANTA LUCIA. She received her first loan for 300 Soles which she invested in the purchase of a sewing machine and began her small business doing alternations and making costumes. With a loan for 500 Soles, to be repaid within 4 payments, she plans to purchase fabric to increase her production of costumes. Thanks to her perseverance and effort she has a large number of customers. She dreams of remodeling her house to have a sewing room and space to sell school uniforms, dresses, etc, and to study fashion design.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Martha Elizabeth H. L., es madre soltera, tiene 39 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primario y secundario respectivamente, vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Debido al abandono del esposo, tuvo que ayudarse económicamente. Decidió participar en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “SANTA LUCIA”, recibió un préstamo de S/. 300.00, invertido en la compra de una máquina para coser y empezó en el mundo del negocio, arreglando pantalones y elaborando disfraces. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, tiene pensado comprar tela para incrementar la cantidad de disfraces. Gracias a su perseverancia y esfuerzo tiene una gran afluencia de clientes. La socia sueña con remodelar su casa, tener un taller de costura para vender uniformes de colegios, buzos, al por mayor y estudiar alta costura.

loans.use: Compra de tela al por mayor.

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es:
Juana M. is originally from the city of Leon and lives in the county of Nagarote. She dedicates herself to the arduous labor of sewing, and has done so for long 30 years. She has acquired great experience making trousers, shirts and all types of clothing.

Being a widow she doesn't get any financial help from her partner, so she works hard to sustain her household. It is for this reason that she is seeking help from Ceprodel. She would like credit to buy some materials which she works with and to continue to maintain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana M. es originaria de la ciudad de León habitando en el municipio de Nagarote y se dedica a su ardua labor de costura dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 30 largos años habiendo adquirido gran experiencia en la elaboración de pantalones, camisas y todo tipo de costura.

A pesar que ella es una dama viuda a partir de que no recibe el apoyo económico de su cónyuge, inicia a laborar fuertemente duplicando sus esfuerzos para llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. Por este motivo es que una vez más busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual adquirir los materiales de trabajo y continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy work materials/Compra de materiales de trabajo

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 28 years old. She is married and has three children ages 12, 8 and 4. She runs her own cafe, which she started in January 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia has been cooking and selling chapati in Zanzibar since 2002. Chapati is a flat pancake fried in oil and eaten for breakfast or lunch. It can be consumed plain or rolled up with fruits or vegetables inside. Asia works from 8:00am to 9:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $35 each month. She is hoping that by taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania, she will be able to increase her profit.

Asia is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, aged 5, 8, 9 and 17. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanahawa, Arata, Kasisa and Asha.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook and sell chapati.

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
María Jacinta pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz de Motupe del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 38 años de edad y dos hijos con su conviviente. En su vida personal ha tenido una dificultad, el tener una hija adolescente que sufre de la presión, pero que poco a poco está mejorando. 

Desea agrandar su negocio de abarrotes y ajíes que expende en el jr. Caraz s/n de manera provisional los días de feria de la ciudad de Huaraz, estos productos los trae desde la ciudad de Barranca. Ha sido su mayor reto porque al iniciar su negocio lo hizo con una bolsa de papel higiénico y ahora tiene invertido en todo su negocio un monto aproximado de cinco mil soles. Ahora se está desarrollando tranquilamente y paga su permiso de venta los días de feria por el lugar que ocupa su puesto de venta y los días donde no hay feria vende sus productos caminando.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en seis cuotas, comprará sacos de ají para tenerlos en reserva.
 
María afirma que le gustaría recibir charlas para saber llevar mejor su familia porque cree que es muy importante para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Jacinta belongs to the communal bank Cruz de Motupe in the Independencia district, Huaraz province, in Ancash. She is 38 years old and has two children with her partner. She has had difficulties in her personal life, having an adolscent daughter who suffers from high blood pressure but is slowly getting better. She wants to grow her grocery and chili peppers business and that she has on Caraz Street, and also in a provisional manner on market days in the city of Huaraz. She brings the products from the city of Barranca. It’s been a major challenge because she started her business with one bag of toilet paper and, today, she has invested everything into the enterprise totalling approximately 5,000.00 soles. Now she is progressing calmly and she pays her business permit on market days for the post she occupies there. Days she isn’t at the market, she sells her products on foot. With this loan of 1,200.00 soles, to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy bags of peppers to have in reserve. María states that she would like to receive lessons/guidance on how to make things better for her family, because she thinks it’s very important to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of peppers.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita B., age 44, is a widow and has no children. Making dresses is her only source of income. In an interview after the death of her husband, she sadly shares that she has been very lonely. Sewing rugs and dress making is her only source of living. People come to her to have nice dresses made. Estelita says, “My mother taught me how to properly sew all the fabrics and design clothes, and I am still using her sewing machine for the food that I eat”.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to purchase fabrics for rugs and dresses. She also wants to try some other lines of business to augment her income. In this way she could expand her business and employ more helpers.

She believes that by joining CEVI, she will realize her plans. Now, she enjoys credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage through CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to use in making rugs and dresses.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy L., 28, is a widow with three children.  She has many years experience selling a variety of shop items to the villagers and public people seven days per week. Amy has had two previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She plans to purchase goods to restock her shop.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock shop

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
For ten years, Felicitas has been working as a beautician. Her beauty skills became her great capital in helping her husband earn enough for their daily necessities. At present, she is in need of financial assistance and she would like to borrow PHP 7,000 which she will use to purchase beauty accessories that she needs to cope with new fashions. She also has skill in cutting hair for men and women. She also wants to engage in peanut butter making or maybe in the business of buying and selling goods to increase her daily income and to save for the education of her three children. Felicitas is hoping to achieve all her business plans for the future of her children.

Felecitas is 37 years old. She is married to Jovito, a carpenter. Their children are: Jevoi, 3 years old; Benvick Jovani, 6 years old, a pre-school student and Jonila, 13 years old, a second year high school student.

loans.use: purchase beauty accessories

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Desde hace cuatro años Ysabel vende cosméticos de tres distintas marcas. También se dedica a la venta de ropa bajo pedidos. Anteriormente, a lo largo de dos años estuvo trabajando en un colegio como auxiliar, debido a los estudios de educación que tuvo cuando era joven.
El negocio de los cosméticos nació a raíz de que Isabel vio que sus tiempos libres los podía ocupar también en algo que le generara un ingreso adicional, un trabajo que sea sobretodo independiente.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años y con dos hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes, Isabel quisiera aumentar la mercadería de sus cosméticos y poder comprar una vitrina grande para mostrar a sus clientes todo su stock.
texts.en:
For the past 4 years Ysabel has sold 3 different brands of cosmetics She also sells clothing to customers that place orders through her. She also worked at a private school as a teacher's aid for two years. She was able to get this job because of her level of education. She started to sell cosmetics because she could run the business in her free time and earn money. She also loves working for herself. Now that she is 48 years old and her 2 kids are grown and independent, Ysabel would like to increase her inventory of cosmetics and also buy a glass case to display her current stock to her customers.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty Products

loans.name: Bendecido Por Jehova. Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Bendecido por Jehova son mujeres responsables con deseos de salir adelante, son vecinas cercanas con mucha experiencia con sus actividades diarias. el grupo se conforma de la siguiente manera:
Sra. Bessy R. tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un año de dedicarse a su negocio que son la elaboracion de tortillas, ella se levanta a las 5:00am para empezar su produccion y luego tiene que venderlas desde las 7:00am hasta las 12 del medio dia, tabimbien vende productos lacteos., ella antes tenia una cafeteria donde vendia golosinas, pero tuvo unos problemas y tuvo que deshacerse de su negocio y ahora quiere empezar de nuevo para salir adelante.
Sra. Heimy tiene 22 años de edad y tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de joyeria como ser aritos, argollas, relojes, tambien vende monederos, carteras, zapatos, cadenas de plata, desde niña le han gustado las ventas ya que antes trabajaba como impulsadora de una empresa privada, pero ella mejor decidio poner su propio negocio y asi solo trabajar para ella, esto tambien lo hizo ya que no tenia a nadie que le cuidara su hijo, y pagar una niñera le salia muy caro. su esposo trabaja en cafe maya una empresa privada, el viaja todas las semanas para distribuir el cafe por varias comunidades. ella necesita el credito para comprar telas para fabricar carteras, comprar escencias de perfumes y ropa interior, la meta de ella a corto plazo  es tener un negocio grande.
Sra. Roxana V. tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a su negocio, ella vende zapatos para dama, carteras, cortinas, mochilas, set de lociones, jeans, camiasas, tenis, ella tiene 3 hijos.
tiene muchos clientes fijos la visitan a su casa para comprarle el producto, ella es muy amable y sociable, esto es una caracteristica que no todas las personas la tienen y por eso sus clientes la buscan. ella antes trabajaba en una farmacia, pero mejor decidio poner su propio  negocio y le da mas ganancias que el salario que tenia en la farmacia. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas ropas, cortinas, carteras y sandalias. el sueño de ella es tener una tienda bien grande.
texts.en:
The Groups "Blessed by Jehova" are responsible women with a desire to get ahead in life. They are close neighbours with a lot of experience in their daily activities. The group is consists of the following members; Bessy Rodrigues is 40 years old, she has had a business making and selling tortillas for the past year. She gets up at 5am to begin her production and then she sells the tortillas from 7am till midday. She also sells dairy products. Previously she has a cafeteria where she used to sell sweets and snacks, but she had some problems and she had to give up the business, and now she wants to start again in order to keep moving forward. Heimy is 22 years old and she has spent the last two years selling jewellery such as earrings, rings and watches. She also sells purses, wallets, shoes and silver chains. Since she was a small child, she has liked retail sales, and previously she worked as a sales assistant in a private company, but then she decided it would be better to set-up her own business and only have to work for herself. She also decided to do this because she didn't have anybody to look after her son, and paying for a nanny was very expensive. Her husband works in Cafe Maya, a private company. He travels every week to distribute coffee in various communities. She needs the credit in order to purchase fabric to make wallets, buy perfume scents and underwear. Her short term aim is to have a big business. Roxana V. is 28 years old, she has 2 years experience with her business. She sells shoes for women, wallets, curtains, rucksacks, lotion sets, jeans, shirts and sneakers. She has three children. She has a lot of faithful customers who visit her in her house to buy these products. She is very friendly and sociable, and as these are characteristics that not everyone has, this is why her customers seek her out. Previously, she worked in a pharmacy, but she decided it was better to set-up her own business and it gives her more income than the salary she earned in the pharmacy. She needs the loan in order to buy more clothes, curtains, wallets and sandals. Her dream is to have a larger shop.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prodcuts and stock for their businesses

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicia Escurra tiene 51 años de edad, es separada, y estuvo casado por 14 años. El matrimonio tuvo cuatro hijos que actualmente están todos casados y viven en forma independiente.

La Sra. Felicia se inicio en este negocio de ventas de joyas hace cuatro años con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos que le dio el capital inicial y a partir de ahi ella empezo a aumentar sus mercaderias gracias a que cada dia aumenta su clientela y por ende aumenta su ingreso mensual.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de aro, argolla, medallitas, anillos, cadenas, pulseras y otras joyas de plata y de esta forma cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicia Escurra is 51 years old, separated, and was married for 14 years. The couple had four children who today are married and live on their own. Felicia began this business selling jewelry 4 years ago with the help of one of her children who gave her the initial capital and from there she began to increase her merchandise as thankfully every day her clientele grew as a result increasing her monthly income. The client seeks a loan to buy earrings, rings, medals, necklaces, chains and other silver jewelry and in this way meet her customer’s orders.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy earrings, rings, medals, necklaces, bracelets and other silver jewelry

loans.name: Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani

texts.en:
Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani (DNR.M-0639) is a 45 year old woman living in the town of Dsn. Pangkung Buluh, Ds. Kaliakah. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani - (DNR.M-0639) merupakan 45 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Dsn. Pangkung Buluh, Ds. Kaliakah. Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Kadek Ayu Ardani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Chakhalov

texts.en:
Chakhalov H. is a 53-year-old man who breeds calves in the small village of Saatli. H. is married and has three children. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

H. has more than 20 years of experience in breeding calves. H. buys baby calves, raises them, and then sells them to the local traders for meat. Humbar has applied for $1500 to purchase three calves to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves to expand his business

loans.name: Sharifchon

texts.ru: Шарифчон – молодой мужчина 1982 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Занимается продажей прохладительных напитков на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Он продает газированные напитки и соки. Он закупает товар у оптовиков из рынка «Панчшанбе» и продает в розницу на рынке «Фаровон». Шарифчон кредитуется в нашей организации впервые. Он очень благодарен кредитной организации за эту поддержку.
texts.en:
Sharifchon Y. is a young man born in 1982. He is married with 1 child. He sells cold drinks in the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. He sells both soft drinks and juices. He buys the drinks wholesale at the Panchshanbe market and then sells them at the Farovon market. Sharifchon is a new member of the credit organization and is very grateful for the support he receives from it.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Increase Sales

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima sells second hand clothes of various colors and sizes. She is married with two children.  Chidima is 25 years old.  She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesús Margarita

texts.es: Doña Jesús C.  cuenta con 39 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Tipícos para mujeres” habita junto a  sus 5 hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 12 años en la Artesanía su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Paquiaquix, Cantón Quiaquix del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Jesús C. is 39 years old. She is married, by the Tejedora service. She makes traditional clothing for women. She lives with her 5 children. They all do the same work; she has spent 12 years in crafts. Her home is found in the Paraje Paquiaquix, in Cantón Quiaquix, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At the moment the demand from her clientele is growing, but the economic conditions that she finds herself in are not sufficient for her to be able to augment her capital. For this reason, she approached ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying more merchandise and in this manner increasing her weekly sales, hoping also to improve her children’s lives and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (purchase of raw materials)

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede 2 Group

texts.en:
Nicolasa M. (pictured above in red) used to be a housewife, until she got a divorce. Now she has her own business. Her kids are still her priority and she insists on calling them her babies, even though they are now 13 and 14. She received a loan with Esperanza two years ago and with that began her business. Nicolasa sells health, beauty, and basic hygiene products from her home; in that way she can still be close to her kids. She lives in Barrio Lindo in San Pedro D. Macoris. Even though translated it means Beautiful neighborhood. Barrio Lindo can have its troubles. To name the most prominent ones, there is no constant running water - sometimes the town is left three to four days without water.  Electricity goes out unpredictably every day,  sometimes for a few hours but sometimes for half a day, and crime has risen so much that you cannot walk by yourself after it gets dark. Yet with all those circumstances Nicolasa’s business has proven to be successful. She is now on her third loan with Esperanza and is quite satisfied with her steady income. She laughs and smiles at me, confessing that she wishes her business can keep on gaining momentum because one day she hopes to own her own car. 

Please strongly consider loaning to Nicolasa.  She is diligent and deserves an opportunity to grow her business and eventually own her own car. Esperanza thanks you for your time and consideration.

Maira Flores
Summer Intern ‘09

loans.use: to purchase Amway health products, cosmetics, and hygiene products to grow her home business

loans.name: Sailon

texts.ru:
Негматова Сайлон  1971 3 дети вдова портниха 10000 12 мох 

Сайлон – 38 лет. Вдова, мать 3-х детей. Она занимается любимым делом больше 10 лет. Она – портниха. Год назад она открыла свой ателье, где шьют на заказ постельное белье, а также национальные платья. Сайлон хочет получить займ в сумме 10000 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев для закупа х/б тканей для постельного белья.

loans.use: Закуп Х/Б тканей для постельного белья

loans.name: Prelyn

texts.en:
Prelyn G. is from the city of Pagadian. She is 29 years old. Prelyn is single. To make a living, Prelyn is starting a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prelyn is just starting this business.

Prelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prelyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Prelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene una tienda de abarrotes, el esposo es transportista publico asalariado, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos que depende de la pareja; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinará para incrementar su capital de trabajo (compra de mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes), para poder surtir su mercadería.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Carmen operates a grocery store. Her husband is a salaried public transportation driver. Her business is the main source of income that enables her to support her four dependent children. Her family lives in their own home in the Cotahuma district of the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase merchandise to restock her grocery store.

This is Carmen’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Grupo Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Camino a la Luz es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, del municipio de Tisma ubicado a 17 Km de la ciudad de Masaya. Está formado por Elena Patricia M. G., Blanca Azucena G. y María Auxiliadora C..

Elena es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 23 años de edad y es madre de una niña de 2 años; por quien trabaja muy duro, para lograr darle un nivel de vida mejor que el que ella tuvo. Elena trabaja en la elaboración e cajetas (de coco, leche, maní, papaya) y otra variedad de postres como atol, arroz con leche, que distribuye en su comarca.

Aparte trabaja planchando ropa y comprando arboles que convierte en leña y distribuye en pulperías y tortillerías, se esfuerza mucho por conseguir ingresos que le permitan brindarle a su hija las necesidades básicas.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en el negocio de la leña, ya que le resulta muy bueno, está orgullosa de sus logros puesto que ha podido levantar su humilde casa con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de su esposo.

Blanca vende refrescos de frutas y bebidas gaseosas en su casa de habitación, además de vender golosinas y María C. vende comida en su casa.

loans.use: compra de arboles para leña

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las peras está conformado por  Silvia Elena L. B., Miriam Escarleth A., Fátima del Rosario S. y Cruz Alfonzo L. Rivas. Ellas son del Raizon, Nindiri.

Silvia L. de 33 años comenzó hace tres años vendiendo sopas los domingos y actualmente ella vende comida los fines de semana el sábado hace fritanga y los domingos sopas. Ella ocupara el préstamo para adquirir artículos para el negocio como platos, tasas, cucharas y productos como yuca, hueso, carne, granos básicos, papa, ayote entre otros.

Mientras Miriam Escarlet A. vende fritanga, Fátima del Rosario S. vende cosméticos y Cruz Alfonzo L. vende ropa nueva y usada.

loans.use: para comprar carne, verduras, huesos, granos básicos

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Ajara works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. Ajara cooks and sells rice with stew. She sells by the roadside from morning till evening. She procures her ingredients from nearby towns.

Ajara has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Justice

texts.en: Justice, 29, is married and has two children who are currently in school. He works very hard, driven by his passion to provide brighter future opportunities for his children. Justice sells logs of wood in his community, buying his stock from saw millers and retailing them to his clients. He wants to use the loan to buy more logs of wood so he can increase his income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase wooden logs in bulk.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: This 44-year-old farmer, Gina, is already a widow but strives hard to make a living. She grows rice in Surallah, South Cotabato. She needs additional capital to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer, and to pay for land preparation. She has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will help her to meet her needs for the farm and for the support of her 3 children in school.

loans.use: Farm supplies, fertilizer, labor

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
La señora Porfiria es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 4 meses atrás, del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primarios incompletos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. 
Porfiria se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprò de redes, corchos, etc.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse su carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Porfiria has been a member of the "Tupac Amary I" Community Bank for the last 4 months in the Yunguyo province, district of Puno. She is 39 years old, has an incomplete primary education, and is married with three children. Porfiria buys and sells fish, and she tells us that with her first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos of 500 soles she bought nets, bobbers, etc. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles so she can buy a cow. Her dreams for the future are to buy herself a cart and that her children become professionals. What she likes the best about her Community Bank is the meetings among the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mary Emy

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of living of Mary Emy, 54. She supports two children in her family. Her 1-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field is just enough to provide their basic needs.

Mary Emy joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan with a low interest rate to finance her business. She’s requesting 8,000 Php to buy farm necessities and to sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to sustain her family

loans.name: Pheach

texts.en: S. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and also raises ducks to produce eggs for extra profit. S. is taking out her loan to purchase more feed and ducks for her husband to breed. This couple was married many years ago and is blessed with seven children who go to school or to work.

loans.use: To purchase more feed and ducks.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en:
Jhonny is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his parents and brother. In 2005, he opened his own bakery business in his town. Jhonny caters for a wide range of customers in his village and surrounding neighborhoods. He bakes all kinds of Lebanese bread, cookies, etc.  He is grateful for his work because it allows him to control his economic situation. 

Today, Jhonny is requesting to borrow $1,200 USD to renovate his bakery and purchase an electronic oven. In this way, he hopes to develop his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: To renovate his bakery and purchase an electronic oven

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, es una mujer muy soñadora, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 64 años, es madre de sietes hijos, dos son dependientes, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, esta actividad la realiza en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda en el trabajo de criar las gallinas. Lastenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace tres ciclos, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de alimentos para sus gallinas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en el acondicionamiento de un lugar en su casa para que pueda vender comida. La meta de Lastenia es tener una bodega en su casa donde pueda vender de todo.
texts.en:
Lastenia is a woman with big dreams. She lives in the Yarinacocha district of Ucayali. She is 64 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom still live with her. She makes a living raising chickens, a business that she runs from her house. Her husband helps her with the business. Lastenia has been a member of the Las Dinamicas community bank for three funding cycles. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy chicken feed. She now needs a 1000-soles loan that she will use to renovate a space in her house to sell food. Lastenia's goal is to own a shop in her house where she can sell everything.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop a space at home for food sales.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James M. K. is fifty years old. He is married and they have two children aged twenty-three and twenty-one years old. His business is located at Kiganjo, a very business market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.


James has been running a fuel station for the last five years. He says the major challenge in this kind of business is price fluctuations therefore dissatisfied customers. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 65,000 to buy fuel to expand his business. In future, he hopes to open many outlets. He is a very innovative man.

loans.use: buying more fuel to resell

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix O. is a 32 year-old businessman who sells bicycle spares in Nyamasaria Kisumu Kenya. He started his business in 2001, after ditching welding as a source for generating income, and he buys his stock in Kisumu town on a weekly basis.

Felix is a father of three children and also takes care of two orphans. His dream is to see all of these children get a good education that will guarantee them a better future but this will only come to pass with him having a solid financial base.

This is why he wants to boost his business by increasing his stock that will see him generating enough income. It is for this reason that he wishes to get a loan of 20000 KES.

loans.use: To increase stock to boost his business.

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla S., from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, is a 37-year-old married mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosavilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosavilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 38-year-old single mother of three children aged 21, 8 and 14 years. She has toiled to bring them up alone with the ever-higher cost of education. She lives in Masindi, Uganda, where she operates a secondhand clothing business in the market. She has been in the business for fifteen years. 

With the loan, Prossy intends to buy secondhand cloths for reselling. She expects to have a bigger clothing business in future and include new clothing in her business.

Prossy is currently living in a rented home and her dream is to construct her own house and also to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Leangse

texts.en:
Leangse N. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sarith Rim, have been married since 1990 and have three children; one son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

One month ago, Leangse started a business selling food in front of the garment factory. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi since 1989. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia A. is from the village of Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Delia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pren

texts.en: Every day, Mrs. P. hurries to wake up before dawn and travels to where the fishermen work. She buys their fish in bulk and comes back to sell the fish at the small market for a profit. Her husband earns an income climbing palm trees to tap juice and boilit  into sugar for sale. The couple work  together to generate enough income to support their three school-aged kids. They have an older child who is now married. Mrs. P. will be using her first loan to buy more fish to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements and to pay some personal family expenses.

loans.name: Julia Anyango

texts.en: Julia Anyango O. is married with four children. She is 34 years old. She is a business lady who sells second hand clothes that she normally buys from Busia. She is situated in Malanga. Prior to this, she practiced agricultural activities, which she realized could not enable her to adequately satisfy all her family needs and that is why, when she heard of this initiative of loan grants by K-MET, she decided to apply for a loan worth Ksh.10000. She will use the loan to increase her stock so that she can expand her business and maximize her profit to help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr:
B. Samuel, née à Kigali  secteur Muhima dans la province de ville de Kigali du Rwanda, il est marié, il a 4 enfants, il a 40 ans, son ainé a 12  ans et son dernier enfant à 5 ans et  son niveau d’éducation est primaire. Il habite à Kicukiro avec sa famille. Tous ces enfants vont à l’école. Son épouse  fait le commerce de détail en  boutique pour aider son mari de faire vivre sa famille et pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de celle-ci. Il effectue ce commerce de transport des personnes sur moto a Kigali .Il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour acheter le réservoir de sa moto pour remplacer le vieux réservoir.
Il fait les épargnes, une partie du profit est  épargne pour les études de ses enfants et supporter la capacité  financière de sa femme. Il a pu construire une maison grâce aux épargnes continuelles.
texts.en:
B. Samuel was born in Kigali, in the Muhima sector, in the province of Kigali City, Rwanda. He is married and has four children. He is 40 years old. His eldest child is 12, and his last child is 5. Samuel has a primary school education. He lives with his family in Kicukiro. All of his children go to school. His wife has a retail store to help her husband provide for the family and to be able to improve living conditions. Samuel has a business transporting people on his motorbike in Kigali. He just signed a loan with the micro-finance institution Amasezerano to buy a gas tank for his motorbike to replace the old one. He is saving money. Part of his profit is saved for his children's schooling and for supporting his wife's finances. He was able to build a house, thanks to the steady savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a fuel tank for his motorbike

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en: Arcely A. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Arcely is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Arcely buys and sells bamboo shoots and other food products to local community members. Arcely has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Arcely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcely is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Arcely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, sugar, boxes of soap and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and boxes of soap to sell.  Sarah is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a carpenter. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and boxes of soap to sell

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza B. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 33 years old. Rheza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rheza owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing construction services to local community members. Rheza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rheza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rheza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase equipment to improve the business. Rheza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Rheza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: G.s. Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: La señora Marta tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 10 y 13 años respectivamente. Ella tiene una panadería, localizada en su casa de habitación, ella horna dos veces por semana, vende el pan en una comunidad. Tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, cabe señalarse desde niña aprendió este negocio de su mama ya que ella anteriormente se dedicaba a lo mismo. Ella solicita este préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlo en materia prima para la producción de pan. La otra integrante del grupo es doña Flor, la cual tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de ocho y once años respectivamente. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales y cosa de horno, los cales distribuye de manera ambulante elabora fritos de cerdo y sale a vender. Ella comenzó este negocio desde hace 7 años con el objetivo de tener un ingreso adicional al de su esposo para mantener a sus hijos. Cabe señalarse su esposo trabaja como albañil. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de nacatamales.
texts.en: Señora Marta is 36 years old, married and has 3 children who are 7, 10 and 13 years old respectively.  She has a bakery located in her home.  She bakes twice a week and sells her bread in the community.  She has been making her living in this way for 8 years.  It's worth noting that she learned her trade from her mother as a young girl, since her mother made her living in the same way.  She is requesting her loan with the intention of investing in raw materials for making bread.  The other member of the group is doña Flor, who 29 years old, married and has 2 children who are eight and eleven years old respectively.  She makes her living making "nacatamales" (a traditional Nicaraguan dish) and baked goods, which she sells as a street vendor.  She also makes pork sausage, which she sells on the street as well. She started her business 7 years ago with the goal of adding to her husband's income in order to support their children.  It's worth nothing that husband works as a bricklayer.  She wants this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for making "nacatamales."

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is the treasurer of Dove Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya and has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces maize, milk, beans and vegetables, which are sold to the local market. She also runs a posho mill and a tailoring shop in the same area.

Grace is 46 years old. She is a widowed mother of four school-aged children, all of whom attend school.

She has requested this loan of 31,200KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her children and feed her family well. Her primary challenge has been poor prices for her products. She however hopes that in the future she will expand her farming by buying 5 more dairy cows, for which she has enough land.

She is requesting Juhudi to also provide school fee loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Terengot Ole

texts.en:
Terengot Ole K. is 24 years old and he supports a family of three. His spouse is Esther K. and she supports him in farming. Terengot has been a wheat farmer for the last four years, and he also raises livestock.

This will be his third loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare land for wheat planting and the remaining amount to buy some livestock. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting and to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Bernilda

texts.es:
El negocio de Bernilda N., es mejorar la imagen personal y/o profesional de sus clientes mediante las técnicas de belleza que aplica a ellos  en su salón de belleza del barrio Villas del Carmen, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 14 y 17 años. Ella inició este negocio cuando aprendió a cortar cabello y practicaba esta tarea,  primero con familiares y muy buenas amigas y gradualmente extendió su servicio, aprendiendo las técnicas de manicure, pedicure, tratamientos de cabello y maquillaje, productos que hoy en día ofrece en su microempresa y con los que resalta la belleza de cada persona que compra los servicios que ella ofrece.
Este es el tercer financiamiento que  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace a Bernilda, organización que le ha apoyado su crecimiento personal y empresarial mediante servicios de formación empresarial y crédito,  para que ella pasara de las   tijeras y maquina  de corte, a todo lo que hoy tiene como infraestructura su negocio. Bernilda ha tenido un manejo ordenado y muy técnico de el, porque el aprendizaje producto de las capacitaciones, lo aplica y esto hace que cada día viva  mas enamorada de su negocio y de lo que mas le gusta ofrecer: Belleza para damas caballeros, jóvenes y niños, que son su  principal  mercado en el barrio donde vive,  y   de otros barrios a su alrededor que  también la buscan, porque sus clientes reales “han pasado la voz”,  de  la buena calidad de su trabajo. Con su credikiva, Bernilda se dispone a comprar productos de belleza como tintes, aliceres, pintauñas, limas, champús,  enjuague y gel todo esto en mayor volumen,  para obtener buenos descuentos y asegurarse que en estas fiestas de Diciembre no le falte nada en el momento de hacer su trabajo, porque sus clientes deben quedar bellos para celebrar en familia y para ir a las graduaciones y fiestas de sus amigos familiares o vecinos.
Su sueño mas adelante es construir la segunda planta de su vivienda, para independizar el negocio de su vida familiar y brindar un ambiente confortable a sus clientes y mayor tranquilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Bernilda N.'s business is to improve the personal and professional image of her customers with beauty techniques applied in her beauty salon in the Villas del Carmen neighborhood.  She lives there with her husband and her two children, age 14 and 17. 

She started this business when she learned to cut hair and practiced on her relatives and very good friends, and gradually extended her services.  She learned techniques for manicures, pedicures, hair treatments and makeup, which she offers in her business now and improves the beauty of everyone who buys the services she offers.

This is her third loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization which has supported her personal and professional growth with business training services and loans, so that she has passed from scissors and cutting equipment to everything she has today as the infrastructure of her business.  

Bernilda has an organized and technical operation of her business because she applies her training and every day is more in love with her business and what she likes to offer: beauty for women, men, young people, and children.  Her primary market is the people in her neighborhood and in other neighborhoods nearby who have heard good things about the quality of her work from her customers. 

With her loan, Bernilda plans to purchase beauty products like dyes, straighteners, nail polish, nail files, shampoos, conditioners, and gel in a larger volume so she can get a better discount and make sure she has enough stock for the December holidays.  Her customers need to stay beautiful to celebrate with their families and to go to graduations and parties with their friends and neighbors.  

Her dream is to build a second floor of her home so she can separate her business from her family life and create a comfortable environment for her customers and more comfort for her family.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products like dyes, straighteners, nail polish, nail files, shampoos, conditioners, and gel in higher volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: San Isidro 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama San Isidro1, porque es el Santo del municipio de donde es originario el grupo, pertenece al Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. Rosalba es una integrante de este grupo. Tiene 27 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de plantas que inició desde hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en la temporada de noche buena, ya que en esta epoca es cuando ella vende el mayor número de plantas.Sus clientes recomiendan ampliamente a la señora porque les ofrece un buen surtido en plantas y siempre trata de que sus clientes se sientan a gusto con lo que compran. Ella inicio el negocio como un  pasatiempo ya que siempre le han gustado las plantas.Quiere este credito para poder invertir en su negocio ya que desea incrementar el numero de clientes y de esta forma obtener un mayor ingreso y poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
This Group is called San Isidro I because his is the patron saint of the community the group is from.  It’s in Hidalgo state in México.  The group has 11 members.

Rosalba is a member of the group.  She’s 27 years old and finished third grade.  She started selling plants three years ago.  She is asking for a loan to invest in the poinsettia season since this is the season when she sells the greatest number of plants.

Her customers recommend her widely because she has a good variety of plants and always strives that her customers feel satisfied with their purchases.

She started the business as a hobby since she’s always liked plants.  She wants this loan to invest in the business because she wants to increase her customer base to earn higher income and be able to offer her son a better future.

loans.use: To invest in the poinsettia season.

loans.name: Crucero De San Vicente 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Eleuteria Hernández quien es tesorera del grupo CRUCERO DE SAN VICENTE 1 que está ubicado en la localidad de San Vicente en Jilotepec Edo.de México, en la foto se puede apreciar a las señoras que forman parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la VENTA DE TORTILLAS DE COMAL el cual inició hace 10 años, solicita el prestamo para comprar otro comal y más maiz ya que el comal  que tiene ya no sirve muy bien.Las clientas de la señora comentan que sus tortillas son muy ricas y ademas son de las mejor calidad que venden en la localidad .Ella tiene 43 años sólo estudió la primaria y es casada y apesar de no contar con un buen grado de estudios es muy aguerrida en su trabajo, tiene una hija de 20 años a la señora la motiva seguir trabajando con dedicación ya que con las ganacias de su trabajo quiere hacer un buen patrimonio para cuando ella ya no pueda trabajar y no ser una carga para su familia.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Mrs. Eleuteria Hernández’s business.  She is the Treasurer of the CRUCERO DE SAN VICENTE I group which is located in San Vicente in Jilotepec, México state.  In the photo we can see the women who form this group.

She has sold comal (flat, earthenware griddle for making tortillas) tortillas for 10 years.  She is asking for funds to buy another comal and more corn because the comal she owns doesn’t work too well anymore.  Her customers comment that her tortillas are very good and the best quality sold in their location.

She is 43 years old and only went to elementary school.  She’s married and, even though she didn’t get a lot of schooling, she is very experienced in her work.  She has a 20 year old daughter.  She is motivated to continue working with dedication because she wants to use profits from her work to establish a good patrimony so that when she’s no longer able to work she won’t be a burden to her family.

loans.use: To buy another griddle and more corn.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a fifty year old hardworking man, married to a nurse with five children. They live in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to secure a sustainable venture to earn income for the basic needs at home. For ten years he has been an employee of the Ministry of Health and also owns a drug shop. His major challenge is price fluctuation of drugs. In the future he hopes to set up a pharmacy. George needs the loan to buy drugs for resale.

loans.use: Buying drugs for resale

loans.name: Susana Del Socorro

texts.es: Susana Del Socorro tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de elotes. Desde hace mas de 18 años que tiene este negocio, ella es muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad todos los días, ella sale desde muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche ya que ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y disfrutan de lo que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de la mazorca de maíz, leña, bolsas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Susana del Socorro is 45 years old and sells corn.  She has been in this business for over 18 years.  She is very hard-working and enjoys her daily activity.  She leaves the house early in the morning at 5:00 a.m. and works until 7:00 p.m., selling her corn in the streets to customers who really enjoy it.  She is requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood and bags, among other things.

loans.use: As working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks & toothpaste in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es:
Bolívar casado, hombre trabajador, su casa es humilde, tiene como proyecto la terminación de la construcción total de su casa, ha ido poco a poco realizando mejoras en la vivienda.
Con este ciclo de préstamo comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedra, bloque, alambre de amarre, camisa, entre otros materiales. Para la construcción de un cuarto.
texts.en: Bolívar is a hard-working married man.  He lives in a modest home.  His current project is to complete construction of his home.  He has been making improvements to it little by little.  With the loan proceeds, he will buy construction materials: cement, sand, stone, blocks and wire, among other items.  This is for the construction of a room.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie G. is from the village of Barangay 26, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Margie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business buying and selling used clothing or ukay-ukay products in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional good to sell . Margie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock of used clothing to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell and to pay for her weekly obligation.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk S., 32, resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. sells traditional baskets, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed transporting construction materials, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. 
S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new truck to improve her husband’s business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new truck to transport construction materials

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 50 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 1 of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a sari-sari store in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 30 years.   Lornahas  requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Aisyah

texts.en:
Aisyah is a 43 year old lady and married toYusran, a crops seller. They are living in Oeba Village and have been blessed with 4 children, namely:
-	Jefry, 19 years old who is studying in University
-	Ricky, 18 years old and graduated from Senior High School
-	Amir, 5 years old
-	Akbar, 1 year old
Aisyah has a kitchen equipments business. She initiated this business using her own capital to support her husband in generating money for their family. She has been running the business for 4 years. The business is operated in Oeba Market. She rents a small area for her business which costs her IDR 300,000 per year. 

Aisyah needs to add more equipment at her business to meet the demand of her customers. To do so, Aisyah doesn’t have enough capital so she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She plans to spend the loan on kitchen equipments such as the water pot, rice cooker steamer, frying pan with different sizes, and also plastic and glass plates. She hopes that TLM will assist her with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen equipment to sell such as the water pot, rice cooker steamer, frying pan with different sizes, and also plastic and glass plates.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María tiene 24  años de edad, ella es casada.  Vive en casa propia, con sus dos menores hijos dependientes. María reside  en un anexo llamado  San Antonio de Padua, ubicado a 07 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. 
Se dedica se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultora.
María desea adquirir más animales y sus respectivos  alimentos ya que la demanda  de sus animales esta en aumento es, por ello que ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
María es una madre bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old and is married.  She lives in her own home with her two dependent children.  María lives in an annex called San Antonio de Padua, 7 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  She raises small animals and poultry such as hens, ducks and turkeys in the back part of her house.  When they reach a good size she sells them to the merchants that usually visit the area where she lives.  She also works as a farmer.  She wants to buy more animals and feed as the demand for her animals is increasing.  For this reason she is requesting a loan of 800 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa .

Maria is very committed to her family and is always looking after their well-being and development.  Those that know her are very fond of her and hold her in high esteem.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and feed.

location.town: San Antonio - Muy Finca - Mochumí - Lambayeque

loans.name: Silvia Mercedes

texts.es:
Silvia  es costurera y comerciante, ya que vende ropa y zapatos, desde hace ocho años, anteriormente trabajaba en zona franca, lo que renuncia y decide trabajar en casa,  la costura como la venta de cosmético.
Sus tres hijas la apoyan a vender sus productos, que es por catálogos, muy reconocidos por ser de buena calidad Avon. 
Ha invertido una mayor cantidad de productos a si como también ha logrado la mejora a su vivienda a través de los préstamos que Afodenic ha dado en once ciclos.
Hoy con esta nueva solicitud es para la construcción de un muro perimetral el cual ha ido avanzando del otro lado del terreno y que quiere comenzar con el otro extremo para mejor seguridad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is a Dressmaker and Merchant because she has sold clothes and shoes for eight years.  She used to work in the Tax Free zone but resigned to work at home dressmaking and selling cosmetics.  Her three daughters help her sell the products since it’s via catalogue and they are very well known for being of good quality, Avon.

Through Afodenic loans she has been able to invest in more products as well as do some home repairs.  Today, this new loan request is for the construction of a wall around her property which has advanced along one side but now has to continue from the other side to provide better security to her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials to erect a wall in the back yard.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El señor Joel vive en su terreno ubicado en la urb. La fortaleza de la localidad de el Torno,  es nacido en Cotagaita de potosí, un valle hermoso,  es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja en el torno, hace unos siete meses se dedica a esta labor aunque es nuevo en esta actividad le va muy bien tiene buenos ingresos, el destino del crédito es para comprar una moto nueva para trabajarla y así generarle otros ingresos, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Joel lives in his farm, located in the hamlet of La Fortaleza in the township of El Torno. He was born in Cotagaita de Potosi, a beautiful valley. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver. He works on the wheel. He has done it for about seven months, and although he is new to the business things are going well and he has a good income. 

He will use the loan to buy a new motorbike to use in his business and get more revenue. He is grateful to the organisation for the support received.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina Maria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años esto fue con el propósito de obtener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Ella siempre ha sido una Madre muy abnegada y responsable. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer un buen servicio y además le gusta interactuar con sus clientes, ya que es su medio de vida. El crédito es para la compra de materia necesaria como perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Reina Maria makes a living selling cosmetics. She began this business five years ago with the idea of acquiring a source of income to support her children. She has always been a very selfless and responsible mother. 

She has always been characterized by her good service and she likes to interact with her customers as it is her livelihood. This loan is for the purchase of necessary materials like perfumes, creams, treatments and nail polish among other things

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, treatments and nail polish, among other things.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Lolita has a shop that sells snacks, bread & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibarahima,agé de 55 ans, est marié pére de 5 enfants.Il est photographe et s'active également dans le métier de gardiennage afin de diversifier ses revenus. Il a appris le métier de photoraphe à travers un ami qu'il assistait lors des couvertures de cérémonies familiales et autres. Ainsi, la passion lui domina et décida, il y'a plus de 10 ans, d'acheter son premier appareil pour son propre business.Pour mieux augmenter ses revenus, il souhaitait un prêt de 75 000 FCFA pour acheter un autre appareil photo.
texts.en: Mr. Ibrahima, 55 years of age, is married and the father of five. He is a photographer and also works as a security guard to diversify his income sources. He learned photography from a friend whom he helped with taking photo of family ceremonies etc. And thus he grew passionate about this work and decided, over 10 years, to buy his first camera for his own business. In order to increase his earnings, he would like to receive a loan of 75,000 West African francs to buy a new photo camera.

loans.use: to buy a photo camera

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with two children. Violeta is 22 years old and lives in Palomoc,Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Violeta sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

Violeta has been a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Violeta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a determined and focused 43-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with six children, three of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has been running a cafeteria so as to make a living and meet the needs of her family. She supplements income from this venture with the earnings she makes from selling charcoal and the rent that she collects. Previously, she used to run a retail shop. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have grown her business into a restaurant. Grace's dream is to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, beans, maize flour, maize and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to learn business management skills.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, rice, beans, maize flour, maize and sugar to make food for her cafe

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 37 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos en las edades de 6 a 16 años en el municipio de Malambo a 15 minutos de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio a través del cual, vende artículos de la canasta familiar, de contado y con algunos créditos,  entre los que se cuentan ranchos, víveres, refrescos, enlatados, carnes etc. Su principal clientela son las amas de casa, quienes se acercan a comprar los insumos que requieren para la preparación de sus comidas diarias o de los artículos de aseo para su hogar.  Inició su negocio vendiendo mercancía para apoyar la gestión de su hogar, hace 4 años con un capital que le dio su esposo y con su gran esfuerzo compró estantes y lo ubicó en una habitación de su casa. Gradualmente su negocio fue creciendo y pudo hacerle adecuaciones al local y comprar enfriador, vitrinas e ir renovando su infraestructura,  hoy convertido en una gran tienda. Hace 2 años alquiló su negocio pues se separó de su esposo y fue a vivir donde su madre, pero antes de 8 meses debió retomarlo  pues el arrendatario le dio un mal manejo, así que con su trabajo diario y persistente ha logrado salir adelante y hoy está entusiasmada para hacerlo crecer. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara víveres al por mayor de mayor rotación, para ganar descuentos con la compra de contado y en mayor volumen. Sus inventarios rotan cada 28 días y la rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es inferior al 13,75% indicador desde los cuales auguramos su potencial crecimiento y una inversión exitosa con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maritza is 37 years old and has three children between the ages of 6 and 16. They live in the town of Malambo, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla. Maritza has a business where she sells basic household goods for cash and sometimes on credit. Her inventory includes snacks, provisions, soft drinks, canned goods, meats, and other products. Her main customers are housewives looking to buy ingredients for preparing their daily meals or for cleaning products to use around the home. Maritza started her business four years ago with some capital given to her by her husband. Through hard work, she purchased shelving and established the store in her home.
