Her business grew gradually and she later equipped her store with a cooler and some display cabinets. She also renovated the infrastructure so that now she has a larger store. Two years ago she began renting out her business because she separated from her husband and then went to go live with her mother. Within the last eight months, she has reclaimed her business due to bad management by her tenant. Through her daily work, Maritza has managed to press forward and is excited about being able to grow.

For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy in large quantities those products that have high turnover so that she can obtain discounts for paying with cash and buying in bulk. Her product turnover period is 28 days and she maintains a profitability rate from her sales of no less than 13.75%. These indicators signal an increase in her growth potential and a successful investment from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 35 years old. Lodivina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 250 daily for these activities.

Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks, and spices for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices.

loans.name: Twivane Mubukene B/gr Group

texts.fr:
Espérance  fait partie du groupe Twivane Mubukene B. Le nom du groupe signifie «Luttons contre la pauvreté  ». Elle a 55 ans et elle est mariée avec 6 enfant de 1 à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarisés.

Espérance est agricultrice. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 200kgs des pommes de terre, 10kgs d’engrais, 60l d’eau et paiement main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter la capacité et d’acheter d’autres terrains de champs afin d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Espérance voudrait être parmi les grandes agricultrices dans ce district. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille et payer les frais scolaire des études supérieur de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Espérance is part of the "Twivane Mubukene B" group. The name of the group means "Let´s fight poverty". Espérance is 55 years old, married and has 6 children aged between 1 and 14 years, 4 of whom go to school.

Espérance is a farmer and this is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use the money to buy 200 kgs of potatoes, 10 kilos of fertilizer and 60 litres of water, and to pay the farm labourers. She plans to grow her business by increasing capacity and buying more plots of land in order to increase production. 

Over the next few years, Espérance would like to become one of the district´s biggest farmers. She plans to use her profits to improve her family´s standard of living and pay her children´s higher education expenses.

loans.use: to buy 200 kgs of potatoes, 10 kilos of fertilizer and 60 litres of water, and to pay the farm labourers.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 47 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 10 children. 

To earn a living, Nida has a grocery business selling such things as beverages, canned goods, cigarettes, noodles, etc. She earns about 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

Nida has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase stock for her grocery store. Nida has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Cristhian José

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San André se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a Cristian, el es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 20 años de edad, está soltero, y espera seguir trabajando para en un tiempo poder formar su propia familia.

El se dedica a la venta de pescado, recorre la ciudad en un triciclo de su propiedad  que adquirió con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución. Trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana   desde las 05h00 hasta las 14h00. Él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar el pescado directamente en las playas a los pescadores, lleva dos años en este negocio y le va bastante bien. En los días que tiene libre hace trabajos de albañilería.
 
Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar más pescado para la venta.  Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante creciendo en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San André communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi (Portoviejo) Canton, which is well known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized artisanship. It is famous for its straw hats. This is where Cristhian lives. He is a very hardworking young man, age 20 and single. He hopes to continue working in order to someday be able to start his own family. 

He sells fish, making runs around the city on his own tricycle cart, which he acquired with one of the loans that he took out through the communal bank. He works between three and four days a week from 5:00 am to 2:00 in the afternoon. He goes down to the city of Manta to buy fish straight from the fishermen on the coast. He has been in this business for two years and it's going well enough for him. On his off days, he does masonry work. He will use this loan to buy more fish for sale. This is his fifth loan with Fundación ESPOIR [Kiva field partner], which he appreciates it for the help it provides through its loans. 

His dreams are to keep on growing his business and in his personal life.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
el sr. Carlos Alberto tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado y de su matrimonio solo dependen 3 hijos, Carlos es Caficultor y Agricultor, cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el cultivo de café y agricultura, gracias a este tipo de actividad a logrado mantener a su familia y darle el estudios a sus hijos. Don Carlos utilizara el credito para comprar una planta solar y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia,  él necesita tener energía en su casa para laborar hasta ciertas horas de la noche.
asi mismo proveer entretenimiento a sus hijos ya sea por medio de tv o radio.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is 47 years old, married and with 3 dependent children from their marriage. Carlos is a coffee grower and agriculturist. He has many years of experience in the production of coffee and agriculture. Thanks to his work, he has supported his family and provided an education for his children. Don Carlos will use the loan to buy a solar plant and improve their quality of life. He needs to have electricity in his house to work during the night and to provide his children with entertainment from a TV or radio.

loans.use: to buy a solar plant.

loans.name: Yessah

texts.en: Yessah is 42 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has two children who live own their own. For the past three years, Yessah has been running an entertainment shop. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (beer, soft drinks and soda) for her business. Yessah plans to expand her business and wishes her children to continue the business.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Ablowoa

texts.fr:
Ablowoa est un homme âgé de 51 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a  03 enfants. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 24 ans.  
Ablowoa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2003. Elle vend dans une boutique à la maison après s’être approvisionner à Lomé.
Ablowoa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales. Il veut agrandir son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablowoa voudrait ajouter d’autres activités comme la vente des céréales. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablowoa, age 51, is married to a retiree. She has three children, the oldest is 30 and the youngest is 24.

Since 2003, she's been working as a reseller of grocery products. She gets her supplies in Lomé, and sells in a small shop at her home.

Ablowoa is seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy grocery products. She wants to expand her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to start selling cereals. She says that she intends to use her profits to cover her family's vital needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has four children; three of whom are in school. He owns a food stall which he began this year. There are a high number of customers in the area; mainly port workers, who come to take meals from his stall. Besides this, he is also a teacher.
He learnt of Milango from his friends. Samuel is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase more meat and flour.
His main constraint has been the lack of manpower since he could not employ more people, because the business was still new. He looks forward to converting the business into a hotel and even acquiring more space so he can serve more clients.
Samuel will use the additional income from this loan to pay school fees and also purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and flour.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais apenas 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela.

É negociante ha mais de 10 anos dedica-se a venda de alho em grandes quantidades e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente desta inastituição.Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar alho para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 15.000.00mt.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende mobiliar a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has four children, only one of which still attends school. She completed 6th grade and stoppes for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a niece who lives with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over 10 years. She sells garlic in bulk and earns an income of about 4.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase garlic in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The first loan was for 15.000mt.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to furnish her home and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase garlic for selling.

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr:
Madame Nogoye est une femme âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui confiés par des proche. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et appartient au groupe de Solidarité de Mame Diarra.

Elle développe un petit comme de légume. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 300.000 francs CFA elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en légumes (carottes, choux, oignons etc.) pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Ms. Nogoye is a 63-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. She also has two additional children left in her care by close relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village loan group) since 22 October 2007 and belongs to the solidarity group of Mame Diarra.

She has developed a small business selling vegetables. She has gained lots of experience in this field of business, having practiced it for several years.

With her new loan of 300,000 francs CFA, she is going to increase her supplies of vegetables (carrots, cabbage, onions, etc.) to better satisfy her customers.

Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the family and, at the same time, increase her level of savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Deo Gratias Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DEO GRATIAS est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Vignon Akouavi Blandine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 41 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Vignon Akouavi Blandine est marié a un mécanicien du nom de Victorien. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Vignon Akouavi Blandine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Vignon Akouavi Blandine vend des produits de merceries et des tissus depuis vingt-trois ans. Vignon Akouavi Blandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Vignon Akouavi Blandine ensemble avec les membres du groupe DEO GRATIAS sollicite pour la première  fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de merceries et des tissus .

loans.name: Reina Cleotilde

texts.en:
My name is Reina and everyone knows me for the delicious bread that I make. I have had my bread business for five years, and some people allow me to sell my bread in their pulperias (small restaurant/markets), businesses and pharmacies. I also recycle paper to make craft-paper, that I also sell in stationary stores. The earnings I make help my mother, who is old and needs to be cared for.

Loan Use: Purchase flour, butter, cinnamon, sugar, tins, and other items.

Me llamo Reina y todos me conocen por el delicioso pan que elaboro, tengo cinco años de tener mi negocio de pan y algunas personas me han permitido venderlos en sus pulperias, negocios, farmacias. Tambien trabajo en el reciclaje para hacer papel artesanal que tambien lo vendo a papelerias. Los ingresos que percibo me ayudan con los gastos familiares y poder ayudar a mi madre que es una ancianita y necesita de mis cuidados.

loans.use: Compra de harina, manteca, canela, azucar, sal, moldes y otros.

loans.name: Mehr Afroz

texts.en:
Mehr Afroz is 52 years old and lives in a household of 10 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Mehr Afroz took a 1st cycle loan for her oldest son who has a fuel and gas shop in the market.

Mehr Afroz is an uneducated woman, but she knows tailoring and embroidery well. Because of low family income she took a loan for her son to buy more fuel, gas and wood for his shop. If all goes well, she hopes to take a 2nd cycle loan for herself so she can start a tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy fuel, wood and gas

loans.name: Fofoa

texts.en: Making use of natural resources is an alternative our people turn to when they cannot get jobs to support their families financially. Fofoa chose fishing as her business because it was the means of her survival before she received help from the SPBD program. She is now on her fifth loan of $1400ST. She used the money to buy more fishing gear, build a new bathroom for the family and pay the school fees for her three children, who are all attending high school. She also sold pancakes to earn more money to finance the weekly repayments. Fofoa believes that the program helped her and her family in not only putting her husband’s fishing talent into earning money but also improving their standard and way of living.

loans.use: to pay the childrens’ school fees and purchase more fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Nghip

texts.en: Mrs. Nghip T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband (pictured in Siem Reap province, Cambodia). She is a housewife, while her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and moderately makes around $3 per day in revenue. In order to increase her savings, Nghip T. is currently requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase her husband a motorcycle to transport him to work so that he will no longer need to pay for public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is a 41 year old woman, who is married and has 3 children. She has a dining room in her house, from which she gives food to people who work in the offices and businesses in her area. She started with little savings, and with time it has grown thanks to the support of her husband and the help of credit obtained by the Paraguaya Foundation. Marta is a very dynamic woman, who gets up very early in order to start her day's labor, owing to the numerous breakfast orders she receives from her clients, as well as carrying out her own domestic tasks as a mother. She comments that she is content that with effort and honest work she can give a good education to her children. The loan she requests is in the amount of $200 and she will invest it in the purchase of wine, carbonated water, beer, fruit, delicacies, meat, and eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva volunteer

La señora Marta tiene 41 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee un comedor en su misma casa donde da de comer a personas que trabajan en las oficinas y comercios de la zona. Empezó con unos pocos ahorros y con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias al apoyo de su marido y la ayuda de los créditos obtenidos en la Fundación Paraguaya.Marta, es una señora muy dinámica, ya que se despierta muy temprano para iniciar su jornada laboral, debido a los numerosos pedidos de desayuno que recibe de sus clientes, como así también realizar las tareas doméstica propia de una madre. Comenta que está contenta de que con su esfuerzo y trabajo honesto puede darles una buena educación a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita ahora es de $200 y los invertirá en la compra de vino, gaseosas, cervezas, frutas, golosinas, carne y huevo.

loans.use: To purchase wine, carbonated water, beer, fruit, delicacies, meat, and eggs.

loans.name: Maria De Loudres

texts.en:
Maria de Loudres is 27 years old and has four children. Maria makes and sells pastries to those that live near her home. She is part of a group of women, including Marta Marin Ovando (who sells traditional food) and Maria Hernandez Gomez (who sells clothing). With the loan Maria de Loudres and Marta will buy a stove so that they can produce a larger quantity of products and Maria Henandez will buy clothing of specific cuts in order to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA DE LOURDES, tiene 27 años, 4 hijos, se dedica a hacer y vender pasteles entre las personas que viven cerca de su domicilio.Pertenece al grupo Santiago 2 junto con doña Marta Marín Ovando (vende comida tradicional) y doña maría Hernández Gómez (vende ropa) Con su préstamo doña Maria y doña Marta compraran una estufa para poder hacer mayor cantidad de productos. Y doña Maria comprará ropa de distintas tallas para surtir mejor su negocio,

loans.use: Purchase of stove to increase food production and clothing to better supply customers.

loans.name: Asumini

texts.en:
Asumini is a small entrepreneur who owns a pharmacy shop selling all types of human medicine. She is married to Juma Kiongozi and has four children ages 15, 23, 25 and 27. Asumini is a very hard working woman and really struggles for her family. This is her second loan request from SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 525 to buy a used small refrigerator and improve her stock. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a used refrigerator and improve her stock

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Catalina P. is 48 years old and married to Mr. Lorenzo Macedo who is 49 years old. They have 6 children, three of which are married and live with their respective families. The three younger children live at home. One child is 20 years old and works at a supermarket in a city near the capital. The other two children (12 and 9 years old) are making their way through elementary school.

Mrs. Catalina has had a store for 8 years. It is located in a new neighborhood where it is practically the only business. She would like to invest the loan she is requesting into the purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, flour and herbs. When purchased in big bags these items cost less and thus aid in bringing in more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Catalina P. tiene 48 años y esta casada con el señor Lorenzo Macedo que tiene 49 años. Tienen 6 hijos, 3 de ellos ya están casados y viven con sus respectivas familias, y los 3 menores aún viven con ellos, uno de 20 años que trabaja en un supermercado de una ciudad cercana a la capital y dos niños de 12 y 9 años respectivamente que están cursando sus estudios primarios.

La sra. Catalina tiene su despensa desde hace 8 años y esta ubicada en un barrio nuevo donde prácticamente es el único negocio por lo que desea invertir el préstamo que solicita en la compra de mercaderías como ser arroz, azúcar, harina y yerba por bolsas de esta forma el costo de los mismos es más barato y ayuda a que las ganancias sean mayores.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, flour and herbs

loans.name: Semire

texts.en: Semire E. and her family are cattle raisers in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She has been working in this business for the last eleven years and currently wants to expand her and her family’s business. Semire has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit, proving to be one of our valued and trusted customers. She is looking for funding in the amount of $1,500 so that she can purchase more calves to raise for slaughter and milk production.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise for slaughter and milk production

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is a 44-year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband Vitez. Her husband works in a medical center in Vitez and he earns about 600KM monthly. Almira does sewing, and with this loan 600KM, she wants to buy material to improve her business. She wants to open a sewing shop.

loans.use: Buying material for sewing.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank located in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is a 47-year-old mother of seven and her husband works as a driver.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Trinidad decided to invest in a grocery business and now has a general store. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and then works in the store until 8:00 p.m. With this loan of $375, which she plans to repay within six months, Trinidad will buy goods to sell including rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, soap and eggs.

Trinidad is very happy and proud that, due to hard work and sacrifice, she has been able to build a business that allows her to earn a better income. Her family is proud of her and very thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Km. 6,00 entrando por el radar, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Trinidad con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en un negocio de venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego atiende su bodega hasta las 8pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, aceite, 1 caja de jabón, 2 javas de huevo, etc. Trinidad esta muy feliz y contenta, porque en base a esfuerzo y sacrificio logro establecer su propio negocio, sus ingresos han mejorado, su familia esta orgullosa de ella y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell in a general store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is a widow and has one son who is already an adult. For this reason she started her business to be able put her son through school since her husband passed away five years ago. Since then she and her neighbors have been selling tamales and then started a shop to sell traditional dishes such as chile relleno, menudo, gorditas and others.

She is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, that she will use to buy a griddle to make tacos so that she can sell them in the evening. Let us support Juanita so that she can continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Juanita es viuda, tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad, por el cual inicio su negocio, para sacarlo adelante en sus estudios ya que su esposo falleció hace 5 años, desde entonces inicio vendiendo con sus vecinas tamales, después puso un puesto para vender chiles rellenos, menudo, gorditas, etc.

Solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses y le va a servir para comprar una plancha para elaborar tacos, para empezar a venderlos por las noches. Apoyemos a Juanita para que su negocio siga creciendo.

loans.use: Comprar una plancha

loans.name: Uwi

texts.en: Mrs. Uwi O. is 44 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells a local gin known as Ogogoro, which she has been selling since 2005. She is requsting a loan of $450.00 to buy more Ogogoro to sell.

loans.use: To buy more Ogogoro to sell.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: I. Zuhro is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works as a constructor, while Zuhro has been running her own general store for the past seven years. Starting her own business, she thus tried to ensure sufficient income for her family. This business is one of Zuhro's greatest accomplishments, as she had always dreamed of owning one to not be dependant on anyone else. In her store, Zuhro sells underwear for women, men, and children. She travels to the neighboring town Istaravshan to purchase the goods, and her elder son helps her manage other aspects of the business. While in the beginning Zuhro was selling only a few products, now her store offers a large variety. Currently, she needs to increase the working capital in order to expand her business even further. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 4 months. Zuhro promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she has done with all the previous ones. She thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Development of a clothing sales business

loans.name: Dina Natividad

texts.en:
Dina is a single, sixty-year-old mother of one son. Dina has been an educator and has already retired. She works as personal assistant for the director of a cosmetic line. Dina sells catalog cosmetics to various friends, family and co-workers. Furthermore, Dina makes beautiful sweaters to order for various clients.

Dina is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She has been a member for twelve years. She needs a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in wool and various cosmetics.

Dina’s dream is to improve her business, to have her own home, and to provide the best for her own mother and her son.

loans.use: to invest in wool and various cosmetics

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben E. G. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Ruben Espinosa G.. I am married and I have two children, but they are already older and do not live with us now. My wife and I have planned to make an addition to the front of our home, but it will have to be done little by little since the material is very expensive for us. I am a pensioner and now I am dedicated to doing construction jobs (builder); for this reason I will not have to pay for the manual labor to make the improvements on my home. My wife is the home maker and now we live alone in our home."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es RUBEN ESPINOSA G. soy casado y tengo 2 hijos pero ya son mayores y no viven con nosotros, mi esposa y yo hemos pensado en hacer una ampliación al frente de nuestra vivienda pero esto tendrá que hacer poco a poco ya que el material nos sale muy caro. Yo soy pensionado y ahora me dedico a hacer trabajos de construcción (albañil); así es que no tendré que pagar la mano de obra para hacer la mejora en mi vivienda, mi esposa en ama de casa y ahora vivimos solos en nuestra vivienda.”.

loans.use: Addition to house.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander G. is a businessman from Zaporozhye. He works in the local market called "Yubileynyi" selling toys at affordable prices. Alexander has ben in this business for 7 years. Presently, he has about $2400 in inventory. His income amounts roughly to about $1300.

Alexander is seeking a loan of 5500 Grivnas to increase turnover capital. He is hoping to press on with his expansion plans and ultimately earn enough in savings to open a new vending facility in the future. We believe Alexander's enterprising spirit will help him achieve all his goals and see his dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Arzadi

texts.ru: Эмиралиева Эрзади проживает в районе Джиликуль. Занимается бизнесом. Скупает фрукты у населения и продает на  центральном рынке. Бизнес приносит доход, которого ей хватает только для того , чтобы обеспечить своих двоих детей. Она замужем , но муж нигде не работает, поэтому ей необходимо много работать для того, чтобы улучшить условия жизни. Сейчас она планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев, с целью увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Arzadi A. lives in the Jilikul district. She is involved in a business of fruit sales. She purchases fruit from locals and sells it at the central market. This business brings her just enough income to support her two children. Arzadi is married, however because her husband is unemployed, she has to work more to improve their quality of life. Currently, she plans to obtain a 12-month loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes to make a phone booth to start the sale of rechargeable phone cards.  She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and make a phone booth. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and make a phone booth

loans.name: Marifet

texts.en:
Marifet M. is 25-year-old single man who lives with his parents and takes care of them. Marifet is a hard-working man who was taught farming by his father. 

He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business about three years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and is proud to say that the business has been running well. However, he now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, Marifet is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase four cows for an estimated cost 300 USD each. 

He thanks you very much for the support that you offer him in helping to expand his business and helping him to give his parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Borrower Purevdorj L. is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in the informal housing area in Ulaanbaatar. He has been selling wristwatches and wallets on the "black market" in a place called Harhorin since 2001. 

He has good reputation and long experience in his business. Now his working capital is US$ 640. He has borrowed between US$ 100 and US$ 480 15 times from XacBank and his loan history is good. 

His dream is to own a comfortable house one day. He has been a diligent saver for years, with the result that he now has a savings balance of US$ 2,400, a sum which gets him about halfway to making his dream a reality.

Rather than spend his hard-earned savings on more watches for his business, he’d like to borrow US$ 450 from Kiva lenders. His wife is a conductor on a bus (she collects people's money), but she also helps with her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy wristwatches for re-sale

loans.name: Shamim Rahmat Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is a 56-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Borewala, Pakistan for the past 40 years. She couldn’t get an education because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses. Her husband's name is R. M. and he is a wood seller by profession. He has been selling wood for the past 25 years.

Shamim baji also helps him in his wood-selling work. They divide the work hours between themselves. Shamim baji sells wood in the shop in the morning and her husband sells wood in the evening. Shamim baji is the mother of two sons. Her elder son runs a salon and the other has a mobile phone shop. Shamim baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her wood-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Farzana baji and Shabana baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to re-sell

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
No hace mucho el esposo de Alma ha iniciado un negocio. En la provincia de Chincha, acaba de construir una cancha de gras sintético para alquilarlo a diferentes clientes cuando deseen practicar algún deporte, en especial el futbol. Viendo la oportunidad de instalar un puesto de comida, Alma no dudo en empezar a preparar comida para venderla a aquellas familias o grupos de amigos que iban a usar la cancha.
Hoy ya lleva solo dos meses en este negocio pero tiene muchas expectativas. Más adelante esta planeando construir un pequeño restaurante en el mismo lugar.
Por otro lado, desde hace un año,  también se dedica a la confección de aretes, pulseras y collares. También ha trabajado anteriormente, en una fabrica textil por varios años, al cual renuncio ya que la fábrica se mudo a un distrito lejos de su hogar. No obstante, cuando tiene libre presta sus servicios ya que siempre es bueno contar con un ingreso adicional de dinero.
texts.en:
It has not been too long ago that Alma’s husband started a new business. He just finished building an artificial turf field in the Chincha province that he can rent out to different customers when they want to practice any type of sport, particularly soccer. Seeing the opportunity for a food stand, Alma had no doubt about starting to prepare food and sell it to the families or groups of friends that came to use the field. Currently, she has only been working at this business for two months but she has great expectations for it. Her future plans include building a small restaurant at the same location. On the other hand, for about a year now, she has also dedicated herself to making earrings, bracelets, and necklaces. Previously, she worked at a textile mill for several years, but she had to resign when the factory moved to a distant district that was too far from her home. Regardless, when she has free time, she lends her services since it is always good to have additional sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for embroidery and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Elizabeth Kang’opo from Mbeya. She is married with 5 children, between the ages of 11 and 21. Elizabeth has been running a crop-selling business since 2002. Her business is to purchase crops from farmers on a wholesale basis and sell them in town for a higher price. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Elizabeth currently earns about 90 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase rice, groundnuts, beans and maize in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of crops she buys in order to get more profit. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, groundnuts, beans and maize in bulk

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is the mother of three children and the wife of Benjamin A..  They are both farmers and work hard for the welfare of their family.  Her family lives simply in the village of Barangay San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. Her children are Geraldin, twenty-four years old, a college graduate and presently working in DSWD (Department of Social Welfare and Development), Gerlyn, twenty-one years old, also a college graduate, and the youngest is Harron, 19 years old and a high school student.  Pacita is thankful that through their hard work and patience, they are able to eat three times a day and send their children to school.  She prays that their youngest will also finish his college education.  

Pacita manages a small store beside their house.  She has been in this business for ten years and it really helps her family a lot.  She wants her business to become more progressive and with this, she would like to take out a loan of $75 that she needs to purchase different grocery items for her store.  Her goal is to expand her business so she can generate more income, because her income of $7.50 a week is not enough to meet the needs of her family.  Pacita is hoping that her loan will be granted for the development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase different commodities

loans.name: Bagam Nash Group

texts.en:
Bagam Nash is the group leader. There are three members in this group. They all want to better their businesses.

Bagam Nash wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. Bagam Nash's husband wants to expand his business and to attract more clients. Amanullah wants to take a loan for a new machine for his car. Shbnam wants to take a loan for a new machine for her tailoring business. They are thankful for AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: To expand a general store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 27-year-old single man living in Shwaifat, Mount Lebanon. For eight years he has owned a metA. shop which services the surrounding villages. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new toolkit for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new toolkit for his business.

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Muhammad Tariq Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen baji is the leader of a group of three women, all residents of Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a leather-selling business, a very profitable enterprise because most people in Kasur wear “Khussa,” a kind of leather footwear. Kosar baji and her members also run their own businesses selling kites which are very popular with children, thereby enabling them to pay for utilities. Kosar baji is now applying for a loan to buy leather to increase the profit of her husband’s leather-selling business, while Rasheeda baji and Sugran baji and Ailas baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Beatrice S. from Mwanza. Beatrice has been running a shop selling soaps, maize flour and sugar since 1998. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Beatrice is married with one child, age one years old. In addition, she is responsible for supporting one dependant whose parents do not take care of him.

Beatrice currently earns about $160 US from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 US in order to purchase rice, beans and maize flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Beatrice thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Silvia Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios superiores (Docente de Ciencias Sociales),  vive en el Barrio Pedro Vilcapaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró abarrotes.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/.  1300.00 nuevos soles. Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, y también combustible.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares. A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 51, in a common law marriage, and has a son. She has a college degree (Social Studies teacher). She lives in the Pedro Vilcapaza neighborhood. She works with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. With her first loan for 300 PEN, she bought groceries. She is now asking for a loan for 1,300 PEN to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and fuel. Her wish is to keep working to pay the family expenses. She likes the way the Movimiento Manuela Ramos works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and fuel

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Cecilia es casada  tiene 47 años tiene  cinco hijos de 28- 22, 20, 18 y 14 años  este ultimo esta estudiando en  la escuela estatal. 
Cecilia  es de Huancavelica llego a Lima, se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos, pero vio la necesidad económica en su casa y  se puso a trabajar en la cachina, ella junta por las noches  botellas,  fieros, reciclaje y los vende en la cachina, también se  dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que Cecilia esta en Finca aprendió a ahorrar y valorar el dinero.
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la  compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
El sueño de Cecilia es tener un puesto para venta  de  fruta.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Cecilia is 47, married and has five children; 28, 22, 20, 18, and 14. The last one attends the state school. Cecilia is from Huancavelica. She came to Lima and spent her time taking care of her children. But, she saw the economic need in her house, and she went to work at the “cachina” (used goods market). In the evenings she gathers bottles, metal, and recyclables. She sells them at the cachina. She also sells beauty products by catalog. Since Cecilia has been with Finca, she has learned to save and value money. Cecilia needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog. Cecilia’s dream is to have a fruit selling stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products by catalog

loans.name: Francisco Rogelio

texts.es:
el sr. francisco H. tiene 41 años de edad, el tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos y accesorios para carro, el anda su producto en su carro pick-up y se pone frente a una pollera en un bulevar muy transitado en la ciudad capital, este punto es muy estrategico ya que por ahi pasan  muchos carros todos los dias. antes el vendia en el parque el obelisco.
el vende forros para timon, gatas, llaves, halogenas, radios, parabrisas, antenas, tapa sol, copas para rines etc.
el tiene 4 hijos de los cuales a logrado darles alimentacion y estudio, con ellos tambien vive su madre la cual es una persona de la tercera edad a quien tambien el provee los medicamentos y alimentos, ella es una persona que pasa enferma.
el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio. comprar al por mayor que asi es como se obtienen mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco H. is a 41-year-old man who sells car accessories and spare parts. He sells his products out of his Pick-up truck in front of a chicken restaurant on a bustling boulevard in the capital city. This is a very strategic location because many cars pass by every day. He used to sell his products at the El Obelisco Park.

He sells steering wheel covers, jacks, keys, halogen lamps, car stereos, windshields, windshield covers, antennas, hubcaps, etc.

He has 4 children, to whom he has managed to provide sustenance and an education. His elderly mother lives with them, and he must also provide her with food and medication, as she is sick quite often.

He needs this loan in order to purchase more products wholesale because that is how one can obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car accessories and spare parts

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut P., age 50, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer, earning approximately $1.5 USD per day. Her husband is a local primary school teacher, earning an income of $5 USD per day, which is the family's primary source of income. The family is also assisted by two of the children who have a sewing business that generates an income of $3 USD each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, including P.. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase items for her children's sewing business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to reach a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase items for sewing business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela, a member of the United Friends village bank, is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her youngest child studies at the public school while the older ones are already working. 

Manuela has a convenience store at home where she sells sodas, beer and sweets. Her house is alongside various mechanics' workshops that buy drinks at her store. Additionally, her neighbors place orders for lunch specials. Manuela is requesting a loan of 1600 soles to buy more sodas and beers. Her dream is to continue growing her convenience store. 

Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97757&_tpos=f&_tpg=h

loans.use: To buy sodas and beers

loans.name: El Oriente Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Oriente tiene dos años de trabajar con adim y está conformado por cuatro mujeres excepcionales, trabajadoras y con deseos de superación estas son Rosa Virginia F., Elivee T. M., Ana Paulina P. y Ángela Dominga S. L.. Estas son provenientes de la comarca Guanacastillo zona rural de Masaya.

La coordinadora del Grupo es Rosa Virginia F. de 60 años de edad. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio donde fabrica y vende  sartenes, moldes de reposterías y tablas desde hace doce años, actualmente con la ayuda de adim y la cooperación de su esposo y nieto el negocio ha ido prosperando, es conocido en varios puntos del país. 

F. desea que su negocio crezca para ello invertirá su préstamo en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de  sartenes como lata, remache, alambre, tabla entre otros.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elivee T. M. de 28 años quien vende perfumes de la marca Avon que es muy reconocida en Nicaragua, Ana Paulina P. de 45 años de edad que vende perfumes de la marca Zermat y Ángela Dominga S. L. tiene un negocio muy diverso ella vende cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, chiverías, hielo y frescos.

Todas ellas desean poder seguir trabajando en sus negocios e invertir en la compara de materia prima para ellos.
texts.en:
The “Oriente” (Eastern) Group has been working with ADIM for four years and consists of four exceptional members. These hardworking and determined women are Rosa Virginia F., Elivee T. M., Ana Paulina P., and Ángela Dominga S. L.. They are from the rural district of Guanacastillo which in Masaya.

Rosa Virginia F. is 60 years old and the group coordinator. For 12 years, she has operated a small business where she manufactures and sells frying pans, pastry molds, and chopping boards. She currently has the support of ADIM and the assistance of her husband and grandson. Her business is thriving and well-known in different parts of the country.

Sra. Rosa wants to grow her business and will use her loan to purchase materials used in making frying pans such as tin, rivets, wire, metal sheets, etc.

There are three other members of the group. Elivee T. M. is 28 years old and sells perfumes made by Avon that are recognized in Nicaragua. Ana Paulina P. is 45 years old and sells perfumes made by Zermat. Ángela Dominga S. L. has a diversified business selling cosmetics, perfumes, crèmes, snacks, ice, and soft drinks.

They all want to continue working at their businesses and invest in more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making frying pans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter un terrain pour le champ et faire la pépinière du piment

loans.name: Sèdé

texts.fr: A. Sèdé est née en 1961 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Sèdé est mariée à MELONOU Jean, un cuisinier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés mais non plus à sa charge. La famille vit à Fifatin à Cotonou. C'est les divers (boîtes de conserve, pâtes alimentaires, bicarbonate, éponge en fer, bougies, etc.)que Sèdé vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Sèdé achète ses produits à Gbogbanou, marché de vente en gros des produits importés. Sèdé a déjà eu un crédit de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé. Sèdé sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Sèdé was born in 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to MELONOU Jean, who is a cook. The couple has four children who are all schooled but no longer dependents of theirs. The family lives in Fifatin in Cotonou. Sèdé sells a variety of goods (canned food, pasta, bicarbonate, metal scrubbers, candles, etc.) at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She purchases her goods in Gbogbanou, a market selling imported goods in bulk. She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. She’s requesting this second loan for bolstering her working capital in order to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (canned food, pasta, toilet paper, etc.)

loans.name: Candida Norberta

texts.es: Candida Norberta tiene 68 años, esta señora ha sido una mujer muy ejemplar para sus hijos ya que les ha enseñado a trabajar de una manera muy humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que al inicio ella recorría las calles para ofrecer sus productos y por medio de sus amistades logro obtener más clientes, pero con los años se le ha hecho muy difícil seguir recorriendo los lugares que visitaba, pero aun así algunos de sus clientes la visitan en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de ropa, calzado, artículos, perfumes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Candida Norberto is 68. She has been an exemplary woman for her children. She has taught them to work in a very humble manner. She sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over ten years. When she started she traveled the streets to offer her products. Through her friendships she was able to get more customers. But, the years have made it very difficult for her to keep traveling to the places that she used to visit. Even so, some of her customers visit her in her house. The loan she is asking for is to buy clothes, footwear, and perfumes among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба Давлатова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 41 год. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в месной школе учителем. Сама Махбуба более 7 лет занимается бизнесом. Она имеет троговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahbuba D. lives in the city of Kulob. She's forty-one years old, married and has four children. Her husband works as a teacher in a local school. Mahbuba has been in business for more than seven years, selling clothes on the market, where she has her own shop. She is asking for a loan to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new supplies

loans.name: Pine

texts.en:
Pine is 56 and married with 6 children (ages 22-37).  She owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Pine needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in renovating the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2007, Pine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pine's 4th loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Meleane

texts.en:
Meleane S. is 39 and married with 5 children (ages 4 - 16).  She owns a business venture, cultivating fruit trees & harvesting its fruit for sale.  Meleane has 4 years of experience in this business.  Meleane needs a loan of WST $2750 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Meleane joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Meleane's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Meleane S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng S. is a vendor whose main activity is to sell cooking ingredients. She started in the grocery business in the beginning of 2000. She has a partner in her husband, who helps feed the family by working in construction. This couple is married and has been blessed with four children. One of the children is married and lives separately and others attend school. To help the family, one grown daughter works in a garment factory. Because mature rice has a low price this season, Leng S. wants a loan to use as capital, which will enable her to order rice in bulk to resell for additional income.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad is a 45-year-old married man with four children, two of whom are unemployed. He has owned a coffee shop since 2008 and has been involved in this type of work for the past 20 years. He offers all types of tea, coffee and Lebanese tobacco to his customers. Today, Fouad is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to renovate and decorate his shop in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To renovate and decorate his coffee shop

loans.name: Aidee Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aidée del Socorro Hernández A., tiene 43 años de edad,  vive con sus 5 hijos en edades entre  10 y  21 años  en el Barrio Chapacua de Cartagena,  reconocido por la belleza de sus reinas muy representativo en las fiestas del 11 de Noviembre.  Su negocio es una miscelánea-variedades, que  inició informalmente con la  venta de mercancía a través de guías especializadas de productos empresariales;  hace mas  de cinco años,  cuando conoció a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo e hizo su primer crédito,   compro su primera vitrina para hacer una mejor exhibición de sus artículos; gradualmente fue creciendo e ideó la forma de ofrecer servicios fotocopiados muy solicitados en su comunidad, por eso  con su segundo crédito compró una fotocopiadora, que adicionó a su negocio  y con su utilidad fue pagando el crédito. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $ 1.500.000, el cual invertirá en  la compra de mercancía variada, especialmente productos de belleza, articulos escolares y papelería en general.

Con su actividad independiente y  los créditos recibidos, ha aumentado su capital de trabajo y así mismo el nivel de vida   de su familia; ella ha podido educar a sus cinco hijos y tiene como meta  que todos sean profesionales  y respecto a su negocio quiere seguir progresando adquirir más exhibidores y hacer arreglos locativos.

Aidee considera que no ha tenido problemas significativos, todos los ha resuelto en su momento, pero muchas veces no tiene el efectivo disponible para comprar mercancía  de oportunidad que le hace falta  y  retarda su compra.
texts.en:
Aidée del Socorro Hernández A. is 43 years of age. She lives with her 5 children, ages between 10 and 21 years in the Chapacua de Cartagena neighborhood, known for the very representative beauty of its queens in the festivals of November 11. Her business is the sale of miscellaneous products, that she started informally with the sale of merchandise through catalogs of specialized products. She has run this business for more than five years. When she learned of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and received her first loan, she bought her first showcase in order to better exhibit her articles. Gradually she has grown her business and thought to offer photocopy services in her community. Therefore with the second loan she bought a photocopier, that has added to her business and with its use she has repaid the loan. Currently she is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 pesos (about $800 US), which she will invest in the purchase of various merchandise, especially beauty products, school supplies and paper in general. With her independent activity and the loans received, she has enlarged her working capital and thus improved the standard of living of her family. She has been able to educate her five children and she has a goal that they all become professionals. With respect to her business she wants to continue progressing to acquire more showcases and to make product displays. Aidee considers that she has not had any significant problems. They have all been resolved as they surfaced, but many times she does not have the available cash to buy merchandise which is on promotion that she lacks and her purchase is delayed.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise for resale such as beauty products, school supplies and paper

loans.name: Elizabeth Hurun

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 57-year-old lady who resides in Kisumu Ndogo, Malindi and is married to Hurun with whom she has three children: James and M..

Elizabeth sells charcoal to residents and hotels within Malindi town and this she has been doing for the last twenty-four years. She normally earns a monthly profit of Ksh 12,000.

Elizabeth was introduced to KADET by an existing client and she has applied for a loan which she will use to add charcoal stock and also to repair her store. She plans to purchase a tuk tuk (a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer) with the extra income she will earn from this loan.

A hardworking woman, Elizabeth dreams of owning a big house.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur REVIEW  Elizabeth Hurun from  Kenya

loans.use: To repair her store with Ksh 25,000 and to buy sacks of charcoal with Ksh 50,000

loans.name: Ameenullah

texts.en: Ameenullah, son of M. G., an educated and married man, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. With plenty of land available for cultivation, this hard-working man is requesting a loan to complete his stock, buy more seeds and prepare his land for cultivation. Ameenullah is striving for success as a farmer to support his family and help build a better future for his children. He would like to thank everybody supporting him. He hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Serves Joint Stock Company) in the coming years.

loans.use: To buy seeds and prepare his land

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en: Hermocilla B. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Hermocilla owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies which she peddles every early afternoon in the local community and in the neighboring villages. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Hermocilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Hermocilla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kagaramira Abamwe, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
M. Sam is very ambitious and determined in regard to the way he handles his business. He owns a thriving supermarket that deals in the sale of both foodstuffs and household items in Kagaramira, Ibanda town.

At the age of 34 years, Sam has, by contemporary Ugandan standards, earned the credentials of being called successful. With his five-year-old business he has, to a great degree, improved on his family’s welfare standing. His four children are all attending school and his wife is also involved in his business. He asserts that he makes 220,000 shillings every month.

With the loan, Sam plans to purchase more produce for his supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more produce for his supermarket

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina R. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Rosalina is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Remia

texts.en: Remia B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 54 years old. Remia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Remia operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish and shrimp in the local community. Remia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Remia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Remia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Remia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy N. is from Barangay Upper Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Joy owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells a raised pig. In 2010, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Baye Ndaraw

texts.fr: Monsieur Baye Ndaraw B. est un jeune artiste peintre de 33 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene.  Il est membre de la caisse depuis novembre 2006 et n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt dans l’institution. Monsieur B. est en même  temps décorateur  de faux plafond. Il pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Il sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs pour l’investir dans son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses gains financiers et de mieux subvenir a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mr. Baye Ndaraw B. is a young painter, 33, who lives in the Camberene area of Dakar. He has been a member of the U-IMCEC since November 2006 and has never received a loan from the institution. Mr. Baye is also a dropped ceiling designer. He has been doing this for more than ten years. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to invest in his business. This financing will allow him to increase his financial gains and better meet his personal needs.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Kigarama Kwetungura, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
As they say, determination is a key to success. B. Benon, a happily married father of six children, ventured into tea growing in Kigarama, Kihihi, twenty years ago. After realizing a readily available market in the area with a tea factory, he developed interest in growing and selling tea leaves alongside his farming business. This enterprise sees him earning about $41 a month which has had a great impact on his standard of living. 

His main problem is that his land is infertile and produces low yields. With this loan he is looking at buying fertilizer and manure as well as further expanding his tea plantation by buying more seedlings and planting on a large scale. This will improve his yields and his sales and enable him to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase tea seedlings and fertilizers for plantation expansion.

loans.name: Prosperity Group

texts.en:
Oretha S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Prosperity”. She is 32 years old, is married and has three children who range from 5 to 15 years old. Oretha was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support.

For six years, Oretha has been selling palm oil, rice, onions, tomatoes and beans in Chicken Soup Factory Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

Oretha plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more gallons of palm oil, rice, onions, salt and beans. She describes herself as a devoted woman. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

in the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil, rice, onions, salt and beans to sell

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov H. (in the photo) is 24 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vichet Chhe, is 28 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have just one young son. They are living in a small village across the Mekong River and approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreypov has been a silk weaver for six years, while her husband has been a construction worker for five years. She is asking for her first loan, in the amount of $700. She will use $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. And she will use the other $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to buy a motorcycle for her husband to get work

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old. Julieta is married and has one child. Julieta is involved in the farming and hog-raising business. She helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Julieta says she does all these activities because she wants to provide for her family. She also wants her child to have a bright future.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional piglet and feeds

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Toan T. N., a 48-year-old mother of three children who are attending high school, owns a shop that sells construction materials such as cement, iron, and bricks. Her shop, from which she earns 4,000,000 VND monthly, is especially busy during the construction season of August through October.  Since joining our credit program in early 2010, Toan has proven to be a very responsible client. She is now requesting a loan of 5,450,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To invest in her shop.

loans.name: Jennypher Carolina

texts.es: Jennypher es de 21 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones y dos  mujeres, es estudiante, actualmente se dedica ala elaboración de bolsones (mochilas),  en la actividad tiene 5 años de experiencia, solicita un credito para ampliación de capital, ya que necesita producir mas port la razon de que su negocio tiene demanda de clientes, sus antecedentes indican que es un persona responsablelos y lo creditos que ha tenido en esta institución los ha cancelado sin problema de atraso, la inversion que hace es rentable y la solicitante posee la capacidad para realizar los pagos mensuales, con lo que espera mejorar su ingresos y su condición de vida.
