texts.en: Jennypher Carolina R. Gonzales is 21 years old, married, and has two sons and two daughters.  She is a student, but she also manufactures backpacks and has five years of experience.  Jennypher is requesting her fourth loan to increase her capital and views this opportunity as a profitable investment.  She has the capacity to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: Ampliacion de capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna L. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. Lorna is separated from her spouse and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting, trading and selling bananas, cassava and copra (dried coconut meat) in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to rent land to raise additional crops. This loan will be the third taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Tejan

texts.en: This is 50 year-old Tejan.  He is married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 7.  In 2000, Tejan established his used clothing business in order to become self-reliant.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,922,800 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more used trousers, t-shirts and blouses.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 288,420.  In the future, Tejan plans to have a shop instead of just a table and he also hopes to be one of the most popular suppliers in town.  He currently reinvests his profits back into his business for growth, Tejan plans to educate his children to university level.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.fr:
Femme tres entreprenante , vient de finir son premier  pret avec excellence,elle avait achete des cartons de vivres frais comme le poulet de chair ,les ailes de dinde, ailes de poulet, croupions de dinde; les cotes de porcs.
les ventes journalieres ont augmente de beaucoup 100.000frs a 250.000frs par jour et elle a beaucoup epargne, pour essayer d'aller vers l'avant.

Avec le nouveau pret, elle pense renforcer son capital en achetant les memes stocks de produits pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
Elle va continuer avec Hope pour atteindre son objectif celui d'etre une femme d'affaire reputee.
texts.en:
Dorothe has a strong entrepreneurial spirit and has just finished her first loan with excellent results. She had bought crates of  fresh food like whole chickens. turkey wings, chicken wings, turkey pieces, and sides of pork. Her daily sales went up sharply, from 100,000 francs to 250,000 francs per day and she was able to save a lot of money in order to plan for the future. 

With the new loan, she will increase her capital by purchasing the same types of products to meet her customers' needs. She will stay with Hope in order to meet her goal - to be a business woman with a  strong reputation.

loans.use: To buy boxes of whole chickens, chicken thighs, fish.

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat lives with her family in a small city called Vehari in Pakistan. She lives there in a small home of 3 rooms in the area named Jhedo. 
She has given birth to 2 daughters and 2 sons. All of them are attending school and getting their education. Asmat wants them to finish their education and that’s why she works very hard. She sews clothes for her local clients on order. She is good at her work and receives many orders every month. The money she earns helps her to pay her children’s school fees and the utilities expenses. 
She is married to M. Y. who is involved in an animal selling business. He buys young animals from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises them and sells them to customers. 
Asmat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young animals (goats & cows) and sell them for good profits. He has been doing this business for the past 25 years and has good experience in his field. 
Asmat is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and as a result her family will enjoy more financial benefits. 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy young goats and cows to raise and sell.

loans.name: Silvia Emerita

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia O. es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de Ucubamba en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza que encierra a sus alrededores, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y de un corazón calido.

Doña Silvia tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 15 y 12 años de edad y todos s estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como operador de maquinaria pesada, no tienen casa propia lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Silvia realiza  manualidades y por el momento esta haciendo adornos navideños, también realiza todo tipo de costuras actividades que aprendido por habilidad, lleva 6 meses en esta actividad. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo como es de la marca Esika y a esta labor se dedica hace 8 meses.

Es el quinto crédito que realiza y lo va a invertir para la compra de una maquina de coser. Su meta es tener un negocio propio donde venda sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia O. is a member of the Génesis (Genesis) communal bank in Cuenca’s Ucubamba sector.  This city is renowned for the beauty that surrounds it.  Its historic city center was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its people are very gracious and warmhearted.


Silvia is 37 years old, married and has three children who are 16, 15 and 12 years of age.  They all go to a local school.  Her husband is a heavy machine operator.  They do not own a house; they rent.

Silvia makes crafts and is currently making Christmas decorations.  She also does all kinds of sewing, a skill she learned on her own.  She has been in this occupation for 6 months.  In her free time she sells catalogue cosmetics of the Esika brand.  She’s been doing this for the last 8 months.

This is her fifth loan and she will use it to buy a sewing machine.  Her goal is to have a business of her own where she sells her crafts.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca F. de Maldonado de 69 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y sacrificada que se dedica a la actividad de venta de mercaderías para la despensa tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, carbón entre otros hace más de 20 años. 
La misma nos comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha por los resultados del préstamo  otorgado por la Institución, y que día a día se siente más comprometida con la Fundación Paraguaya, por el apoyo que le brindan, y nos comentó que seguirá trabajando con responsabilidad  y la vez abonando al día para poder obtener otros créditos y así devolver la confianza que se le volvió a dar hacia su persona.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de verduras, lácteos, enlatados, embutidos, azúcar, y otros.
texts.en:
Francisca F. de Maldonado, 69 years old, is a very responsible and sacrificing woman who has been selling groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, charcoal, etc., for more than 20 years.

She tells us that she is very satisfied with the loan authorized by our organization, and that day by day she feels more committed to Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya because of the support they've given her. She also told us that she continues to work responsibly and make her payments so she can get other loans and so live up to the trust that was given her.

She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, dairy products, canned goods, lunch meats, sugar, etc.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, dairy products, canned goods, lunch meats, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng N. is the leader of this four-member group; all the borrowers live in the province of Siem Reap.  N., 44, is currently a massage employee in a small club and earns a proper salary to contribute to her family’s well-being.  She is married to Saiy, 47, who is a temporary laborer.  

Heng N. is the mother of five children, all of whom are single.  One of her sons works driving a taxi.  Heng N. has an older house that often has problems and she hopes to repair it by using this loan from Kiva.

The other three members are: 

S., 59, who sells firewood to earn a living. She needs a loan to repair her broken motorcycle.
N., 56, who makes and sells various cakes and she is asking for a loan to help her business grow.
L., 64, who is a porter in the busy local market. She requests a loan to buy the a motor bike for traveling to work.

loans.use: To repair her older house.

loans.name: Eira Mercedes

texts.es:
LA SRA. EIRA MERCEDES S. A. ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA, CASADA SIN HIJOS, QUIEN TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMO GASEOSA, JUGOS SKIMOS Y PARAMALAT A DEMAS DE LA AGUA PURIFICADA, ELLA TRABAJA CON UNA HERMANA LA QUE ELLA EMPLEA PARA QUE LE AYUDE ADESPACHAR EN LA VENTA. HA TRABAJADO CON CEPRODEL NUEVE PRESTAMOS LOS CUALES HA SIDO PARA SU NEGOCIO, A HORA ELLA NUEVAMENTE A CUDE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE SKIMO, PARMALAT, GASEOSAS Y AGUA PURIFICADA PARA SU NEGOCIO.
ELLA TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADOS DE SIETE  DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS CINCO DE LA TARDE EN EL MERCADO ISRAEL LEWITE.
ELLA AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR LOS PRESTAMOS OTORGADOS YA QUE GRACIAS A ESTOS HA PODIDO SACR A DELANTE SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en: Mrs. Eira Mercedes S. A. is an entrepreneurial person, married, with no children, who has a business selling products such as sodas, Skimo and Parmalat beverages, and purified water.  She works with a sister, who she employs to help her sell her merchandise.  She has been working with Ceprodel for nine loans for her business.  Now, she once again turns to Ceprodel to request a new loan to purchase Skimo and Parmalat products, sodas and purified water for her business.  She works Mondays to Saturdays from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon at the Israel Lewite Market.  She thanks Ceprodel for the loans granted since, thanks to this credit, she has managed to get her business ahead.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, Skimo and Parmalat beverages, and water.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sorin Van, have been married since 1996 and have two sons and two daughters. The children are all in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phally and his wife produce rice wine and raise pigs at home. Mrs. Sorin Van is a silk weaver as well. The couple requests a loan of $1,000 to continue their businesses.

loans.use: To produce rice wine and raising pigs.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan tiene 70 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el en el distrito la Matanza ubicado en la Provincia de Morrropon que pertenece a la región Piura, que se ubica a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo capital de la Región de la Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, el suele sembrar maíz amarillo en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, luego de la cosecha lo vende a buen precio. Esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, cuenta con clientela establecida.

Juan desea realizar  cambios en su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
70-year old Juan is married and lives with his family in Matanza district in the province of Morropon, part of the region of Piura. Matanza is more than four hours away from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Juan has earned his living in agriculture for many years. Usually he grows yellow corn in his small plot of land, then harvests it and sells it for a good price. He’s been growing corn for five years and has regular customers for his produce.

He now wishes to make some alterations to his house and improve his standard of living. For this reason he is seeking a loan of 1500 soles from Kiva partner, Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia M. is a trader working at Abee near the fishing town of Elmina.  She is married to a taxi driver and has one child.  Portia sells drinks and powder as well as hand bags and kitchen utensils.  She has been doing this job for 6 years now. 

Portia uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Her plan is to expand her business.  Therefore she would like to purchase more bags and utensils for sale.  Portia hopes to increase her profits to reinvest into her business, but to also take care of her children so they can enjoy a good education.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and utensils for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein, in Rift Valley Kenya. He has been practicing farming for the last fifteen years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to Kabianga dairies in his town. He also earns income from his small-scale tea farm, because he sells his produce to Finlay factory in the same town.

Joseph is 55 years old and married, with 6 children between 3 and 24 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested for a loan of 45,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from his milk sales will enable him to pay school fees for his children. He says that the lack of enough land and poor artificial insemination services have been his major challenges. He plans to improve his dairy farming in future by building a modern dairy unit and planting more grass for the animals eat.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Geronedes

texts.en:
Geronedes C. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Geronedes is married. 

To make a living, Geronedes buys and sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (coconut meat used for making oil). Geronedes has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Geronedes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Geronedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Geronedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. This will be the second loan taken out by Geronedes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en:
Batkhuu is 42-year-old widow who lives with her son and daughter, ages 23 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small house in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian tent) district. Batkhuu’s son is a web designer and her daughter works as a teacher at a local public school. Batkhuu supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

When she first began her business in 2003, Batkhuu had 800,000 MNT in working capital. Today, her business has grown and she has about 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. Batkhuu sells jeans and trousers. She says “I want to grow my business with this loan and I would like to be able to buy my own apartment in future.” Batkhuu is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase the variety of jeans and trousers she sells.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and trousers to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan  es un joven que se dedica a al elaboración de balones anteriormente él trabajaba para su tía en la fabrica de balones pero ahora es independiente y hace sus propios balones, el cliente es bastante trabajador y conoce bastante de su área, gracias a su trabajo el puede ayudar a su familia que vive en La Paz, el actualmente tiene bastante mercado y también viaja a provincias para comerciar sus productos, comenta que a un mediano plazo piensa retornar a su tierra natal La Paz para estar al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos.  Él vive en alquiler en un cuarto en la casa de su tía, con el dinero del crédito comprar balones por cantidad para poder comercializar, es una persona muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who manufactures balls.  He used to work for his aunt in the ball factory but now he’s independent and he makes his own balls.  He is quite hard working and knowledgeable in his area.  Thanks to his work he’s able to help out his family that lives in La Paz.  He currently has quite a few customers and also travels to the provinces to sell his products.  He comments that in the medium run he plans to return to his native city, La Paz, to be with his parents and siblings.

He lives in a room he rents from his aunt.  He will use the loan to buy balls in quantity to sell.  He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy footballs and fulbito (typical Peruvian variation of football) balls.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 29-year-old working woman who is married to Sami. Sami appears in the picture instead of her, as she is a conservative woman. Iman and Sami have two daughters (Safya and Wala) and three sons (Ahmad, Ibrahem and Wafa).  Iman needs electric  appliances for her kitchen like an oven and a refrigerator, so she took out the loan from FATEN.

loans.use: to pay for electric appliances

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 59 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adoracion has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

Adoracion has been raising pigs for 11 years.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul is the treasurer of this group.  She is 38 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she brings up two sons and a daughter. The sons are in school and the daughter is not yet, she is preschool age (under seven).  

Three years ago with an initial investment of 33,000 SOMS, Baktygul started to sell fruits and vegetables in the market.  In this way she earns 4,000 SOMS per month.  With money received from the loan Baktygul wants to purchase more vegetables for further resale.  In the future with money gained from the trade Baktygul wants to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Angela Azuncion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 43 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años de edad y todos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.  Para ella este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende  ropa de todo tipo, tiene un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual  cinco días a la semana se dedica a vender sus productos, nos cuenta que instala su negocio desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 que levanta sus productos y se va a su casa a realizar las tareas del hogar, nos cuenta que es sacrificado su labor pero tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. Lleva más de diez años realizando esta labor. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es  tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo Community Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the town of Portoviejo. It’s well known as a business hub, as well as for its traditional festivals and its fun-loving people.

43-year old Sra. Angela lives here. She is married and has three children aged 17, 15, and 13. They all attend high school. Her husband is a businessman. This is Angela’s third loan with the Community Bank which she enjoys because of the benefits that are offered.

As well as being a fine housewife, Angela sells all kinds of clothing from a small stall in the centre of town. She works there five days a week from 8am to 6pm when she packs up the merchandise and returns home to do the household chores. She says it’s a hard life but she has to do it for the sake of her family. She’s been doing this work for more than ten years and goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise.

Angela will use the loan money to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing

loans.name: Sampang

texts.en: Sampang, 27 years old, is a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) driver. His wife sells food and their combined income is $10 per day. They have a 1-year-old child. Every month, Sampang spends $50 on food, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike to replace his current one because it is old and needs a lot of fixing. He plans to use the rest of the money to buy wood to repair his house. When he has enough money in the future, Sampang wants to get a small place for his wife to sell food.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sa-Ben Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sa-Ben” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each member in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom are attending primary schools. Isatu sells cotton cloths, vests, shirts, and portmanteaus.  She has been running this business for five years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business through buying cotton cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes and portmanteaux in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cotton cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes and portmanteaux in large quantities

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira, 39, is the leader of this group. Together with her husband, who works in a brick producing plant, she brings up three young kids. Currently she works in a field, for which she is paid 1,500 soms per workday. Zamira also owns a small piece of land, 2.8 hectares of her own, where she planted clover. She’s been cultivating the land, planting various agricultural products every season. The land was bought twelve years ago for 10,000 soms. 

Now Zamira is happy to earn 15,000 soms per month. The purpose of Zamira’s loan is to purchase tools and fuel necessary for field work. She is confident in her group mates, who are responsible and motivated entrepreneurs, and who can repay the loan on time with no violations. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and tools which are needed for field work.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 29 years old.  He is married, and a father of four children. Arnold runs a stationery shop in Mariakani.  His business has been in operation for the last three years and it has been a success. 

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, Arnold plans to expand his business by adding more stock of stationery. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to open another business.

loans.use: adding more stock of stationery

loans.name: Nemis

texts.es: Nemis, de 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja y es madre de seis hijos. Juntos en su casa propia que pudieron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Nemis, consiste en la venta de comida, entre los platos que ella prepara están los anticuchos, juanes, patarasca, tacacho y otros mas. Este trabajo lo hace en casa de su mamá, antes ella vendía en el mercado pero tenía pocas ventas, ahora venderá en un pequeño espacio que le cedió su mamá, al cual acondiciono para realizar su negocio. Le gusta su trabajo, pues siempre le gusto mucho cocinar y es feliz al ganar dinero. Espera más adelante consolidar su negocio ya que recién empieza. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene y espera contar con el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará cecina, tacacho, y demás ingredientes para su trabajo.
texts.en: Nemis, 36, is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives with her partner and is mother to six children. They live together in their own home which they were able to buy after a lot of effort. Nemis' work consists of selling food. Among the dishes that she makes are anticuchos (kebabs), juanes, patarasca, tacacho and more. She does this work in her mother's house. Before, she sold in the market but she had few sales. Now she will sell in a small space that her mother gave her which she refurbished to start her business. She likes her work since she's always enjoyed cooking and is happy to earn money. She hopes in the future to strengthen her business that she recently started. This is the first loan she's taken and she hopes to count on the help of each one of you. With the amount requested she will buy meat and tacacho and other ingredients for her work.

loans.use: to purchase food and meat for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 28 years old. Aida is married and has one infant child. She owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Aida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like coffee, sugar, spices, noodles, and drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to buy noodles, drinks, coffee, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh, 27, lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Dornod, a province located far from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. 

He transports passengers around the region with his motorbike. He has been doing the business for two years successfully. His wife works in a private company as a food technologist. 

Their family house is quiet old, and the roof, floor and wall have become dangerous. He is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to repair  his house so it is safe to live in.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin, 45 years old, is a pig feeder and earns $1 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and earns $2 per day. They have six children, two of whom are studying and the other four of whom are working.   Each earns $3 per day.  Every month, Rin has to spend $66; $5 on electricity, $15 on rent house fee, $10 on school fee, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a boat and fishing equipment. Before, she went fishing with her husband but the benefits are not good.  She decided to feed pigs at home in order to make other income.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing equipment

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced. Her kids are grown. Tatyana runs a small female clothing sales business in her hometown of Kahovka. She also travels to small neighboring towns in the Kherson region, selling clothing merchandise as well. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Tatyana was forced to find new ways to support and feed her family, which motivated her to launch this small vending venture. Tatyana worked really hard to see her trade succeed. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise that she offers for sale. She wants to increase her sales and income as a result. Tatyana always says she enjoys being self-employed and would never trade it for any other job.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventories - winter coat and sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy t-shirts, sweaters, lingerie, baby clothes, and other items.

loans.name: Rahab Wanja

texts.en:
Rahab used her previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She was able to plant and have a very profitable harvest. Rahab repaid the loan well and in good time.

This will be Rahab's fourth loan, which she plans to use to buy seedlings, fertilizer and spraying chemicals. In the future, Rahab hopes to become among the best farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and spraying chemicals

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 21 ans.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1985. Elle vend des céréales et du charbon pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Afi a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des charbons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait diversifier son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 47 year old woman. She is married to an employee. She has four children, one whom studies. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 21. Afi has been working as a vendor since 1985. She sells cereals and charcoal out of her home, to all kinds of customers. She stocks up in Lome. She works by herself. At present, she has no problems with her business. Afi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and charcoal. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years to come, Afi would like to diversify her business. She says that she plans to provide for some family needs with the revenues obtained.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and cereals

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina de la ciudad de Managua es una persona soltera y  trabaja como archivista  desde  hace diecinueve año para tener un mejor  nivel de vida para su familia y así salir adelante. 

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó la señora anteriormente mencionadaa solicitar crédito para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, este crédito lo invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín y pagar mano de obra, para poder hacer una reparaciones en la pared de su casa.
texts.en:
María Cristina is from the city of Managua; she’s single and has been working as an Archivist for nineteen years to have a better standard of living for her family and thus get ahead.


The aforementioned lady came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan to improve her house which is in poor condition.  She will use the loan to buy building materials like sand, cement, concrete blocks, rebar and gravel and to pay labor costs to do some repairs to her house’s wall.

loans.use: to do home improvements.

loans.name: Kiwambi Tujitunze Mikolola Group

texts.en:
Yuditha is a 46-year-old married woman with one child. She has been doing well in producing coffee, maize and beans for over seven years. She has been earning low income due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Yuditha is finding working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, she has committed to increase her scale of production from seven to 18 acres in five years which can lead to generating more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Parque El Litre Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Parque El Litre” está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican principalmente al rubro del comercio en diferentes ferias libres. Entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa para varón, chocolatería, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
María Angelica tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en una silla en primera fila, en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, usa una polera color sandía y sostiene a su pequeña hija en las piernas.
Se dedica a vender ropa usada para varón y dama, además ropa nueva para bebé y durante época de navidad vende juguetes. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 2 años.
Instala su puesto de ropa en diferentes ferias libres dos veces a la semana, el resto de los días ofrece y vende la mercadería desde su casa. Además está esperando un permiso municipal, para trabajar los días domingos. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras ubicadas en la ciudad de Santiago y Valparaíso. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva para bebé, además de artículos para la Fiesta de Año Nuevo, entre cotillón y challa. 
Las metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido para ofrecer su mercadería, de una manera menos esforzada, ya que durante las temporadas de invierno y verano, se ve afectada por la lluvia y el sol.
María Angelica vive junto a su madre, su hermana y su hija de 2 años de edad. En la actualidad a su madre la aqueja una compleja enfermedad (tumor cervical), situación que la mantiene con dificultades para trasladarse por sí sola. Por lo que uno de sus sueños es que su madre se recupere, para esto María Angelica hace todo lo posible para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y por ende una mayor comodidad. Otro de sus sueños es obtener su vivienda propia, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional, por lo que su familia ha debido tener paciencia para esperar el llamado de entrega.
Por esto igual la motivación de continuar con su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que ha hecho amistades y que a pesar de algunos inconvenientes, han sabido superarlos.
Por otro lado tiene buenas expectativas respecto a las capacitaciones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Parque El Litre” ["El Litre Park"] and is comprised of 20 entrepreneurs who, for the most part, are merchants at various open markets. Among them, you will find individuals who sell men's clothing and chocolate, as well as other businesses. They are all from the city of Valparaíso.

María Angelica is the treasurer of this communal bank. In the photo, she is seated in the first row of chairs, second from the right. She is wearing a watermelon-colored shirt and has her young daughter on her lap. She sells used clothing for men and women, as well as new clothing for babies. During the Christmas season she also sells toys. She has been working in this business for two years.

María Angelica sets up her clothing stand in different open markets twice a week and sells merchandise from her home on the other days. She is also awaiting a municipal permit to work on Sundays. She buys her merchandise from distributors located in the cities of Santiago and Valparaíso.

She will use this loan to buy new clothing for babies, as well as items for New Year's celebrations, such as party supplies and shawls. Her goal for her business is to have an established location so that she can offer her merchandise more easily, since during the winter and summer seasons she is currently affected by the rain and sun.

María Angelica lives with her mother, her sister, and her two year-old daughter. Her mother is currently suffering from a complex illness (a cervical tumor), which makes it hard for her to get around by herself. Another of María Angelica's dreams is for her mother to recover, so she is doing everything she can to offer her mother more comfort and a better quality of life. María Angelica also dreams of owning her own property, so she has already applied for a housing subsidy. Her family has had to have patience as they wait for the approval call. This has further motivated María Angelica to continue with her business.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business. In respect to her communal bank, María Angelica comments that she has formed friendships and that despite some drawbacks, they have been able to succeed. She also has high expectations for the educational training sessions.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the legislative seat of the country. It is the country's main port and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque sites, such as the home of Nobel Prize winning poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy new baby clothing, as well as items for the New Year's celebration, including party supplies and shawls

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 29 years old and married with two children aged 2 and 8. She sells vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years . She describes her business environment as good because she has many customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to support her family financially. She hopes to open a big shop in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en:
Ma.Teresa is 25 years old and lives in Manamong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.
 
Ma.Teresa has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.
 
Ma.Teresa has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerza, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera madre de 3 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 6 meses. A Flora le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por que se distrae y también porque la facilidad con la que obtiene los prestamos, también le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan sobre la puntualidad, el ahorro, y tambien como educar a sus hijos y como manejar su negocio y sus ganancias. Flora solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de suministros para la elaboración de la cancha como: aceite, sal, maíz, etc.
texts.en: Flora is a partner of the Fuerza Communal Bank. She is a 30-year-old single mother of 3 children, and has been a member of FINCA Perú for over 6 months. Flora likes the communal bank meetings because they take her mind off things, and also because she can obtain loans easily there. She also enjoys the training sessions because they teach her about punctuality, saving money, how to bring up her children, and how to manage her business and profits. Flora is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to make cancha [a Peruvian dish of toasted corn kernels], such as cooking oil, salt, and corn.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, and corn.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants(on peut voir son plus petit enfant sur la photo); elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis pratiquement 15 ans. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de petit déjeuné.  Elle est sociétaire  à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a honoré son engagement par rapport à son premier crédit obtenu. Elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit d’un montant de 500.000 francs qui sera destiné à l’achat de produits alimentaires et agroalimentaires qui serviront à la préparation des divers menus  proposés a sa clientèle. Le renforcement de son fond de roulement pourrait avoir comme conséquence  l’augmentation de ses profits, ce qui peut lui offrir l’opportunité de commencer une seconde activité, la vente de produits cosmétiques. Dans le futur, elle projette d’ouvrir un grand restaurant afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mariama lives in Senegal.  She is married and a mother of 5 children (her youngest child is pictured in the photo with her) and has worked in commerce for almost 15 years.  She is now specialized in the sale of breakfasts.

Mariama is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC.  She has already honored a previous commitment with them and repaid her first loan.  She is now requesting another loan of 500,000 francs, which will be used to buy fresh food as well as processed food products.  She will use these supplies to prepare the various dishes which she sells to her customers.

By strengthening her working capital, Mariama might increase her profits, which may give her the opportunity to start a second activity, such as selling cosmetic products.  

In the future, Mariama is planning to open a large restaurant in order to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy food supplies to prepare the meals that she sells.

loans.name: Rachael's Group

texts.en:
Racheal is 41 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Racheal is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Racheal started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Racheal’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самара, 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, вместе с мужем занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Самары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 30 овец. На 0,50 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Самара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и топлива для обработки почвы. Самара является лидером группы "Бай Дыйкан А4", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита Самара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт хоз построек.
texts.en: Samara is 27 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture with her husband.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows and 30 sheep on her farm.  She also grows beans on 0.5 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers, seeds and fuel to work on her land.  Samara is the leader of the "Bai Dyikan A4" group, which comprises another three members, so a total of three people.  Samara is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business and to repair some farm buildings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fuel to work on her land and grow organic beans.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Eleven years ago Martha and her husband started a small grocery store in order to give a better future to their family, they have six children. They started with the support of a supplier and now they have been growing on their own.

The store is located in a low income zone, lots of people know it and prefer it, and this is why Martha is requesting a loan of $925 USD. She plans to pay this loan back in a term of 4-8 months. And she will use this loan in order to buy merchandise and provide a better service to their clients.

ESPAÑOL

Hace once años que Martha y su esposo iniciaron un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el fin de poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Su familia esta compuesta por ellos y seis hijos. Iniciaron con el crédito que les daba un proveedor y poco a poco han ido creciendo en su negocio.

Su tienda esta ubicada en una zona muy popular y la gente ya la conoce y la prefiere, es por eso que solicita un préstamo por $925 USD a pagar en un plazo de 4-8 meses, para poder surtir mejor su negocio y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Suifou

texts.en: Suifou, with financial assistance from SPBD, was able to put her sewing talents into commercial practice. The money helped her to buy the tools she needed like the sewing machine, thread, and all her sewing supplies. She is happy with the progress of her sewing shop as it makes her confident that she is able to provide for her family’s needs, especially in paying for her children’s education and other family commitments. "If you are looking for a seamstress, try Suifou’s Sewing Shop that provides you with all of the family's clothing at affordable rates," she would exhort her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of overlock sewing machine, cotton fabrics, and needles

loans.name: Laue

texts.en:
Laue is a mother of two. She is a very strong and determined woman seeking different ways to earn more money. She has been operating her vegetable garden for a long time but the money earned from the business is not enough to meet her familys immediate needs and maintain the garden. 

She started with a $750ST loan and purchased equipment with the money. She is now repaying her fourth loan of $1000ST, which she used to finance the purchase of a second hand pick-up truck she uses to deliver her vegetables to the market. Laue is delighted to own a car because this really helps take some of the burden off her shoulders.  It allows her to save money on public transport fares and is also helps her deliver vegetables to various restaurants in town. She also has a stable spot at the market to sell her vegetables.  Therefore, she is earning more profit and at the same time meets her familys daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more gardening tools and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his hotel business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 10 years of experience in seafood sales, together with her husband, who taught her the business. He worked with his father from the age of 15. After he married Maria, they succeeded in founding their own business. They work every day from 7 am to 2 pm. They catch crabs, cook them, remove the meat and package it to be sold later.

Before borrowing from Mifex, Maria could not meet the demand with of her clients. After receiving a loan several months ago she has been able to significantly increase her production and keep her clients happy. She is now hopeful of taking out a second loan under the Mifex and Kiva partnership.

Maria is 28 years old. She has 4 children, all in school. Her children appreciate their parents for the effort they put into supporting them and giving them the opportunity to study. They hope to buy their own house, since they currently live with Maria's inlaws.

loans.use: Buy a new freezer

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is a struggling woman who works hard every day to put food on the table for her four children that she cares for alone after separating from her husband 11 years ago. She decided to take control of her home and help her little ones get ahead by raising small animals and guinea pigs. Every day she works at this, accomplishing various tasks and devoting herself to raising the animals she sells regularly in the fairs and markets in her area. With the earnings that she gets from her work, she educates her children and is able to offer them a good life. Many times life has not permitted her to grant them fulfillment economically. Nevertheless she has always tried to devote herself to working at many jobs so that what happened many years ago will not happen again. For the good of her children, she is requesting a $400 loan that she will invest in purchasing a small bull and more fodder. Support Doña Eugenia in her efforts to get ahead. Together we can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Eugenia es una mujer esforzada que día a día trabaja con diligencia para ubicar el sustento diario para beneficio de sus 4 hijos a los cuales mantiene sola tras separarse de su esposo hace ya 11 años. Decide tomar las riendas de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus pequeños con la crianza de animales pequeños y cuyes. Así mismo cada día se esfuerza realizando diversos trabajos y con mayor diligencia en la crianza de animalitos que comercializa diariamente en las ferias y/o mercados de su localidad y con las ganancias que obtiene por su desempeño educa y les otorga bienestar a sus hijos.Muchas veces la situación no ha permitido brindarles un sostén económico adecuado para su desempeño. Sin embargo siempre ha tratado de dedicarse a más de una labor a fin de que no vuelva a ocurrir lo sucedido años atrás y para bienestar de ellos solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares que invertirá en la compra de un torito y más forraje . .Apoya a Doña Eugenia a seguir adelante, juntos podemos hacerlo.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for guinea pigs and a small bull.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 45 years old. She co-habited with Miguel for 24 years, until she was widowed three years ago, leaving her in charge of their business that they started together when the began their relationship.

Mercedes owns a butcher’s shop, she recounts with much sadness that when her partner died, she had many difficulties in taking over this and the grocery store which they managed together, as it was he who had largely taken care of the businesses. Despite this, she managed to continue forward alone, with the help of her 5 children aged 28, 24, 22, 19 and 13 years-old respectively. Today only the youngest of them lives with her, while the rest are already married and have established their own homes although they continue to help her with the family business.

Today her business continues to function well, with a well-established customer base, and she struggles day-by-day to advance.

Mercedes needs a loan in order to buy livestock which she will then farm in order to sell the meat in her butcher’s shop.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Mercedes tiene 45 años. Vivió en pareja durante 24 años con Miguel hasta que enviudó hace 3 años quedándose a cargo del negocio que montaron juntos cuando comenzaron la relación.

Mercedes posee una carnicería, cuenta con mucha tristeza que cuando falleció su pareja tuvo muchas dificultades para retomar el negocio de la carnicería y la despensa que manejaban juntos, debido a que él se ocupaba mayormente de dichos negocios. No obstante logró salir adelante sola con la ayuda de sus cinco hijos de 28, 24, 22, 19 y 13 años respectivamente. Hoy día solamente la menor de todos vive con ella, mientras que los demás ya están casados y han formado sus propios hogares aunque continúan ayudando en el negocio familiar.

Hoy día su negocio continúa bastante bien, cuenta con clientela bien formada y ella lucha día a día por salir adelante.

Necesita de un crédito para la compra de animales vivos que luego faena para vender la carne en su carnicería.

loans.use: Purcahse Livestock

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Ms. Felipa T.’s business is flowers and shoes' sales, in the city of Chinandega. She started a year ago as a peddler, but her age as well as the sun exposure led her to settle in one place, in order to prevent any health issues. She has presently been assigned a spot at the boulevard of the Chinandega market, where she works selling by retail.

It is important to point out that, in a short period, she has obtained a total of three loans from Ceprodel, which have allowed her to improve her business, by buying a higher volume of merchandise, as well as by acquiring novel flower products, which she sells at the Chinandega market.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio a que se dedica la señora Felipa T. es a la comercialización de flores junto con la venta de chinelas en la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio lo inició hace un año vendiendo ambulante en las calles, pero su edad y la exposición al sol dieron lugar a que la señora T. se estableciera en un solo lugar para evitar daños a su salud. Hoy en da la señora Felipa ha conseguido un tramo en el bulevar del mercado de Chinandega, donde se desempeña vendiendo los productos al detalle.

Es necesario destacar que desde hace poco tiempo, ella ha obtenido créditos en Ceprodel acumulando un total de 3 créditos, que a pesar de que sean pocos ha podido contemplar mejoras en su negocio, como lo son la compra de mayores volúmenes de ventas y de igual forma la adquisición de nuevos productos florales que los vende en el sector del mercado de la ciudad de Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Katogo B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Eva is 33 years old and married with four children. She has a butcher shop. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a plot of land and construct a house.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand butchery business

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a young single man with no children. He is licensed in business administration and, after graduating, began his own business. He now owns a small hamburger restaurant where he has a simple menu of great food.

Luis has been in business now for five years and, over time, he has created a great clientele and reputation in the area. He is looking for a loan to help him purchase more drinks, meat for burgers, and bread. He is hoping that soon he will be able to hire more people and increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To buy drinks, baked goods, meats, and vegetables for the production of his hamburgers.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Jimenez is 38 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliacion, with her husband who sells goods by travelling from market to market. They have two young sons. Maria sells tortillas and fried pork out of her home, and this is how she supplements their income and helps with their sons' expenses. She is now asking for a loan, which will be used to purchase pork and cornmeal, which she will use to make tortillas (filled with fried pork and onion salad). This is a favorite meal among her clients because it is full of delicious flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria J., de 38 años de edad vive en Villa Reconciliación, con su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo perecederos en los mercados de tramo en tramo, tiene 2 hijos que son jóvenes y aun no trabajan. En su casa vende tortillas y frito de carne de cerdo, con esto apoya a los gastos de sus hijos. Solicita un crédito para comprar carne de cerdo y vender con tortilla y ensalada de cebolla, esta es una comida muy gustada por sus clientes ya que tiene un sabroso sabor, comprara también maíz para hacer sus tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase pork and cornmeal for making tortillas to sell through her business. (Comprar carne de cerdo y maiz para torillas para vender en su negocio)

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban is 44 years old and he is a carpenter. He has been married to 39 year old Mirian for 18 years. They have one 7 year old child who is going to school at the moment.

Esteban said that he began his carpentry 14 years ago but formerly he worked as a farmer. Nevertheless, he left this activity because he realized that his calling was carpentry, and it was thus that he began to work in the profession. Now he makes furniture, kitchen utensils, clothes hangers, and all types of crafts in wood that soon he returns to resell at the big supermarkets, primarily of the Capitol.

Now he needs a loan in order to buy wood for the creation of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Esteban tiene 44 años de edad y es carpintero de profesión, está casado hace 18 años con Mirian quien tiene 39 años. Tienen un solo hijo que tiene 7 años de edad que actualmente va a la escuela.

Esteban comenta que montó su carpintería hace 14 años pero que anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura. Sin embargo dejó dicha actividad debido a que se dió cuenta que lo suyo era la carpintería y fue así que comenzó a trabajar en la profesión.

Actualmente fabrica muebles, utensilios de cocina, perchas para ropas y todo tipo de trabajos en madera que luego vuelve a revender a los grandes supermercados, principalmente de la capital.

Ahora necesita un crédito para la compra de maderas para la elaboración de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Juana Eva

texts.es:
Juana Eva began a business so she could get ahead and cover household expenses, because her husband´s salary was not enough. She has 2 children, 3 and 6 years old. She decided to start a business selling sheets, towels and other home goods by catalog. This has given her a good income and she has been able to establish a good client base.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and in this way be able to increase her sales. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Eva inició el negocio para superarse y salir adelante con los gastos que se generan en su casa ya que con el sueldo de su pareja no completaban. Ella tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años. Decidió emprender su negocio de venta de blancos por catalogo, lo que le ha dado buenas ganancias ya que ha logrado hacerse de una buena cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas V., 50, is a widow and lives with her children in Siem Reap province. Mrs. Meas has had a business selling a variety of fruits in a busy market since 1998 and earns around $10 each day. She also gets support from her son who is a fruits vendor in a different market who typically makes about $5 each day. She has four children, one of whom is married and lives away.

Mrs. Meas V. would like a loan to purchase more fruits in order to meet her customers' growing demand and to expand her business. She is pictured here with her son.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
First loan:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=24427&_tpos=3&_tpg=1

Soraida is a single, 32-year-old woman who sells imported clothing such as leather coats, shoes, zapatillas, pants, sheets, quilts, etc. She purchases these products from Puno and Tacna, where she goes every two months depending on her sales and working capital. Her sales are on credit, selling to friends, family, neighbors, and institutions. She begins every day at six in the morning working till six each night. Soraida currently has a project to start a new business to rent dresses.

Soraida is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in mO. slippers and shoes.

Soraida’s dream is to have her own home and to have a stO. where she would rent out dresses.

loans.use: to invest in more slippers and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Soknat

texts.en:
Mrs. Soknat P., 24, is a farmer, and her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. She grows rice and has been farming since 1980, earning approximately $1 per day. Soknat has two children, all of whom are young and in school. They live in Trapeang Preah Commune in Kampong Cham Province.

Due to increasing family expenses, she needs to expand her business by raising pigs. And now she would like to request a loan to purchase piglets and pig food.

loans.use: To request a loan to purchase piglets and the rest amount purchase pig food

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort K. is 48 years old. She is a wife and the mother of six children. Currently, four of the children are in school; the other two have completed school. She loves selling and she has a great deal of experience in customer service. She has been selling dried fish for 30 years to support her family. She treks to fishing communities to purchase goods from farmers and sometimes from fish mongers. This process saves her from paying the middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price. She wants to use this loan to buy dried fish in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. 

Comfort is a member of a group called Isaiah Trust Group'. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy dried fish in bulk

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married to Nadiya and has a 9-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine, and offers technical maintenance services at a gas station in his home town. Andrei decided to launch this business because he has always loved working with technical systems. He's been running this business for 6 years. Currently, his daily income is about $100. He has just bought a car for his family to make their life more comfortable.

Andrei is seeking a 3000 Grivna loan that he is hoping to invest in the purchase of vehicle oil. He believes his business policy, that allows deferred payments, will be an attraction for his customers and will help him stand out among his competitors. Andrei has successfully repaid 3 loans to Nadiya Ukraine which has impacted the growth of his business.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase 300 liters of motor oil

loans.name: Socorro Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Socorro tiene 37 años de edad, con cuatro hijos de 3, 8,15 y 20 años de edad, todos están a su cargo y estudian, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de cerdos, compra en la ciudad del rama lo cual viaja a muchos kilómetros de la ciudad por que allá se compran a buen precio y los revende bastante bien. La Sra. Socorro tiene una pulpería desde hace cuatro años con ingresos que su esposo le dio comenzó con poco pero ha ido estabilizando la pulpería, con esta solicitud de préstamo es la segunda pues ha logrado mantener su negocio mas surtido con los préstamo, con esta solicitud es para compra inventario en compra de productos varios y poder sastifacer la demanda de su clientela. A largo plazo es poder hacerla en una miscelánea para vender de todos los productos a sus clientes, cambiar de vehiculo ya que tienen uno viejito donde acarrean los cerdos, y poder dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Socorro is 37 years old, with 4 children ages 3, 6, 15 and 20. She is responsible for all the children as they all study. They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. Her husband has a business selling pigs, he buys them in a city far away because he gets a good price and can then resell them for a profit. Socorro has had a convenience store for four years. She began the store with a little income her husband gave her. This second loan will enable her to maintain her store with inventory to buy various products and be able to satisfy her customers’ demands. Her long term goals are to be able to enlarge her store and sell more products to her customers, get a new car to transport the pigs as they have an old one, and be able to offer an education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products to stock her convenience store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. sells Irish potatoes and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a peasant. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build an internet café. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Wumi

texts.en:
Wumi is 38 years old and married with 2 children.

Wumi has a shop where she sells children’s clothes and clothing materials. Wumi used to hawk her goods within her community. Now, with the assistance of LAPO MICROFINANCE, she has been able to rent a shop to sell her clothes. Wumi hopes to stock her shop with more goods to meet the demands of her customers.

Therefore Wumi needs a loan of N99,000 so she can purchase more children’s clothes to sell. She says thank you to all KIVA lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more children’s clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed J. is a Tanzanian entrepreneurial businessman. His business is selling coconuts in Kariakoo Dar es Salaam. He purchases coconuts direct from producers and sells to retailers for domestic use. He has been in this business for six years. Coconuts are used by many people as a spice and sometimes for cooking oil production in industries. They are mainly produced in the coastal region. He needs a loan to buy more product.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso M., reside en Zacatecoluca departamento de La Paz, vive junto a su esposa desde ya hace 23 años en el mismo lugar. A sus 66 años de edad, se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora, ya que hace un año emprendió un negocio propio, el cuál consiste en vender materia prima para productos elaborados con madera. A pesar que Alfonso cuenta con una extensa red de clientes los cuales compran el producto al contado, no percibe  mucha ganancia debido a su poco inventario. Es por ello que el deseo de Alfonso es obtener un préstamo a través del cuál pueda aumentar sus productos y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas, así también desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que los insectos deterioran la madera y le es muy necesario contar con el capital para mejorar su servicio. De esta manera el podrá percibir mayores ganancias y mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Alfonso M. and his wife have lived in the Zacatecoluca district of La Paz for 23 years. Although he is 66 years old, he continues to be a very hard worker, and it was only last year that he started his own business. He sells the raw materials needed to make other products out of wood. But although Alfonso has an extensive network of clients who pay cash for his products, he has not been able to make much of a profit because his inventory is so small. It is for this reason that Alfonso is requesting a loan. He would like to increase the range of products he offers and thus, increase his sales. A loan would also help him improve the condition of his store, which is currently infested with insects that are ruining his wood and are obviously a very serious problem for the quality of his service. In these ways, capital would help him improve the profitability of his business and increase his household's income.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood and improve inventory

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilis K. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Cecilis is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Solina

texts.en: Solina N., a 66-year-old mother of four, resides in the beautiful town of Hamtic, the first town of the province of Antique, Philippines.  Her husband is a farmer and a carpenter. The family has experienced different forms of poverty; however, they've always tried their best to survive. Mrs. N. has been able to send one of her children to college, who is now employed and helps support the family. She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI) last year to obtain capital for raising pigs.Mrs. N. has applied for this loan to buy clothing for a retail business to be managed by her daughter-in-law and to buy another pig and goat for her to maintain her previous business. She plans to save money in order to rent a stall in the market. She hopes that in the future she and her daughter-in-law can expand their businesses.

loans.use: To replenish livestock and buy clothing for retail.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane D. V. is 30 years old, single and has two children aged five months and two years. She supports her young family by engaging in different types of business endeavors. Currently, she makes a living by designing gowns. She also sells food, a line of work which is currently her main source of income.  After learning that HSPFI offers financial assistance to small businesses such as hers, she immediately grasped the opportunity to acquire more funding. She is applying for her first loan to acquire the money she needs to expand her food-selling businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: 42 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thị Hoa Ngô is a 55 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Thị Hoa is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 42 - Nam Ngạn.

Thị Hoa is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Thị Hoa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices to the local community. Thị Hoa has been engaged in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 1.050.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Thị Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 1.626.500 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thị Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. L. Thị Hoa is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

2. N. Thị Chính is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

3. H. Thị Cúc is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

4. H. Thị Liên is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

5. Ngô Thị Lan is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.500 VND loan to support her business of a specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Thị Hoa Ngô (286) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Thị Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả L. khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 42 - Nam Ngạn (17.11.42).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thị Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thị Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1.050.000 VND.
