Vào 2009, Thị Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thị Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.500 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. L. Thị Hoa (287) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.

2. N. Thị Chính (288) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3. H. Thị Cúc (289) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. H. Thị Liên (290) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

5. Ngô Thị Lan (291) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina Serwaa is 26 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child. She currently lives with her daughter who is in school in the community where they live. She lives at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She sells bags of maize and groundnuts.

Faustina has been in this business for over two years now. She goes and gets maize from the remote areas because she feels those areas are cheaper. She treks to Kumasi and Accra to sell it. She buys her goods from the farmers just to avoid middlemen. She says she sells at the market square sometimes.

Faustina wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, hence, her profit. She is hoping to receive a loan from you for a business upgrade.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam P. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Meriam is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Meriam sells different varieties of bananas in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Meriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 55 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Nenita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks known as "suman" (glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed in banana leaves) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba  es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Elba es casada tiene dos hijos de 16 y 10 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Elba estudio visitadora medica lo dejo por que salio embarazada y tenia riesgo de perdida, se dedico a su casa y a sus hijos hasta que estuvieran grandes para poder nuevamente trabajar, es como empieza con la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y la venta de joyas, esta incursionando en la venta de  comidas por las noches en su casa.
Desde que Elba esta en Finca aprendió a programarse en su pagos y en su cuentas, a sacar su ganancia y no tocar su capital.
Elba necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de cosméticos, joyas de plata y oro y la compra de una parrilla grande.    
El sueño de Elba es crecer en el negocio y tener una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Elba is a member of the Empresarias Community Bank. Elba is married and has two children. They are 16 and 10, and they attend the state school. Elba studied to do medical visits, but she left her studies when she became pregnant with a risk of miscarriage. She devoted herself to her home and her children until they were bigger and she could start working again. That is how she started selling beauty products by catalog and selling jewelry. She also sells food in the evenings from her house. Since Elba has been with Finca she has learned to schedule her payments and how to take her earnings and not touch her capital. Elba needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy cosmetics, silver and gold jewelry, and a large grill. Elba’s dream is to expand her business and have a bazaar style store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, silver and gold jewelry, and a large grill

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L. is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the town of Sataoa. She is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Elena runs a banana plantation. She has been engaged in this business for more than one year, and earns approximately $500 WST a month from her work.

Elena joined SPBD earlier this year to gain access to financial services that can improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1,250 WST from SPBD. She used this loan to buy fertilizers such as manure. Elena has applied for a new loan of $750 WST to buy additional fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's standard of living

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: La Señora Sara Biviana C. tiene 53 años de edad. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Tiene 7 hijos que laboran de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es su vivienda, Sara tuvo dificultades ya que su casa de habitación está ubicada en un lugar muy distante por lo que perdió muchos clientes. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y con lo difícil que ha sido mantener este negocio ha hecho muchos sacrificios para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materia prima para satisfacer la demande a de sus clientes. El sueño de Sara es de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Sara Biviana C. is 53 years old. Currently she is married and has 7 children who work independently. The economic activity that she is involved in is to sell general merchandise. The location of her business is her home. Sara has had difficulties because her house is in a distant location and she lost many customers. She has been running this business for 8 years and because of the difficulty with maintaining the business she has made many sacrifices so that the children have no lack of bread each day. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials to satisfy the demands of her clients. Sara’s dream is to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells sarongs. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She has been in this business for years. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell and make more profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mrs. Mean T., age 25, is married Mr. Sambath Hoeun, age 29. The couple has no children yet and lives their mother on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Mean T. and her husband have earned a living by buying vegetables grown in their village and transport to sell in Phnom Penh market. Mean is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase more vegetables for resale, she will able to keep continuing expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Beatriz E. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene vario tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el cual le ha dado todo lo que tiene, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que este es un alimento que se consume mucho en nuestro pais, las tortillas aparte de ser muy sabrosas son el acompañante en todas las comidas (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). es por eso que este tipo de alimento es bien vendido.
Beatriz esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas materia prima al por mayor para tener una mayor produccion ya que ahora no se da abasto y su producto se le termina rapido, tiene las esperanzas que su produccion va a crecer y sus ventas van a mejorar mucho. 
tiene el espiritu de una mujer trabajadora. estando con ella nos dio a probar una de sus tortillas y son muy buenas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz E. earns a living making and selling tortillas. She has time to devote herself to this kind of activity, which has given her all that she has. Her sales are very good, due in part to the food that is consumed in her country. Tortillas, in addition to being very delicious are the mainstay in all meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner). It is for this reason she sells this type of food. Beatriz is asking for a loan to be able to buy wholesale the raw materials needed to have a major production, now that the supplies are being used up quickly. She hopes that her production is going to grow and her sales will improve a lot. She has the spirit of a hardworking woman. While being with her, she gave us one of her tortillas to taste and they are delicious.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood, corn, lime and water.

loans.name: Aydelina

texts.es: La señora Aydelina S.  tiene años de trabajar con adim en este tiempo ha demostrado ser una mujer con carácter, visión en los negocios, trabajadora y comprometida. Es una persona muy inteligente que a pesar de sus carencias educativas ha podido superarse, ella vende ropa y realiza reposterías.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aydelina has worked for years with ADIM. During all this time she has demonstrated herself to be a woman with character and business vision, and is hard working and dedicated. She is a very intelligent person who despite her lack of education has been able to forge ahead. She sells clothes and has a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES AND SUPPLIES TO MAKE PASTRY

loans.name: Babyelesa Women's Group Of Mukono

texts.en: Clement B. is 50 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is married with nine children whose ages range from 30 years old to 20 years old.  Many of her children have graduated from University.  She is involved in the dairy business and generates 150,000 USH per week from the enterprise.  Right now, the supplies of milk are low due to the season, so naturally the prices have gone higher for the product. Clement would like to use the loan to purchase the milk at these higher prices. With hard work and determination she one day hopes to be able to afford to build her family a house.

loans.use: Additional milk

loans.name: Maricel Lei

texts.en:
Maricel Lei M. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Maricel Lei owns and operates a business providing transport "motorela" services to local community members. Maricel Lei has been engaged in her business more than ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maricel Lei joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel Lei is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricel Lei from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation service

loans.name: Presie

texts.en: Presie, 30 years old, ventured into rice farming in 2000. She is a married woman and has two children with her husband, Loreto. She is happy to say that her business is doing well and she is now preparing her land for planting. She wants to maintain her farm's good condition so it is productive and gives her a better income. Presie needs additional capital for her farm so she applied to CEVI for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). With this loan, Presie will be able to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia A. is from the village of New Village Tambulig Zds. She is 43 years old. Lucrecia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as bread, sugar, coffee,salt,candies shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucrecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lucrecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more soya beans, vegetable oil, khebab sticks, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Senan

texts.en: This young man is single. Senan was born in 1989. He teaches students to play the accordion. Senan has been in this business for 2 years. He lives in Baku city. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita G. has been an ASHI member since 1998. Her family is very thankful that she has an opportunity to improve their standard of living through the proceeds of the fishing and fish selling businesses she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

Her husband’s support of her business is Estelita’s inspiration to keep going through the challenges of being poor but growing her business despite that. Over time, Estelita has been able to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to manage and use for fishing while she is the one who sells his fish directly to people in the market.

The fishing business has brought joy to Estelita’s family, especially to her personally. Because of its profits, she has been able to graduate her eldest 23-year-old child from college. However, her second child has not graduated from college but, nevertheless, Estelita has accepted the fact that she can’t have everything she has expected, especially with their poor economic status. Being a mother, she always wanted to support her son in whatever career he would be taking and that is being a fisherman just like his father.

With that, Estelita is requesting a loan from ASHI to be able to purchase another fishing boat for her son. This would not only provide him with employment but would also make their business grow and make more profit, which will enable her to support the education of her two youngest children to college level until they graduate.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing motorboat for her son

loans.name: Italia Fortunata

texts.es:
Italia L. de 33 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio (está situado al sur de Guayaquil y generalmente vive gente de clase baja) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de periódicos local, ellos tienen dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad.

Italia aprendió ha realizar muñecos y dibujos de fomix hace muchos años atrás porque le gustaba esta actividad pero por la falta de ingresos decidió convertir esta actividad en algo que iba a solventar a su familia e invertir sus ahorros y comprar fomix para hacer muñecos infantiles para sus amistades. 

Por los buenos ingresos que obtuvo alquilo un local para vender mejor sus muñecos, dibujos, piñatas de fomix. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano para terminar los pedidos que le piden sus clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix para hacer más manualidades.

En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener ya empleados que la ayuden y también poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Italia L., 33 years of age, lives in the urban area of Suburbio, Guayaquil (located to the south of Guayaquil, and primarily comprised of lower-income families). Her husband works at a local newspaper enterprise, and they have two children ages 13 and 9. Many years ago, Italia learned how to make dolls and drawings out of foam because she enjoyed the activity. However, given her lack of financial resources, she decided to turn her interest into something that would generate income for the family. She opted to invest her savings into buying foam so she could make foam figurines for her friends. Since she generated a good profit, she rented a location where she could do a better job selling her foam dolls, designs and piñatas. She starts work very early, in order to complete the orders from her customers. With this loan, she would like to buy more foam to make a greater quantity of handicrafts. In the future, she would like to expand her business and hire employees to help her out. She would also like to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foam for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mom H. and her family live in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She was born in 1980. She is a farmer who owns a 2.9-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problems are that her rice field has infertile soil, it is a long way from an irrigation system and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve rice production, Mrs. Srey Mom H. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and to hire farming laborers to plow her rice field. 

Her husband, Mr. Sina Dieb, is a construction worker and is also a fisherman. He is shown in the photo with her. The couple supports two children, one of whom is studying in the local public school, while the younger one is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide, and hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: Tey

texts.en: Tey S., 23, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She buys traditional baskets for resale for an income of about USD 10 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more baskets for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more baskets for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Nouch Hin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan in Chy Chrab village in TaK. province and the members have selected Mrs. NO. H. as the village bank president. She was born in 1979 and now she is a farmer who owns a two-hectare (5-acre) plot of land she uses to cultivate rice to support herself and her family.

Now Mrs. NO. H. has a problem because she wants to buy a buffalo but she has a little money to buy it. So, to achieve this purpose, she is seeking a loan to add to her money to buy a buffalo.

She is single with a member household.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl G. de 40 años de edad, es separado, el tienen a su cargo 2 hijas que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
 Don Raúl se inició en este rubro aproximadamente en el año 2.008; con el capital que adquirió con la venta de un automovil, dicho dinero lo invirtió en compra de artículos deportivos como: remeras, pantaloncitos, rodilleras, busos, y diferentes tipos de championes;  en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada.
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (remeras, pantaloncitos, rodilleras, buzos, y championes); teniendo en cuenta que  en esta temporada tiene muchas ventas.
texts.en:
Raúl, 40, is separated and cares for his two daughters who are attending secondary school. Raúl began selling clothes around 2008 with the capital that he acquired through a car sale. He invested this money in the purchase of sporting goods such as t-shirts, shorts, kneepads, track suits and different types of sneakers, all the while developing a customer base. Raúl will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise (t-shirts, shorts, kneepads, track suits and sneakers) keeping in mind that he does a lot of sales in this season.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise (sporting goods and clothes)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Makima Group of Faulu Kenya. She is a married lady with two children aged 5 and 3.

Ruth sells second-hand clothes in an open-air market, where her stall is made of iron sheets. She has engaged in this business for three years, having previously operated a general store. She also does printing and photocopying for a fee to earn extra income.

Ruth has seen her business grow since she took out a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya which she used to add stock. Her group members guaranteed her loan and she managed to repay.

Ruth is requesting another loan of 60,000 KES to add to her stock of nightwear. She also hopes get fashionable clothes such as children’s clothes, trousers and blouses to sell.

Ruth is a hardworking lady who dreams of expanding her business premises in the future.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes, trousers and blouses and to add to her stock of nightwear

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 54 ans,veuve avec 3 enfants dont l'age varient entre 18 et 24 ans. En 1994  elle perd son mari et pour faire face aux difficultes de sa nouvelle vie de veuve, elle  se lance dans la vente des produits divers avec la somme de 50.000frs qu'on lui avait donnee pour les condeleances lors du deces de son mari
Elle a des revenus de 30000 a 50000 frs par jour, puisque la majorite de ses clients sont ceux les femmes Ouest Africaines tel que les Beninoises,les Maliennes... qui fabriquent du jus de gingembre et le jus de Bissap  et elle s'approvisionne aux grossistes  de la place . Ses fournisseurs de bissap  sont les grossistes aui 
 Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir , elle va acheter des sacs de Bissaps, gingembre, sucre, des aromes , de la vanille et des sacs de farine.
Elle pense agrandir son etalage et faire beaucoup d'epargne pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, prendre en charge les etudes de ses enfants et a la longue acheter un terrain pour ses enfants .
Dans le quartier tout le monde l'apprecie , et est tres celebre dans le grand marche ou elle passe tout son temps.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 54-year old widow, with three children between 18 and 24 years of age. She had lost her husband in 1994 and, in order to adjust to the challenges of her new life as a widow, she launched a business retailing miscellaneous items, using as a starting capital the 50,000 West African francs she had received as condolence gift. Her revenue ranges from 30,000 to 50,000 per day; most of her clients are West African women (coming, for example, from Benin or Mali) who produce ginger juice and bissap [hibiscus] juice. She purchases from local wholesalers. Her bissap suppliers are also wholesalers. With this expected loan, she plans to purchase bags of bissap, ginger, sugar, flavorings, vanilla and bags of flour. She intends to expand her business and put a big part of money away as savings in order to meet her family needs, pay for her children’s education, and, in the long term, purchase a land plot for her children. She is well liked in her neighborhood, and very well known at the big market where she spends all of her time.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of ginger, sugar,bissap,flavorings,vanilla and flour

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en:
Rapheal is a 41-year-old man who is married with five children aged from 2 to 17 years. He looks after his aged mother and his wife runs a small business of her own. He lives with his family in his own home in Hoima, Uganda.

Rapheal wishes in future to have a family that is self-reliant without loans. He is currently into a timber business and has been in it for ten years. He has a certificate in carpentry and joinery. He at first was working with the diocese and then saved to start his own business.
 
Rapheal faces the hardship of creditors who end up defaulting on payment. He wants his business in future to be a full carpentry shop with machines. He wants a loan to purchase timber for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Ana is married and has two school-aged children. Ana owns and operates a rice farm. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.

Ana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ana is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: purchasing farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Mayyada

texts.en:
Mayyada S. is a young woman from Deir Al Balah in the Gaza Strip. Mayyada has an eight-month-old daughter named Mayyar. Mayyada's husband, Muhammad, is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Mayyada and Muhammad run a clothing store in the city. The store is located in a housing area, which ensures a good number of customers.

Mayyada helps her husband run the store in the morning while he is at work.  The store helps the family financially as PNA salaries are usually low. Mayyada has come to FATEN to take a $1500 loan to purchase winter clothes to prepare for the coming season.

Mayyada's husband appears in the above picture, standing in the small store where they sell clothes and make-up, as Mayyada is not comfortable with having her picture published online.

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Señor Roberto, Vallegrandino, nacido en agosto de 1985, concubinado con la Sra. Verónica, con un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, Hace 15 años que viven y trabajan en los amarillos, a 15 Km de la carretera entrando por Limoncito Carretera Cañada II, tiene tierra mediante el sindicato Agrario Los amarillos, el se dedica a la agricultura, siembra Maíz y Sorgo para hacer Escobas, Arroz, Papa y así también verduras para su consumo diario, con el dinero del crédito preparara la tierra para la siembra de maíz, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Roberto is a native of the Vallegrande province and was born in August 1985; he shares his life with his live-in partner Verónica, and they have a son of school age. For 15 years they have been living and working in Los Amarillos, located 15 km from Limoncito along the Cañada II Highway. Thanks to the farmers’ union of Los Amarillos he has been endowed with some land, and he engages in agriculture planting maize, sorghum bicolor used in the production of brooms, rice, potatoes as well as vegetable for their daily needs. The loan he is requesting will be used to invest in to prepare his land and to plant maize. He is very thankful to this institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en: Oyunbat B. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and son in the bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar: Mongolia's capital city. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rented yard. Her husband works in his brother's business and earns 200,000 MNT per month. Oyunbat has been operating a by-product trading business since July 2010, in a rented space at the shop. In the future, she would like to own her own house and fence where she can live with her family. Oyunbat is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more by-products to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more by-products

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema K. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children; all of them are in school. Rehema has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for just under 20 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products in a retail market. Rehema has requested 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She earns additional income through selling passion fruit and samosas to fellow market vendors.

The main business challenge for Rehema is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease her transportation problems. Rehema lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a single mother of two. For a living, she runs Shiro’s caterers, where she sells food. As the breadwinner in her family, she is able to provide basic needs for her children and educate them. She is able to employ one person and she desires to grow her business and employ more people. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been motivated to work hard and she sees hope in her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy utensils and energy-saving cookers (jikos).

loans.use: To buy utensils and energy-saving cookers

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a 47 years old married man who lives in Nabatieh with his wife and four kids. He has worked as a blacksmith for 27 years. Issam is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the fourth time, in order to buy extra iron for his industry. Issam’s clients believe in his good quality of work, and he hopes to expand his business in the future and open a big factory that can ensure a good living and education for his family members.

loans.use: To buy iron.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
In Trapeang Khnaor village, Takeo province,  these four members are taking a group loan.  Mrs. Kong T. is leads this group loan and she was selected by the other members.  Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so improve their family's living standards.

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Thy Tey, is a horse cart driver and a laborer.  Although they try to work a lot, they earn very little income.  To improve her income, Mrs. Kong T. is applying for a loan to buy some ducks and duck food to start a new business in duck breeding. 

She is a mother nine children, two of whom are employed in a casino club while the other five are studying in a local public school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some ducks and duck food to start a duck breeding business.

loans.name: Prima

texts.es:
La señora Prima Esther D. tiene 43 años de edad, es separada tiene hijos ya mayores de edad independientes económicamente. Vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Encarnación.

La señora Prima es propietaria de una Despensa bien surtida que está situada en la Feria Municipal La Placita de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela que concurre diariamente a su local para realizar sus compras. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante, ir ampliando cada vez más su comercio y mediante esto mantener su hogar y solventar los gastos que el mismo requiere.

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercadería para fin de año.
texts.en:
Mrs. Prima Esther D. is 43 years old and is separated. She has children that are already older and are economically independent. She lives in her own house that is located in the San Isidro neighborhood in the city of Encarnación.

Prima is the owner of a well-stocked pantry that is situated in the "Feria Municipal La Placita" (a market) in the city of Encarnación. She has been doing this activity for many years. She has many customers that come daily to her location to make their purchases. Thanks to this activity, she has been able to move forward in her life, expanding her shop and through this maintain her home and pay the bills that it requires.

She has asked for this loan to buy more merchandise for the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in large amounts such as drinks, meat, and other things.

loans.name: Nzailu

texts.en:
Nzailu K. C. is a 54 year old man. He is married to Monica and together they have been blessed with four children. His wife is a farmer. 

Nzailu owns a boutique and has been in this business for the last nine years. He is able to meet the needs of his family from this business.

This marks his sixth loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase dresses and shirts for resale to his customers. He plans to us the anticipated profits to expand his business. His dream is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: purchase dresses and shirts for resale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 49 years old, married and has four adult children. Wilma makes food, especially snacks known as "biko" made of malagkit rice and coconut milk, to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to their financial services. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC) and is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to purchase materials for housing repair.

This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for housing repair

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao M. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Norng Chea, got married in 2000 and have three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sreymao is a weaver. Her husband has been a weaver for a month, a skill he learned from his wife. Sreymao is asking for a loan of $1,000 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for weaving business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel  casado con la Sra. Elsa hace 20 años que viven en Sombrerito donde tienen su parcela y trabajan agricultura juntamente con su esposa y sus hijos, también se dedican a la ganadería y en agricultura siembra papa, maíz y arroz. Todo lo que cosecha, el lo saca a la venta en el mercado mas cercano, su esposa es quien le ayuda con lo que es la comercialización de sus productos, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de papa y también para lo que implica  el preparado de la tierra, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el poyo brindado.
texts.en:
Daniel is married to Elsa and for twenty years they have lived in Sombrerito where they have a plot of land which they farm.  Daniel lives with his wife and children.  He grows potatoes, corn and rice and he also raises livestock.  He sells all the crops that he harvests in the nearest market.  His wife helps him to sell his produce.

Daniel will use the money from his loan to buy potato seeds and to prepare his land for sowing.  He is a very hard-working person who is always thinking of his family's well-being.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Togetherness” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahim C. is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have one child. Ibrahim has been a businessman for 6 years now. He sells groundnuts/peanuts. With his share of this loan, he will buy groundnuts/peanuts wholesale to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts/peanuts wholesale.

loans.name: Jannete

texts.en:
Jannete C. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 32 years old and married. To make a living, Jannete owns and operates a direct selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics products in the local community. Jannete has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jannete joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jannete is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jannete from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 30 years old and is married with three children between one and six years old.  She earns a living by selling products such as cassava and sorghum. Leonie has been successfully running her business for ten years. Her business is well-organized and she currently employs one person to help her. Leonie works from seven in the morning until six at night every day except Saturday.

Leonie has requested a Kiva loan through the Vision Finance Company to buy more sacks of cassava and sorghum. By expanding her business and increasing her inventory, Leonie hopes to earn more profits. Leonie will save her profits for the future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cassava and sorghum

loans.name: Leya

texts.en: Leya is currently in the business of selling maize grain. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children, only one of whom goes to school. Leya has taken a loan to stock more maize grain to sell.  In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ledy

texts.es:
María es una mujer soltera de 48 años, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe), ubicada en el departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona caracterizada por desarrollar la actividada grícula, ganadera y turística.

María desde hace unos 2 años labora en el cafetín de un molina preparando y vendiendo comida para los trabajadores de ese lugar.  Labor que le ayuda a  tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos diarios.

Por eso María a solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de utensilios (ollas, platos, cubiertos, etc.) de cocina que le hacen falta para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela.

María trata todos los días que con su esfuerzo y trabajo tener mayores ingresos para cumplir el sueño de poder tener más adelante su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48 year old, single woman.  She lives in her relatives’ house, which has the basic services (water, electricity, and drainage).  The house is in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is noted for developing its agricultural, livestock, and tourist business activities.

For two years Maria has been working in a cafeteria at a mill.  She prepares and sells food to the workers in this area.  The work helps her to have income in order to be able to pay for her daily expenses.

That is why Maria is requesting a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativo.  She will buy kitchen utensils (pots, plates, and cutlery, etc.) that she needs to continue providing her customers with good service.

Maria tries every day so that with effort and work she will have greater income.  She wants greater income to be able to make her dream come true, which is to later on have her own restaurant.


.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba makes porridge from millet to sell at Kwaprow, near Abura in Cape Coast. The porridge is normally served in the early hours of the morning. She is married and has four children. As a supportive wife, she helps to pay the utility bills of the home. Her loan will be used to buy millet, sugar, milk, salt, pepper and other ingredients which will enable her make the porridge for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, milk, salt, pepper and other ingredients, which will enable her make the porridge for sale.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en: Nyamjav is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia.  His wife is a student.  He manages a transportation service business between Ulaanbaatar city and the border with China.  He started his business in 2009 and is planning to continue it in the future.  He is a polite man who is planning to have an apartment for his family.  He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 39 years old and is married with three children. He earns about $875 each cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines. He grows rice and has been doing so for ten years.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizers to ensure better crop production.

In the future, Efren hopes to generate more income in order to educate all his children and assure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Cruz Encarnacion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Cruz, tiene 42 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  20 y 13 años  de edad, el menor estudia en colegio, sus dos hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.  En ella trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados, nos cuenta que aunque su tienda es pequeña ella allí tiene de todo ya que así sus clientes no se van a comprar en otra parte.  Tiene más de diez años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y aumentarlo  cada día más.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chimborazo” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commercial activity, its traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the cheerfulness of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Cruz. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children (ages 20 and 13). Her younger child is in high school and both children live at home. Her husband is a merchant.

Cruz has a general store in her home where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other items. She works every day from 6am until 8pm, and sometimes much later. Her children help with the business whenever they are not busy. Even though her store is small, she says her customers can find whatever they need and do not plan to shop anywhere else. Cruz has been in business for more than 10 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to restock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats, and other basic necessities. Cruz has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and likes the fact that she has made many friends within her group. Her goals are to continue with her business and expand it each day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en: Savun, 41 year old, is a fisherman. His wife makes fish paste to sell. Their income is $11 per day. He has five children. Three of the children are studying, one is working and one more fishes with him. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $40 on school fees. He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fishing equipment for doing fishing. He has a plan for his wife to buy clothes to sell in the market so that she can make more income than in her previous career. Then they would be able to send the rest of their children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is a 26-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children ages six and seven. Her husband owns a bar selling beer.

For the past 10 years, she has been selling vegetables. The profits from this business have enabled her to take care of her children.

She will use this loan to purchase more vegetables that she will sell for a profit.  She plans to save her future profits to be able to provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Djidiankola Bougoula Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DJIDIANKOLA BOUGOULA II sont des femmes mariées âgées en moyennes de 39 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, AÏDA, debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de  40.000 F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group DJIDIANKOLA BOUGOULA II are married women who average 39 years of age and five children each. The women live in polygamous families in Kafla, a village of the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their first collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, AÏDA, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends to buy farm inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold locally at the village market and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. AÏDA plans on making a profit of 40,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food production business. Chona has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah has made a living selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 35 years old, single and the mother of three school-age children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and is now applying for her first loan. She plans to use it to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and someday own a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, province of Isabela. She is 60 years old. Simplicia is married and has three adult children. 

Simplicia makes general household furniture and sells it to local businesses and community members. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase raw materials like nail, varnish, wood and wood glue for her furniture to make additional income. 

Simplicia is requesting 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy nails, varnish, wood and wood glue for her furniture business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha,  Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez ensino superior e pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa. 

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane para dar continuidade com os seus estudos, trabalha como docente no Ministerio da Educação ha mais de 19 anos  e tem um salario de 7.395.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria .
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 30.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, ferro, pedra e outros).
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo, in southern Mozambique. A married mother of two school attending  children. She completed secondary education and intends to continue her studies.  She lives in her own home with her family and sustains her mother by sending some money to help with household expenses.

She left Namaacha for Boane to continue with her studies. She has worked as a lecturer at the Ministry of Education for over 19 years and has a monthly salary of 7.395.00 meticais (MZN) which she applies to household expenses and some savings to her bank account.

She has never had loans in other banks. She heard of Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 30.000.00 meticais (MZN) with which she would buy material to work on her home (sand, cement, iron, stone and other).

She has agreed to repay the loan without issue and looks to the future to complete her home for the comfort of her family.  She hopes to ask for future loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy material to work on her home (sand, cement, iron, stone and other).

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким  возраст 57 лет.  У Хакима большая семья, сын которого женил, живет с ними, жена работая медсестрой получает маленькую зарплату. Он имеет  собственную столовую где готовит вкусные шашлыки. В бизнесе ему помогает сын.  Эта столовая находится в центре города, у него много клиентов, потому  он готовит вкусные и отменные шашлыки, бизнес приносит хорошую прибыль. Хакиму нужно женить второго сына, но пока для него нет отдельного дома и денег на строительство мало, поэтому он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 10000 сомони и обещает в срок погасить. Хаким надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Hakim is 57 years old.  He has a large family - a son, who just got married, lives with them, and wife, who is a nurse, earns a small salary.  Hakim has his own cafe, where he cooks delicious shish kabobs.  His son helps him in this business.  This cafe is located in the town center, Hakim has many customers because he cooks delicious and excellent shish kabobs, and the business yields a good profit.  Hakim needs to marry off his second son, but does not yet have a separate house for him and has little money for construction.  This is why he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 somoni and promises to repay it on-time.  Hakim relies on your support.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Abarondezi K1 Group

texts.fr:
Beatrice est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite  au Quartier Kibenga de la Mairie de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle vend des habits pour enfants depuis 2 ans. Elle était fonctionnaire de l’Etat avant de commencer cette activité. Elle est détentrice du Diplôme A2 en Banque et Assurance. Elle est mariée a André, un fonctionnaire, et ont ensemble 4enfants qui étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 350,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’habits pour enfants à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et ainsi accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« ABARONDEZI 1»
texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old trader who lives in Kibenga neighborhood, in Bujumbura.  She has been selling children's clothes for two years.  Before starting this business she worked as a civil servant.  She has an A2 diploma in Banking and Insurance.  She is married to André, a civil servant, and they have four children who are in school.

Beatrice will use her Kiva loan for 350,000 Burundian francs to increase her capital and buy lots of children's clothes for resale.  This will make her good profits and she will thereby increase her savings.

Beatrice is a member of the 'Abarondezi 1' community bank.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Henry Uriel

texts.es: El señor Henry de 40 años de edad, es originario  de la comunidad llamada el Zapote localizada en Limay municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene 4 hijos de 21,17 ,12 ,2 años de edad respectivamente, todos ellos están estudiando excepto su hijo mas pequeño. Don Henry  es comerciante y agricultor. El oficio de agricultor lo aprendió  desde muy pequeño pues su padre le enseño  a sembrar, el estudio hasta tercer año de la secundaria, ya que se dedico a trabajar, se caso , el mantiene a su familia. Hoy en día tiene su terreno propio donde siembra hortalizas tales como tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, granos básicos y se dedica a la crianza de ganado esta actividad es su segunda fuente ingresos pues a veces las ventas de la hortalizas son bajas y con la venta de ganado se ayuda para pagar los gastos y mejorar los ingresos. El requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento de su finca, comprar herramientas tales como chapia, alambres, compra de semilla para mejorar el pasto para el ganado. Este inversión le ayudara  a poner cerco alrededor de su finca, comprar semillas para pastos y mejorarlas condiciones de crianza y calidad  de su ganado. Su principal meta es garantizarles el alimento y estudios a sus hijos, seguir trabajando cada día para mejorar poco a poco su finca.
texts.en:
Sr. Henry is 40 years old and originally from the community of Zapote, which is located in Limay in the town of Estelí. He is married and has four children (ages 21, 17, 12, and 2). All of them are studying except for his youngest child. Don Henry is a merchant and farmer. He learned how to farm at a young age from his father, who taught him how to plant crops. Henry studied through the third year of high school. He has been dedicated to his work ever since he got married because it helps him to support his family. Today Henry has his own land on which he grow vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, peppers, as well as basic grains. He also raises cattle as a second source of income whenever his vegetable sales are low. Selling cattle help to pay his expenses and improve his income.

Henry is requesting a loan so that he can maintain his farm. He plans to buy supplies such as weed killer, barbed wire, and seeds to improve the pastures for his cattle. This investment will help him put up a fence around his farm, buy seeds for his pastures, and improve the development and quality of his cattle. His main goal is to feed and educate his children. Therefore, Henry wants to continue working each day to gradually improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, barbed wire, and grass seed so that he can improve his farm.

loans.name: Alfonso Daniel

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 39 años,  está casado con Carmen de 33 años. El  es albañil  y su señora es artesana. Ambos, por medio de sus esfuerzos comparten los gastos del hogar. 
Alfonso se dedica a la albañilería, hace más de 15 años. Aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien se fue a trabajar en la Argentina después de terminar sus estudios secundarios. 
Actualmente tiene su propia casa, hace como diez años sus trabajos los realiza en forma independiente y con sus propios recursos, hoy en día está trabajando con él un primo a quien le enseña el oficio. Alfonso es muy conocido en la zona por la buena calidad de las obras que hace. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una heladera con la que quiere equipar su casa, ya que es muy necesaria para ellos. El dice que le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
Alfonso is 39 years old and married to Carmen, age 33. He is a bricklayer and his wife is an artisan. Both of them, through their efforts, share in the household expenses.

Alfonso has been a bricklayer for more than 15 years. He learned this trade from his uncle and traveled with him to Argentina for work after he finished high school.

Alfonso currently has a home, which he acquired with his own resources after working independently for 10 years. Today he is working with one of his cousins who is learning the trade. Alfonso is well-known in the area because of the high-quality work that he does.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a refrigerator for his home, which his family needs. He says this will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his home.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 46 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells timber and makes furniture. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber for resale, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and pay school fees for children. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to buy an electrical machine for the timber. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor José Ángel es una persona que se desempeña como fontanero para llevar el bienestar a su hogar y ha logrado mantener a su familia  y así darle una buena condición de vida. Él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona de buenos valores morales, es casado con tres personas a su cargo.

Se presentó en esta oficina de Ceprodel el señor  José Ángel a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como cerámica, verja, puerta y mano de obra, para acondicionar mejor su vivienda y así mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Ángel works as a plumber in the city of Managua to take care of his household and he has managed to support his family and give them a good quality of life.  He is known for being a person with good moral values.  He is married with three people to support.

José Ángel came to Ceprodel's offices to ask for a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He needs this loan to buy construction materials such as ceramic, railings, a door, and labor, to better fit out his home and thereby improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his home by buying construction materials

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. She earns an income by selling garlic to her customers for food production. She buys garlic bulbs from wholesalers and then peels the outer layer of garlic before selling. She has done this since 2004. 

Tuyet is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling..

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: La señora Yanet a sus 34 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad,  gracias al negocio que tiene desde el año 2006 en el cual vende mercancía, minutos, alimentos y bebidas ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Con el propósito de mejorar la variedad de los productos ofrecidos en su negocio, la señora Yanet requiere de la compra de surtido con el cual incentive sus ventas y las mejore puesto que el invierno ha afectado sus ingresos. El sueño de la señora Yanet es poder brindarle a sus hijos educación y tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Ms. Yanet is 34 years old and the mother of two children, ages 17 and 10. Thanks to the business she has had since 2006 - where she sells merchandise, cell phone minutes, groceries, and beverages - she has managed to get her family ahead. The winter has affected her profits, so with the goal of improving the variety of products offered in her store, Yanet needs to purchase an assortment of products to encourage and improve sales. Yanet's dream is to be able to offer her children an education and to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks, snacks, and sweets

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El sr. Reynaldo es un cliente antiguo y muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, el sr. Se dedica a la confección de pantalones de tela que al mismo tiempo lo comercializa en la zona de Sebastián en un puesto fijo que el tiene, en la visita que realizamos pudimos observar que es una persona muy cordial y respetuoso también  dedicado a su trabajo lo cual demuestra que es responsable a la hora de cancelar sus cuotas, el sr. Reynaldo vive en la zona  alto Chijini, solicita el crédito para comprar mas telas para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de pantalones que por la temporada de fin de año lo comercializara en algunas ferias de la ciudad de el alto como ser la feria 16 de julio.
texts.en: Reynaldo is an old customer, who very responsibly makes his installment payments. He works tailoring pants to sell them in a fixed stand in Sebastian district. During our evaluation, we saw that he is a very friendly, respectful person and committed to his job, which means he is also very responsible to make his installment payments. Reynaldo lives in Alto Chijini district. He is requesting this loan to buy more fabric to tailor a greater amount of pants to sell in some fairs in the city during the end of year season, for instance in the 16th of July fair.

loans.use: to buy fabric for end of year season.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old and lives in  Oroquieta City. She is married with five  children. 

Emma has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. 

Emma has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase feed and renovate the cages of her sows.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She started a hair salon in Kiserian town in 2003. She started by plaiting hair and her main customers were school going children and young secondary school girls. In 2004 she joined church road Women Group that works with WEEC. She attended the initial training before receiving a loan. After the training, she was given a loan of USD 117. She bought braids and cosmetics for hair treatment. She improved her work very well and customers increased and kept coming back. She paid up her loan with ease and received another of loan of $200, which she used to buy a drier and cosmetics. She worked hard and paid it too, right now she has two driers and employs one person who assists her in all the work. Mean while, she is building a semi-permanent house in Rongai and its being funded by the business. She is looking forward to a beautiful home and a prosperous business if this kind of assistance is continuously given.

loans.use: Catherine wants to buy different types of hair weaves, wigs, shampoos and other beauty products.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with a grown son. She supports the essential needs of her household by running a small business selling tea and coffee in a busy city market. Currently, Nina has over $3,000 of working capital in her business and her monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Nina is very patient and polite. Her commitment to good business and her natural friendliness attract many potential clients. A variety of quality teas and coffees also makes her kiosk a popular stop for passing customers. Not long ago Nina faced big challenges due to the reconstruction of the local market where she had a kiosk. However, these difficulties didn’t stop her. On the contrary, Nina continued to work hard investing her time and efforts in the growth of her business. Today she owns two kiosks and her business is continuously expanding. Nina is requesting a loan of $1,200 to help open a new kiosk in the market and to allow her to purchase additional tea and coffee from wholesalers where she can get a good price. This loan will help to significantly boost Nina’s revenue and grow her business, further improving the quality of life for her and her family.

Ніна – одружена, в неї дорослий син. Забезпечувати основні потреби родини їй допомагає власний бізнес з продажу чаю та кави. Ніна працює на одному з місцевих ринків. Зараз загальна сума в товарі у неї складає більше 3000 доларів. Розмір чистого прибутку досягає 1000 доларів. Ніна – дуже терпляча та ввічлива. Її відданість власній справі та природна привітність приваблюють багато потенційних покупців. Розмаїття якісного чаю та кави притягують увагу перехожих на ринку. Нещодавно Ніна стикнулася з певними труднощами, пов’язаними з реконструкцією місцевого ринку, де був розташований її кіоск. Однак, ці випробування не зупинили її. Навпаки, Ніна продовжувала наполегливо працювати, вкладаючи час та гроші в розвиток власного бізнесу. Зараз вона володіє двома кіосками, її бізнес поступово зростає. Ніна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити новий кіоск на ринку. Вона планує закупити додаткову партію чаю та кави оптом за помірними цінами. Позика значно підвищить прибутки Ніни та сприятиме подальшому розвитку її бізнесу, що, в свою чергу, якісно покращить життя її родини.

loans.use: To open a new kiosk in the market

loans.name: Tooa

texts.en: Tooa, 37, lives with her extended family in a small seaside village in Samoa.  Prior to joining the SPBD program, she operated a small business comprised of four beach fales on a white sand beach.  (Fales are small, open huts with thatched roofs built in the style of the traditional Samoan house.)  Tooa has used a previous loan to expand her fales.  However, Tooa believes that in order to compete in this tourist market, she will need to renovate her fales and add more guest services.  Thus, she is applying for an additional loan and hoping with this reinvestment she can attract more backpackers and tourists to her beach fales.

loans.use: Build additional beach fales

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en: Maseray is thirty-seven years old and has six children. Her husband assists her with the business and the couple work together to provide the family with a better livelihood.  Maseray sells palm oil, soft drinks and cold water in Mogburaka town of Sierra Leone and diversified her business with her first loan from SMT.  She is seeking her second loan to further expand her business, make more profit increasing her income.  Maseray says, “With six children, I need to work hard to provide them with basic necessities otherwise they will not grow up well”.  Meseray and her husband are determined to provide their children with best they can.

loans.use: Increase her diversified inventory of food stuffs

loans.name: Atanasia

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs. Atanasia emigrated 20 years ago from city in the interior called Caazapá.  She is married tp Yellow Ismael, who is employed in the  sale of footwear. The pair has 5 children, three women and two men, all of them already have finished its secondary studies and nowadays they work of independent, except one, who aids in taking care of the business. 

All in the family collaborate in paying the expenses of the home. Their store is has been in existence since 1992 in a very populated district of the city of Luque.   With the aid of one of their daughters to take care of the business. The successive loans that it has obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation allowed them to improve their store in buying the furniture and the merchandise that it sells. The loan that it asks for will invest it in buying sugar, rice, meat, vegetables and other merchandises that they greatly need.  


ORIGINAL SPANISH
La señora Atanasia emigró hace 20 años de una ciudad del interior llamado Caazapá, ella está casada con Ismael Amarilla,  quien se dedica a la venta de calzados. La pareja tiene 5 hijos, tres mujeres y dos hombres, todos ellos ya han terminado sus estudios secundarios y hoy día trabajan de forma independiente, excepto una, quien la ayuda atendiendo el negocio. Todos en la familia colaboran para la manutención del hogar.
