Su despensa se halla  funcionando desde el año 1992 en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Luque. Sus mercaderías son bien surtidas y sus clientes son vecinos del lugar. Cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hijas para atender el negocio. Los sucesivos créditos que ha obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya le permitió mejorar su despensa desde comprar el mobiliario y las mercaderías que ella vende.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar carbón en cantidad, azúcar, arroz, carne, verduras y otras mercaderías de primera necesidad.

loans.use: Compra de carbón en cantidad, azúcar, arroz, carne, verduras

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
My name is Julia H. and I have dedicated myself to the production and sale of tortillas for the past 3 years. This line of business is very good since tortillas are an indispensable part of our community’s diet. Currently, I would like to increase inventory and production in order to grow sales. With the additional earnings I wish to provide for my family having 2 children that I desire to care for and provide education.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Julia H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realizo hace 3 años, dicha actividad es muy buena ya que la tortilla es un alimento indispensable en nuestra comunidad, en estos momentos necesito incrementar mi inventario y produccion para tener unas mejores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia ya que tengo 2 hijos a los cuales tengo que darles alimento y estudio.

loans.use:
Purchase of maiz, lyme, salt, firewood and matches

compra de maiz, cal, sal, leña, fosforos.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis saw that in his home his family was lacking money to pay all the household expenses and the school costs of his four children. For this reason he decided to become independent and form his own business. At first he worked with his father for a laundry-mat, but over time he saw that having his own business would give him more earnings and this is why he came to be independent. He started a little laundry-mat and added a repair service since many of his clients come in to the store without hems on their pants.

Nevertheless, each time more, his clients bring their clothes to him, and his few washing machines are insufficient to clean his orders with the rapidness that they deserve. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $375 that he is willing to pay back in a period of five months. With this money Jorge will be able to buy a second-hand washer that will help him finish his orders in less time. With your help Jorge will be able to improve his business and at the same time benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Jorge Luis vio que en su casa estaba faltando dinero para pagar lodos los gastos de la casa y para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus cuatro hijos. Es por esto que decide independizarse y formar su propio negocio. En un inicio trabajaba con su papá con una lavandería, sin embargo al paso del tiempo vio que tener el negocio él solo le dejaría más rendimiento y fue así como consiguió poder independizarse. Y puso una pequeña lavandería en dónde agregó el servicio de reparación, puesto que mucho clientes van con pantalones sin vastillas.

Sin embargo cada vez más, los clientes van llevando ropa y las pocas lavadoras que tienen no rinden lo suficiente como para tener sus pedidos con la rapidez que se merecen. Por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá comprar una lavadora de segunda mano que le servirá para poder terminar sus pedidos en menor tiempo. Con tu ayuda Jorge podrá sacar adelante su negocio y al mismo tiempo a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase a second-hand washing machine.

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.es:
Maria S. has lived in Huascar 25 years, she is a mother of 7 (two of them underaged and in school). Her children are her life force and the reason she wants to improve her business daily. Her first business venture was selling coal, and later with the initiative of her two eldest sons opened a sewing shop.

They currently have five machines which allow them to sew clothes and provide other services. To be able to reach their objectives, they need to purchase 10 sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase machinery

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German works as a public employee filling the roles of messenger and file clerk. He earns a salary with which he supports himself and his eldery mother. He lives in the Río Seco zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan is necessary in order to buy doors and windows for his small family home; the purchase will improve the family's comfort.

This is German's first loan with IMPRO. The evalation carried out on his loan application has qualified him for approval of the requested loan. This loan falls under IMPRO's Social Housing program.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

German trabaja como empleado público desempeñando funciones de mensajero y auxiliar de archivos; percibe un sueldo con el que se mantiene él y su madre que es de la tercera edad; vive en la Zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito es requerido para comprar puertas y ventanas y concluir su pequeña vivienda familiar y contar con mayor comodidad de hábitat.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le faculta para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el prestatario. Este crédito cae bajo nuestro programa de Vivienda social.

loans.use: Purchase of doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: Orfelinda's Group

texts.en:
Orfelinda and Lucinda have been members of the community bank “Cocharcas” for eight months. Through their community bank they have learned how to have a healthy relationship with their children, how to avoid domestic violence, and to save.

Orfelinda is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children aged six and four. Orfelinda has been selling cheeses for one year from a cart outsiD. of the central market on the Ayacucho. In addition, Orfelinda knits beautiful sweaters that she sells at the markets in Ayacucho. Orfelinda is thinking of opening a business selling food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar from her home.

Lucinda is 42 years old. She lives with her partner and has four children. Lucinda sells cebiche, a typical dish maD. from marinating fish in lemon juice. She has been selling cebiche from one of the local markets for one year. Previously, Lucinda sold other foods at the market, but maD. a higher profit dedicating her self to cebiche. In addition, Lucinda also travels to the jungle region once every two weeks to sell fish.

Orfelinda and Lucinda need of 600, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil, soap, and fish.

Orfelinda and Lucinda dream of buying a car which they could use as a taxi, building a home, that their children will be professionals, and that their businesses will continue to grow.

loans.use: Orfelinda and Lucinda need of 600, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil, soap, and fish.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.es:
Ursulina A. was born in the city of Aregua in 1951, she has beautiful memories of her childhood and the city because it was the most beautiful city at that time. She tells us about the time when she had to come to the city to live with her husband and three kids: Norma who's 35 years old, Juan is 33 and Alfredo is 29.

Nowadays, after raising her three kids with lots of effort and beautiful memories. Ursulina owns a small mart which is her main source of income. Although her children don't want her to work, she refuses because she doesn't want to feel inept.

In her shop, she sells all sorts of products such as: dairy products, meats, breads, vegetables (onions, tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, oils, fruits).

Ursulina is a longtime member of Fundacion, she used to belong to a women's entrepreneur group. Thanks to her punctuality and responsibility on the bills she was able to receive more credits.

Nowadays she wishes to get more goods and this way get a better deal and increase her supply. Her clients' demands get higher and higher every day.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer./b>

Ursulina A. nació en la ciudad de Aregua en el año 1951, ella tiene bellos recuerdos de su infancia y de su ciudad pues era la ciudad más bella y floreciente de esa época. Cuenta que cuando se caso tubo que venir a la ciudad de Luque a vivir con su esposo, con quien tuvo tres hijos: Norma de 35, Juan de 33 y Alfredo de 29.

Hoy día, y luego de haber criado a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ella los ve realizados y con sus respectivas familias; Ursulina posee una pequeña despensa que es su fuente de ingreso, y aunque sus hijos no quieren que ella trabaje pues prefieren ellos darle sustento, Ursulina se niega a dejar de trabajar pues dice que se sentiría inútil.

En su despensa, ella comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como: carnes, lácteos, panificados, verduras como: cebollas, tomates, morrones así como también frutas de estación; entre otras cosas.

Ursulina es antigua cliente de la Fundación, ya que anteriormente formo parte de un grupo solidario de mujeres emprendedoras y gracias a su puntualidad y responsabilidad en los pagos logro obtener créditos personales.

Hoy día ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías para así obtener buenos descuentos y surtir su despensa ya que la demanda de los clientes es cada vez mas exigente.

loans.use: Purchase of foods such as: meats, dairy products, breads, vegetables (onions, tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, oils, fruits)

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is a married man with three children. He is the owner of a well-stocked general store in one of the busiest areas of the city, Caacupe, which he manages day-to-day with the help of his wife.

His business is located out of his household, and with this loan from the Paraguay Foundation, he will use one part to finish the floor of his business, and the other part to buy merchandise such as beer, sodas, meat, oil, flour, sugar, wine, crackers/cookies, coffee, and yerba, among other necessary products.

Miguel comments that sales have slowed a bit, perhaps because in February and March, there are costs around school supplies, school enrollment, and uniforms.

The sales that never falter are the drinks, and each weekend, there are high sales of these products, especially weekends in which the temperature is high.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel, es un señor casado y tiene 3 hijos, es dueño de una despensa bien surtida y equipada, en unos de los barrios más poblados de la ciudad de Caacupé, la atención de la misma lo realiza con su señora quien día a día lo apoya y conjuntamente administran el negocio.

Su despensa esta úbicada en su domicilio y con el préstamo que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, una parte lo invirtió en la terminación del piso del negocio y la otra parte en la compra de mercaderías como cervezas, gaseosas, carnes, aceite, harina, azúcar, vino, galletas, café, yerba, entre otros productos de primera necesidad.

Comenta Miguel que últimamente las ventas disminuyeron un poco, quizas porque los meses de febrero y marzo son temporadas donde los gastos familiares se orientan más a la compra de útiles, pagos de inscripción, compras de uniformes, etc.

No obstante el rubro que nunca disminuye es el de las bebidas y cada fin de semana se registra buen movimiento en la venta de estos productos y especialmente los fines de semana cuando la temperatura es muy elevada.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba, milk, soda, meat, and all kinds of drinks.

loans.name: Rebeca Cirila

texts.es:
Rebeca belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” and she prepares food in the market of Yungay, located in Yungay district and province.

With the S/.2,500 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 8 payments, she will buy kerosene, 2 sacks of rice, 2 bags of noodles, 2 bags of sugar and meat for the week.

She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children, and they both work so that their business may continuously grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rebeca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta D. alimentos en el mercado del distrito y provincia D. Yungay.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará una cocina a kerosene, 2 sacos D. arroz, 2 bolsas D. fideos, 2 bolsos D. azúcar y carne para una semana

Ella tienen 38 años D. edad, es casada con 2 hijos, ambos trabajan para que su negocio sea cada vez más granD..

loans.use: Purchase supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Sabohat M. lives in Rudaki. She lives with her family. She is married and has one child. To provide for the family, she and her husband are engaged in trade. They sell clothes in the Korvon market. To increase their product turnover, she wants to take out a loan for 750 US dollars for 12 months. This will help to increase the profitability of her business and will help to improve living conditions for her child.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Махмадалиева Сабохат проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Чтобы обеспечить свою семью они с мужем занимаются торговлей. Торгуют на рынке «Корвон» одеждой. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит в размере 750долларов США со срокос в 12 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить доходность ее бизнеса и поможет улучшить условия жизни для ее ребенка.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and enlarge her business

loans.name: Mwatum's Imani Group

texts.en:
Mwatum is 50 years old. She is married and she has 4 children aged between 19 and 32 years old. She has been selling firewood and food items since 1988. Every day, she works at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwatum is requesting a loan to buy more firewood and food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Masheli.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and food items for her business

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha A., 46, is married and has three children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, and so forth. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, and other items to increase her sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to pay for her kids' education.  She would be thankful for that support. She belongs to the group called Gospel Light Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee to repay the loan for one another.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat N., 47, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. Working in the recycling business together with her husband, Pat N. typically makes around US$2 per day. Pat N. sees room for expansion for her current business, and she has approached CREDIT to receive a loan of US$350 to purchase more recyclable items to resell at the recycling plant. Pat N. sees this loan as a good investment in her business as well as a way to increase her family's income. She is very confident that the business venture will be successful, and that her family will be able to raise its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of recyclable items for re-sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina S. is 37 years old. She is married with one child who is currently in school. She is a supplier and a trader who trades in bulk foods stuff like bags of onions and beans and supplies them to her customers at the busy market of Ashaiaman where she lives. Amina treks to the some of the West African countries like Benin to purchase her goods. She needs the loan to buy more stock to scale up the business. She wants to buy more bags of beans and onions to increase her inventory. She hopes to double her savings to take care of her kid in school.

She belongs to the community group called ‘So mu yie’ (handle with care) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and onions.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 37 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos y vive junto a su esposo quien L. apoya mucho en su negocio. Se dedica a L. compra y venta D. repuestos para maquinaria pesada, actividad que viene realizando desD. hace seis años, lo que le gusta D. este trabajo es que conoce mucho D. repuestos y mecánica, además D. conocer muchas personas, le es rentable, porque este negocio es bueno, debido a que muchas personas requieren los repuestos que elL. tiene y son únicos en su zona. Le va bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local adecuado para exhibir sus repuestos D. mejor manera y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old, mother of four children, and lives with her husband who supports her very much in her business. She buys and sells parts for heavy equipment, a job she has had for 6 years. What she liks about this work is knowing a lot about the parts and mechanics, in addition to meeting many people. It is profitable and this business is good, due to many people need the parts that she has and they are the only parts in the area. Her business is going well. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the money she will build a locale in which she can better display her parts and proviD. a welcoming environment for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a locale for her business.

loans.name: Oluwaloju

texts.en: Oluwaloju sells snacks, drinks and bottled water. The demands for her goods are high. She has been in this business since 2004. Oluwaloju is 40 years old and married with four children. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more snacks, drinks and water to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more snacks, drinks and water to sell.

loans.name: Leocadio Casildo

texts.es: el Sr. Leocadio y su esposa Mary Cruz se dedican a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas como ser baleadas, tajaditas de platano, tortillas con quesillo, chilaquiles y otros, tambien los fines de semana vende nacatamales y sopas, su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Altos de Santa Rosa, el negocio es muy limpio y cuenta con mesas y sillas para darle una mejor atencion a sus clientes que a diario lo visitan para comer en su local, los clientes los prefieren a ellos porque son bien amables y tienen una atencion especial para sus clientes. ellos en estos momentos desean hacer crecer su negocio y estan solicitando un credito para poder hacerlo.
texts.en:
Leocadio and his wife Mary Cruz make and sell sweets, as well as baleadas (a Honduran tortilla filled with mashed, fried beans and possibly other ingredients), fried plantains, tortillas with cream cheese filling, chilaquiles (a fried corn tortilla dish with green or red salsa and other ingredients), amongst others. On weekends, they also sell Honduran tamales (called nacatamales) and soup. Their business is located in the Altos de Santa Rosa neighborhood. It is very clean and has tables and chairs in order to better serve the customers that return on a daily basis to eat on the premises. Their customers prefer them because they are very amiable and pay particular attention to their clients. At present, they wish to expand their business and are requesting a loan in order to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, oil, soft drinks, butter, plantains, beans, dairy products, tortillas and other products

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Julio es un cliente que trabaja con la institución desde el año 2006, Se dedica al transporte privado de taxi, para ello cuenta con 2 taxis uno lo maneja él y la otra movilidad la maneja un chofer contratado, los anteriores créditos que solicitó sirvieron para hacer el mantenimiento de sus movilidades, en esta ocasión el crédito lo utilizará en la construcción de un muro de contención para su casa, ya que por la temporada de lluvias que estamos cursando en el país existe el riesgo latente de los derrumbes, en especial en la zona en la que vive ya que es una ladera del cerro. Su esposa lo apoya con la venta de joyas por la zona y se ocupa de sus hijos, que están en edad escolar. Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Julio is a client who has worked with the institution since the year 2006. He dedicates himself to providing private taxi transportation, for which he relies on two taxis. He drives one himself, and hires a second driver for the other. The previous loans he requested served to help maintain his vehicles. On this occasion, the loan would be used to build a retaining wall for his home since, during the rainy seasons we are experiencing in the country there exists the risk of collapses. This is particularly true in the zone in which he lives which is on a mountainside. His wife supports him through the sale of jewelry and by caring for their school-aged children. They are a humble, but very hard-working, family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a retaining wall.

loans.name: Olipa A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Olipa M. from Tukuyu. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 13 and 25. Olipa has been running a bar since 2004. Her bar is a good place to chill with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Two employees assist her. Olipa currently earns about 200USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more crates of beer, soft drinks, and other drinks, like whisky, for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business in a new location. Olipa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer, soft drinks, and other drinks for her business

loans.name: Samalaulu

texts.en: Samalaulu Falono is forty-three years old and married with six children.  She has five years of experience in the banana plantation business. She sells to the general public four days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $50.  SPBD loans are Samalaulu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, herbicides, fertilizer, a weedeater, plant sprayer and bushknives.

loans.name: Salmina Group

texts.en:
Mwanapili has been a juice seller and the owner of a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to the Salmina group loan (Group code 2019). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwanapili is 35 years old, married, and has three children, aged 12, 10, and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwaka, Fatma and Amina. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are currently schooling. She is a supplier and a petty trader who trades in bulk foodstuffs like bags of millet and soya beans, and supplies them to her customers at the busy market of Kasoa, a local market where she lives.

Amina treks to the northern part of the country to purchase her goods. She needs the loan to buy more stock to scale up the business. She wants to buy more bags of beans, millet, groundnuts, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to double up on savings to take care of her kids in school. She belongs to the community group called Olivet Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans, millet, and groundnuts

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells foodstuffs, firewood and drinks. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with 8 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 120,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce depuis 1999 comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de jus de différentes sortes et des yaourts. Beaucoup de personnes aiment ses yaourts parce qu’elle le fait très bien, aussi  à la sortie des classes les élèves viennent se rafraîchir chez elle, de même que certains ouvriers qui travaillent à proximité du lieu d’exercice de son activité. Actuellement le congélateur qu’elle utilise pour rafraîchir ses jus est en panne, elle veut acheter un autre congélateur c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 1 congélateur.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Since 1999, this woman has been earning an income from selling different kinds of juices and yoghurts. Many people like her yoghurt products because she does a good job making them. Plus, when classes are over, students come to her for refreshments, just like certain laborers who work near where she operates. Right now, the freezer she uses for cooling her juices is broken down. She wants to buy another freezer. This is why she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Roshan Liqa Group

texts.en: This is the Roshan Liqa group. It is made up of five members. All of them would like to increase their businesses. Saher wants to take a loan for her beauty salon to buy new and good quality cosmetics. Naqibullah wants to take a loan for his house repairing. Habibullah would like to take a loan for his burger shop to buy the essential materials for his shop. Wahida would like to take a loan for a tailoring business to buy a new machine and other supplies. S. Bebe wants to take a loan for a carpet weaving business. They all have requested a loan of 50000 Afghani to complete their necessities. Besides, they would like to improve their business and bring changes in life.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Juliana Aurora

texts.es:
Juliana  es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Juliana es madre soltera tiene dos hijos  de 21 y 11 años el mayor estudia en una universidad  estatal y el ultimo en la escuela estatal.
Juliana trabajaba en un taller de archivadores dejo el trabajo por que su hijo sufre de asma y constantemente le daban crisis de asma  y ya no le daban permiso, decidió poner un negocio en su casa empezó con una vitrina  vendiendo dulces en su casa, poco a poco fue creciendo, y   las empresas fueron llevando maquinas exhibidoras.
Desde que Juliana esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, antes no  lo asía.   
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.
El sueño de Juliana  es tener un minimarket en su casa.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Juliana is a single mother. She has two children; they are 21 and 11. The older attends the state university, and the younger goes to the state school. Juliana worked in a file cabinet factory. She left work because her son, who suffers from asthma, had constant asthma attacks, and they would not let her leave. She decided to set up a business in her house. She started with a display case selling sweets in her house. Little by little the business was growing, and the business got coolers. Since Juliana has been with Finca she has learned to save. She did not do that before. Juliana needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy groceries to stock her store. Juliana’s dream is to have a mini market in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Lauao

texts.en: Lauao T. is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Malie J3. She is married and has seven school-aged children. Lauao owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 270 WST a month. In 2009, Lauao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start working on his land

loans.name: Denisse Paola

texts.es:
Denisse V. vive en anticrítico en la calle Canónigo Ayllón de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como asesora jurídica en una empresa, el crédito que solicita es para realizar una maestría ya que es egresada de la carrera de derecho y de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos para poder mantenerse.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un credito.
texts.en:
Denisse V. lives on the street Canónigo Ayllón of the Alto San Pedro area in the city of La Paz through a land-pawn rental agreement. She works as a legal adviser in a company. The loan Denisse is asking for will be used towards a master's degree since she already has a degree in law. In this way, she will be able to increase her earnings and support herself. She is not an Impro customer but because of the social nature of the loan, she is able to have access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Graduate Studies (Master's)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda M. is a 65-year-old married woman who strives to provide her family with a better life, ensuring that they are free from poverty. She is married to Eduardo M., who worked as a laborer in a sugarcane plantation. They have eight children: six of them already have their own families and only two still live at home. The family lives in the village of Brgy. San Juan, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.

Before she went into business, Erlinda also worked in the sugarcane plantation with her husband so that they could earn enough to feed their family of ten. But working in the sugarcane fields is very hard work, with long hours for very low wages and few benefits, and it took her away from home leaving her children to fend for themselves. Watching her children grow, Erlinda thought about their future and realized that if the family did not earn more income, she and her husband could never afford to send the children to school and provide them with a better future. This is why she decided to put up a small general store next to her house, using some of her salary from the sugarcane plantation. However, because her capital was very limited, she could only sell a few products.

To access more capital, Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, and she immediately saw the impact of the additional 3,000 pesos she received from her first loan. She was able to buy more goods to sell and she noticed that the inventory turnover was faster, and she was able to earn more profits. So, as her income improved and NWTF-Project Dungganon allowed her to borrow larger amounts based on the cash flow estimates she presented in her proposal, she was able to expand her general store.

Her previous loan of 15,000 pesos was her twelfth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was able to pay off each weekly installment on time, and fully repaid the loan within the loan term. It earned her an average monthly income of 3,000 pesos. For her thirteenth loan cycle, she is asking to borrow another 15,000 pesos to use as working capital for her general store so that she can continue improving the life of her family.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Monte Rancho Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos, viven  en una zona muy alejada D. la ciudad, se conocen bien, no cuentan con servicios basicos, por ejemplo D. alcantarillado, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "MONTE RANCHO", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 5º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Rosa L. D. C. ,ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 3 hijos es casada su esposo y ella trabajan en su carpinteria. Como tesorera esta la socia Patricia S. V.  quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo tiene 3 hijos es casada, el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital en su tienda D. barrio. Como secretaria esta la socia Felisia C. M. es casada tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es albañil y ella elabora y venD. salteñas (empanadas) ambulando, el credito lo utiliza para mejoramiento del mismo.
texts.en:
This is a group that is very responsible with their payments. They live in an area very removed from the city and know each other well. They don't have basic services (sewer system, potable water, etc.) where they live. The group is called "Monte Rancho" ("Mountain Ranch) and is in its fifth loan cycle with its community bank. The group's board of directors consists as follows: Rosa is the president, and she is very responsible and the leader of the group. She is married, has three children and works in her carpentry shop. The treasurer is Patricia, who is also a very responsible mother of three children and is knowledgeable in the handling of money. She will use the loan to raise capital for her neighborhood store. The secretary is Felisia, who is a married mother of three children. Her husband is a construction worker, while she makes and sells empanadas outdoors. She will use the loan to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working captial

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Francisco Javier P. le está haciendo falta cambiar el piso ya que el que tiene actual mente es de vinil y está en muy malas condiciones, y quiere que su familia tenga su casa en buenas condiciones ya que es donde viven. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora, ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario.
Don Francisco trabaja en una compañía  de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de montacargas, es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
The vinyl floor in Mr. Francisco Javier P.'s house needs to be replaced with ceramic tile because it is in very bad condition and he wants his family to live in a house that has good living conditions. He is asking for this loan to buy building materials and to pay the person who will do the installation since he does not presently count with sufficient funds. Francisco is employed by a transportation company as a fork lift driver and he will use part of his salary to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change his vinyl floor to ceramic tile.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida tiene 56 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 3 hijos, D. los cuales, solo uno D. ellos vive en su casa.

Su esposo se dedica a la siembra D. zanahorias, espinacas y lechugas en sus propias chacras, pero como ella tiene dolencias en los pies no pueD. desplazarse con mucha facilidad y se limita a apoyarle en los trabajos D. menos esfuerzo.
Pero en temporada D. cosecha busca entre 5 a 8 personas para trabajar en sus chacras, a quienes les paga 15 soles diarios, incluido almuerzo. En esos días Aida prepara para todos el almuerzo y como tiene fama D. tener una muy buena sazón, todos quedan muy satisfechos.

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, ella es una cliente muy puntual y es quien presta su casa para todas las reuniones D. su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo va a utilizar en la compra D. fertilizantes químicos para que abone sus chacras D. hortalizas.
texts.en:
Aida, 56, is married to the father of her three children, of which, only one still lives at home with them. Her husband grows carrots, spinach and lettuces in his own farm but, because she suffers from foot pain, she is unable to get around very easily and is restricted to helping him only with the least strenuous chores. However, during harvest time, he hires 5-8 persons to work the fields for a salary of 15 soles a day each, including lunch. On those days, Aida prepares the lunch for all of them and, because she is famous for her tasty preparations, they are all very satisfied. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is a very punctual client and she lends her house for all the communal bank meetings. The funds requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to use on the vegetable crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends university and her two younger children both attend a local secondary school. Batbayar operates a clothing retail business out of a shipping container at a local market, where she sells both outer and under clothing. She began her business in 2000 in a rented stall at the local market. As her business grew, she was able to purchase a shipping container so that she could expand her product line. Currently, she travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, twice a month and purchases her products there. Batbayar says, “I am saving money for my children’s education. I want all of my children to be able to attend university.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a wide variety of clothes for her business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of clothes

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda S. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Rosenda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Rosenda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products and also selling daily-use products in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea E., 25, is married and lives with her two childrE. and husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has beE. in the business of selling vegetables since 2004 and is able to earn a gross income of $21 United States dollars (USD) per day. 

Her husband operates a business of selling greE. and ripe coconuts everywhere in the province, earning a gross income of $24 USD per day. This couple tries to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the childrE. and the family. 

Chea and her husband are seeking to improve their businesses. As a result, Chea is requesting a loan of $800 USD from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike to transport coconuts for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike in order to transport coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla Y. is from the village of Polo. She is 48 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosevilla owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling nipa hut products to local community members. Rosevilla has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2006, Rosevilla joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase farm supplies and materials to manufacture nipa hut products. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture nipa hut products. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC, and this is the second time she is being published in Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to manufacture nipa hut products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn N., age 41, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. (N.'s husband is pictured because N. was not available.) She has three children. She sells various kinds of vegetables at a local market in the province, earning approximately US $4.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially the cost of her children’s education. She has been in this business since 2005. Her husband is a butcher, earning a gross income of US $25 per day. Their standard of living has improved since she started her business, so she wants a loan to expand it. 

N. is requesting a loan of US $800 to buy pigs to slaughter for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene W. M. is 64, married with six children aged between 40 and 23. Her business is in Kianjao, near Kianjao primary school, in Thika, Kenya. (Thika is the region of Kenya known for the production of pineapples.) She has been selling such items as flour, cooking oil, sugar, tea, bread, milk, salt, etc. to the local people for the past ten years. She says that this business is profitable but her major challenge is customers who are not keen to pay the money on time. However she works very hard to keep her business going and will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more flour and sugar to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She is very hardworking and cheerful.

loans.use: Buy flour and sugar to sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina has a good relationship with LAPO. She has a restaurant where she sells mouth watering Nigerian cooked foods. Celina is very popular in her neighborhood for her delicious food. She hopes to own a classic restaurant in the future. She has been in this business for a long time. Celina is 50 years old and a widow with 4 children. Widowhood is very challenging to Celina and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita T. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Leonita is widowed and has 4 children. To make a living, Leonita owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling "RTW" or Ready-To-Wear items in the local community. Leonita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: María Susana

texts.es:
María Susana tiene 22 años y vive junto a su esposo en el sector Tranca Fanupe del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito que concentra a la mayoría de sus habitantes en zonas rurales que quedan dispersas, sus actividades principales son la agricultura y el comercio de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace aproximadamente dos años, ella cría aves de corral y cerdos en su vivienda para luego ofrecerlos en venta cada 15 dias en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo) adicionalmente los vende a los negociantes que visitan eventualmente la zona en donde vive. Este negocio le provee de ingresos que utiliza ayudando a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su familia, como es de mucha importancia ella trata de mantener la calidad de sus animales alimentándolos con polvillo (alimento para animales derivado del arroz) y pastos naturales.

La creciente demanda por los animales que ofrece en venta ha hecho que ella piense en ampliar su negocio, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de animales y alimento balanceado con los cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

María es una joven mujer que trabaja arduamente por brindarle a su recién establecida familia un futuro estable, su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante para ofrecerles a sus futuros hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen nos muestra una de sus cerdas que recientemente ha parido lechones.
texts.en:
María Susana, age 22, lives with her husband in the Tranca Fanupe sector of the district of Mórrope. This is a district in which most residents live in rural areas and are scattered. The principal businesses in the district are farming and the sale of animals. The district is part of Lambayeque Province and is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been raising and selling animals for approximately two years. She raises poultry and pigs at her home and offers them for sale every 15 days at the Moshoqueque Market (the wholesale market of Chiclayo). In addition, she sells them to traders who sometimes visit the area where she lives.

This business provides her with income that she uses in helping her husband with the support of the family. This is why it is very important for her to maintain the quality of her animals, feeding them with “polvillo” (an animal feed made from rice) and natural fodder.

The increase in demand for the animals she offers for sale has caused her to think about enlarging her business. For this reason she is applying to Epydme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 new soles. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of animals and nutritious feed which will allow her to succeed in meeting her goals.

María is a woman who works very hard to offer her recently established family a stable future. Her greatest wish is to continue getting ahead in order to offer her future children a better quality of life. In the photo she shows us one of her pigs, which has recently given birth to piglets.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and nutritious feed in order to enlarge her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen T. D. was born in 1983. She is married with three children. She lives in luong Quy village with her husband and her children. She has a store where she sells poultry food. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have a monthly income of about 8,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en: Bathuyag J. lives with his wife and four-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Dolgorsuren, is a salesperson in a general store. During the day, Bathuyag operates a public transport business using his own micro-bus. He transports people between various districts of the city. Over the years, J. has become a very experienced driver who is known and trusted by his many customers. Bathuyag hopes to continue his business successfully in the future and sees many opportunities to grow his business. He hopes to refurbish his micro-bus soon. Bathuyag is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase some household goods for his family needs

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur B. is from the village of Brgy. Upper Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 34 years old. Arthur is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Arthur owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport services. Arthur has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arthur joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arthur is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arthur from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicles to provide better service.

loans.name: Alfa Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LILIANA TIEN 41 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES Y UNO MAYOR D. EDAD, UNIVERSITARIO. HACE DOS AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO "ALFA" JUNTO 8 PERSONAS MAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON RECIENTEMENTE COMO PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. LILIANA SE DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO D. PREPARACIÓN D. ARREGLOS FLORALES TANTO NATURALES COMO ARTIFICIALES, TRABAJA A BASE D. PEDIDOS, ANTERIORMENTE ALQUILABA UN LOCAL PERO AL ENFERMARSE SU HIJA MENOR D. ASMA TUVO QUE TRASLADARSE A SU CASA PARA PODER TRABAJAR Y AL MISMO TIEMPO CUIDAR D. SU HIJA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYA A SU PAREJA CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y SOBRETODO AYUDRA A SU HIJA EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR ES APERTURAR UNA TIENDA EN UNA ZONA MUCHO MAS COMERCIAL.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES PARA LA PREPARACIÓN D. SUS ARREGLOS FLORALES.
texts.en:
Liliana is 41 years old and has 2 minor children and 1 who is adult, a university student. Two years ago the Alfa Group was formed with 8 people who lived in the Carabayllo district. Liliana's companions recently elected her president of the group's directive committee. Liliana dedicates herself to her natural and artificial flower-arranging business. She works on the basis of orders. Previously, she rented a stand but when her minor child contracted asthma, Liliana had to move the business to her house, to be able to work and take care of her daughter. Liliana's work has enabled her to contribute, along with her husband, to paying family expenses, and above all, to help her daughter in her studies. Liliana's next goal is to be able to open a store in a much more commercial zone. The requested loan will be invested in purchasing supplies and materials for preparing her flower arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS TO PREPARE HER FLOWER ARRANGEMENTS

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 35 años, vive  en su casa propia, junto a su hijo Alexander de un año y su pareja Denis de 30 años, ambos trabajan con esmero buscando su mejoría económica. Lleva 4 años dedicada al negocio de venta de comestibles, en un espacio dentro de su casa, es capaz de vender todo lo que llega a sus manos, porque es una buena comerciante, pues ofrece sus productos de manera amable. Por otro lado cultiva frutas cítricas y plátanos desde hace dos años, con la ayuda eventual de su esposo, ya que él, trabaja en un asentamiento minero, ubicado en la ciudad de  “Yurinaki”. Como su tienda es la primera en abrir las puertas  a los clientes, su labor empieza a las 4 de la mañana, porque los hombres de campo salen a sus chacras a esa hora, lo que más le gusta es que su bodega este siempre surtida con productos de pan llevar, pues las ganancias le permite cubrir los gastos domésticos. Por el momento está ahorrando, porque más adelante, piensa construir una casa en la ciudad de “Santa Ana” o “La Merced”, para instalar una tienda, en donde pueda vender al por mayor y menor, además planea renovar sus plantaciones de plátanos. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está feliz de seguir siendo parte integrante de su grupo comunal, donde las personas son bastante unidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Jessica is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her one year old son, Alexander, and her life partner, 30 year old Denis. They both work with great care looking to improve their economic situation. She has had a business selling food for four years. It is in a space in her house. She is able to sell everything that comes into her hands because she is a good merchant. She offers her products in a pleasant manner. She has also been growing citrus fruits and bananas for two years. She has occasional help from her husband. He works in a mining settlement, which is located in the city of Yurinaki. As her store is the first to open its door to customers her work begins at four in the morning. The men from the fields leave for their farms at this hour. What she likes best is that her grocery store is always stocked with local food products. The earnings allow her to cover the household expenses. At the moment she is saving for later on. She plans to build a house in the city of Santa Ana or La Merced in order to set up a store where she can sell wholesale and retail. She also plans to renovate her banana fields. This is her second loan with MFP. She is happy to continue being a member of her communal bank where the people are very supportive. She will use the requested loan to buy food and basic needs products to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her business

loans.name: Eduardo José

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo  de 22 años de edad es comerciante, cuenta con una pequeña micro industria familiar en su casa, prepara productos de limpieza como detergentes, lavandinas, suavizantes, desodorante de ambiente y otros. 
Empezó gracias a la ayuda  económica de sus padres, actualmente trabaja por su cuenta.
 
El mismo se encarga de la comercialización de sus productos por la zona, para lo cual necesita de mas capital para trabajar mejor, ha aumento notablemente su clientela, confía en Fundación Paraguaya, y se siente seguro para lograr todos sus desafíos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 22 years old. He is a merchant who runs a small business out of his home, where he prepares cleaning products, such as laundry detergents, bleach, fabric softeners, household deodorants, and others. He started this business with his parents’ financial help and now he works on his own. He takes care of making sales within his zone and needs to increase his working capital in order to be able to work better, since he has noticeably increased his number of customers. He trusts Fundación Paraguaya and feels confident that he will be able to meet all of his challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Enhsaihan S. lives with her son and mother in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an one-room apartment in the city. Her son currently attends a district primary school and her mother helps her out with her clothing-sales business. 

Enhsaihan manages a clothing and consumer goods trading business out of a stall at a local market. She sells a variety of clothing items, such as women's clothing and lingerie. After graduating university with a major in market research, Enhsaihan started her own business selling consumer goods in 2004.  

After several years of stable earnings, she used her savings to expand her business and began renting another stall at Mars, the biggest market in her town and where she currently manages her operation. Her working capital has now reached to 5,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and daily revenue is approximately 60,000-70,000 MNT.  

Enhsaihan is a very hardworking and decent person. She is very focused on making her business successful as it is the only source of income for her family. She says, "My only wish is provide for my son's education and help him to be a better person." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase different clothes so she can expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase different clothes

loans.name: Mujeres Liberadas 1 Group

texts.en:
Tanya is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Liberadas (Liberated Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to continue her efforts to reach and fulfill all her goals. 

Tanya is excited to be taking third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She has had her business for 1 year, starting with her first loan with Esperanza, after having received an invitation to join a group. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bed covers and pillows by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy linen, bed covers and pillows

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the R.C. Primary School, Kathanthabana village, eight miles from Makeni. R.C. Primary School was founded in 1964 by the R.C. Mission. R.C. Primary school is staffed with ten teachers and  has185 pupils. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Joseph S. K. (pictured here) is the head teacher and leader of this group. The 52-year-old Joseph was born in Binkolo village, about six miles from Makeni. He has been in the teaching profession for sixteen years now. He is married to a teacher and the couple has seven children – two in primary school and five in secondary school. 

Mr. K. backs up his teaching income with agriculture. He has been an agriculturist for seven years now.  He will use part of his loan to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in agriculture. He plants groundnuts and palm-trees.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Germaine Maye

texts.fr:
Germaine Mayé Y. est une femme de 77 ans. Elle est veuve et mère neuf enfants dont la majeur partie est adulte. Elle est membre fondateur du Banc Villageois de BABACK depuis 1997. Elle a 26 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a été toujours exemplaire dans ses remboursements. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits qu'elle achète au marché de Thiès pour revendre dans son village. Elle vend des produits halieutiques et des légumes.

Avec son prêt elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises afin de réaliser plus de ressources financières.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de prendre en charge sa santé.
texts.en:
Germaine Mayé Y. is 77 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 9 mostly adult children. She founded the Baback Village Bank in 1997. She has had 26 loans and has always made her repayments on time.
She runs a small business selling various products in her village that she buys at the market in Thiès. She sells seafood and vegetables.
With this loan she will expand her stock of merchandise in order to increase her financial resources.
Her goal is to be able to meet her personal needs and to look after her health.

loans.use: To expand her stock

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is a hardworking man.  He has been a tailor for three years.  He has been able to improve his business – and hence his living standards – through Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy textiles and a sewing machine.  He hopes to start sewing school uniforms in the future.

loans.use: to buy textiles and a sewing machine

loans.name: Theonille

texts.en:
Theonille is 26 and married with one child. Theonille is a businesswoman and her husband is a businessman as well. Theonille owns a business selling spare parts which is profitable business. Theonille's business is known and organized. This is her 5th year of successful work in her business and the hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except one day on the weekend.

Theonille is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more spare parts for sale. This expansion will make her more effective and more efficient.

loans.use: Purchasing additional products

loans.name: Saul Anibal

texts.es:
Saúl, se dedica a la fábrica de piñatas, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 8 años de edad, ellos residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel; él fabrica las piñatas con la colaboración de su esposa, ellos abastecen tiendas que se dedican a la venta de los preparativos para fiestas infantiles.
Saúl está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de papel, pegamento, colorantes y alambre, para fabricar las piñatas, estos materiales son la materia prima que el procesa para la fabricación de sus productos, él tiene un pedido de 500 piñatas pero no tiene el dinero que se necesita para los materiales por  lo que este préstamo le ayudara mucho para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y dar salida a todos los pedidos que se le presenten ya que son oportunidades de crecimiento para darse a conocer con más personas; él quiere progresar y dar a su hijo lo más necesario para que pueda crecer sano.
texts.en:
Saúl, who makes piñatas, lives with his wife and 8-year old son in the city and department of San Miguel. He makes the piñatas with the help of his wife. They stock stores that sell decorations for children's parties. 

Saúl is requesting a loan to buy paper, glue, dyes and wire to make the piñatas. These are the raw materials that he uses to make his products. He is currently working on a request for 500 piñatas but doesn't have the capital necessary to buy materials. This loan will help him fulfill the order. 

His goal is to improve his business and to be able complete any order that is placed, since each order is an opportunity to expand his customer base. Saúl wants to improve his life and to provide his son with what he needs to grow up healthy.

loans.use: Purchase of paper, glue, wire, and dyes

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité Fortaleza nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Capiata, en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de las integrantes de este comite es la señora Saida quien se dedica a la venta empanadas y bebidas.
Ella posee un puesto en un lugar muy concurrido y ahi mismo posee todas su herramientas de trabajo para la preparación y coccion de sus alimentos.
Tambien cuenta con una conservadora en el cual enfria sus bebidas. 
Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado pero que es la que mantiene a su familia y quiere continuar con el mismo.
Actualmente el precio de la carne, insumo princual de sus comestibles esta muy cara y solicita el prestamo para la compra del mismo y tambie para la compra de bebidas especialmente gaseosa de diferentes gustos.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza [Fortitude] Committee, located in Capiata, was born two years ago with the guidance and support of another committee that was operating in the same place.  In those more than two years of intense work they have grown socially as well as financially.  They are well-known in their area as very hard working women.

One member, Saida, is a vendor of empanadas and drinks.  She has a stand in a high-traffic location and she's got all the tools of the trade for preparing and cooking her meals, along with a cooler for chilling the drinks.  

Saida says that the work requires self-sacrifice but it supports the family and she wants to keep with it.  Currently, the price of meat, her main ingredient, is very high, and she's seeking a loan to purchase some and to buy drinks, particularly different flavored sodas.

loans.use: To buy drinks and meats.

loans.name: Shaiyrbu's Group

texts.en:
Shaiyrbu M., 49, is the treasurer of this group. A widow residing in Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan, she has a daughter and a son. Her son is married, while her 19-year-old daughter studies at the university in Osh.

In order to earn money, Shaiyrbubu works as a security guard, receiving a monthly salary of 4000 soms. She also breeds livestock animals to resell after fattening. Shaiyrbubu applied for this loan because she needs money to pay for her son’s military contract (that is, to pay money for passing the military training). In the future Shaiyrbubu wants to improve her living conditions and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To pay for her son's military contract

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es: La señora Blanca Adriana tiene su negocio que es venta de la comercialización de ropa, cosméticos, ropa interior y otros artículos en general. Un obstáculo que ha tenido últimamente es la falta de movimiento de parte de los clientes. Ella desea continuar invirtiendo en mercadería en general. Su sueño, es establecer una tienda en el mercado, tiene tres hijos, menores de edad a su cargo y se preocupa por proporcionarle lo mas necesario. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima y ofrecerla a sus diferentes clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Blanca Adriana sells clothes, cosmetics, underwear, and other articles of clothing. An obstacle she has had lately is a lack of clients shopping for merchandise. She wishes to continue investing in more merchandise. Her dream is to build a store in the market. She has three children who are small and under her care and she worries about providing them with basic necessities. This loan will be used to buy basic merchandise to offer to her new clients.

loans.use: To buy basic merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to solve her husband's business problems

loans.name: Fedilita

texts.en:
Fedilita S. is from the village of Dolipos Alto. She is married and has three adult children. Fedilita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store selling a variety of products in the local community. Fedilita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fedilita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Fedilita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Fedilita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock and to provide working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Fedilita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and to provide working capital

loans.name: Unsi

texts.en: S. is currently in the business of selling maize grain and sorghum. She is 40 years old, married to a driver, and has 6 children who all attend school. S. borrowed a loan to stock more sacks of maize and sorghum to sell. In the future, S. hopes to buy land and construct a house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more maize and sorghum

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 16 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: chuzos, alitas y pechugas de pollo asadas entre otros. Ella tiene su kiosco frente a la Universidad, mientras que su esposo tiene otro en el centro de Tosagua. Trabajan todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 21h00. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio por 16 años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, carne, alas y pechugas de pollo y mas ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por 13 años es la tesorera del banco y  le gusta por la seriedad de la institución. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'La Inmaculada' community bank meets in the city of Tosagua which is known for being a very dynamic place.  The majority of its inhabitants work farming crops and raising livestock.  It is noted as being an area with a lot of vegetation.

Here we meet Rosa.  Rosa is 44 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three children aged 17, 16 and 11.  They are studying at university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Rosa is a very good housewife who also works preparing and selling sandwiches and fast food such as kebabs, grilled chicken wings and chicken breast and other products.  She has a stand opposite the University and her husband has another one in the center of Tosagua.  They both work every day from 2.00pm to 9.00pm.  She tells us that she has been in this business for 16 years and it is doing very well.

Rosa will use this loan to buy oil, plantains, meat, chicken wings, chicken breast and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her food.  She has been a member of her community bank for 13 years and she is the bank's treasurer.  She likes the bank because of the reliability of the institution.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy oil, plantains, meat, chicken wings, chicken breast and other ingredients

loans.name: Mrs. Nor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Nor was born in 1968 and she has been selected group leader by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Saram, are teachers in the local school, where they can get a low salary to support their family. She is a dessert seller, too.
