This couple supports three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is enrolled in local public school, and the small one is 5 years old. 

In order to improve their family income, Mrs. Nor is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy some piglets

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a married woman who lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business. Her husband Agustillo, who is 46 years old, works as a helper to earn his living.  They have seven children who are between 13 and 24 years old. Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Evelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth D. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Ruth is married and has four adult children. Ruth owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals like chicken & pork adobo, bulalo & afritada. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital.

This loan will be her third from HSPFI. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a mother of four children who are between the ages of 11 and 3 years old. Three are her biological children while she adopted the 4th one. 

She works with her husband and they sell different kinds of foodstuffs which include green bananas, from which she makes a juice called "Umutobe" and sorghum from which she makes another drink named "Ubushera."

She has been in this business for eight years and this business has helped her feed her family and pay school fees for her family. 

Angela is requesting a loan to buy more bananas and sorghum in order to make large quantities of the juices and make more profits. With the profits she hopes to make savings.

loans.use: To buy sorghum and green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi and solve his problems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials for his car wash.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 46, is married and has seven children. Three are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Gemma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

 In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods for her husband's mini-market.

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en:
Dorothea is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dorothea is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

Dorothea has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dorothea requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Dorothea has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Dorothea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nozihol

texts.ru: Нозихол проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 52 года. Она вдова, у нее один ребенок. Нозихол имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей. В основном она ходит по домам и показывает свой товар. В этом ей помогает ее дочь. Она в этой области уже 10 лет. За эти годы у нее появились постоянные клиенты. Нозихол берет кредит для покупки оптом тканей.
texts.en: Nozihol lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 52 years old. She is a widow and has one child. Nozihol has secondary education. She does sales. Mainly she goes from house to house and shows her merchandise. Her daughter is also helping her. Nozihol has been in this business for ten years. During these years she got many regular customers. Nozihol is taking out the loan to buy fabrics in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in wholesale

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou est un jeune célibataire âgé de 23 ans. Il était gérant d'un poulailler d'un professeur de lycée. Comme il  est et travailleur, ce dernier lui céda le local afin de l'aider à travailler son propre compte.Ainsi Sliou qui a trés tôt quitté l'école saisit l'opportunité et décide de développer son aviculture. C'est ainsi qu'il fait appel à IMCEC son IMF du coin pour le financement de cetee activité d'aviculture. Il souhaitait un prêt de 100 000 Fcfa pour l'achat de quelques poussins et de leur alimentation.
texts.en: Saliou is a young single man of 23. He was managing a hen house for a high school teacher. Since he worked hard, the teacher let him have the premises to run a business of his own. Thus, Saliou, who left school at a young age, seized the opportunity and decided to develop his poultry raising project. That is why he is turning to IMCEC, his local Micro Finance Institution,  to find financing for this poultry enterprise. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 F CFA to buy some chicks and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe KOBENKOUN VI sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 32 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  M’PENECOURA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the KOBENKOUN VI solidarity group are married women who average 32 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in Kafla, a village in the rural town of Banco in the Dioïla prefecture, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts. This is their first time collaborating with the MFI.

With this loan, M'PENECOURA, standing first from the left, plans to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for the plowing and weeding required to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold at the local market and the markets of Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She expects to earn an average profit of about 55,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide and small equipment, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Despite being a widow, Mercedes has the strong determination to improve her standard of living to satisfy her family's basic necessities and save for future emergencies. She is now 48 years old and has three adult children. They live in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale and raising livestock.  

Due to the high cost of commodities, Mercedes wants to ask for additional capital of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides in order to increase their rice crop yields. 

In the future, Mercedes plans to improve all of their sources of income so that she can support the education of her grand children. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will be able to achieve her goals someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to sustain rice production

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married with four children.
Myrna's business is cosmetic services and she earns approximately PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase equipment for her cosmetic business.  This is Myrna's first year as a member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her cosmetic business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca and her husband have only one child who is presently taking the college level of education. Rebecca is now 45 years old and is married. Her husband works abroad somewhere in part of the Middle East as a furniture maker. Rebecca lives happily with her child, but she would be happier if they could live with her husband.

She does her best to develop her sari-sari (variety) store business. She manages her business well to help her husband in financing their needs. She hopes that someday she will make her sari-sari store into a large grocery, with many various commodities to sell.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of P12,000 to purchase canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices to sell in her sari-sari store, which is located in front of their house.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe e a sua sobrinha que vivem com ela. 

É  comerciante ha mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, cervejas amendoim e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 18.000.00mt, todos aplicados na obra de casa e algum para o comercio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the District of Boane, in the Province of Maputo, in the south of Mozambique, is married and the mother of 1 son who attends school. She completed 7th grade but did not continue her education due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother and a niece who both live with her.

She has been a trader for more than 8 years and has a monthly income of around 15,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she uses for household expenditures and also saves a little in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks and came to know of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer and others) to increase the quantity of her goods.
Her first loans were for 15,000.00 MZN, 10,000.00 MZN an 18,000.00 MZN, all used for the construction of her house and on her business.

She commits to paying the loan off without problems and in future intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to increase her commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase products (peanuts, fish, beer and others)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 
Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mher

texts.ru:
Мгеру(Mher) 38 лет.Он родился и вырос в селе Срашен(Srashen) Капанской области.С юношеских лет Мгер вместе с родителями занимается сельскохозяйственными работами в родном селе. Мгер женат и живет отдельно от родителей, вместе  с женой , двумя дочерьми 10 и 2 лет и с сыном которому 8 лет. Мгер работает сварщиком , но так-как зарплата небольшая , он с женой занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. В собственном огороде Мгер с женой выращивают овощи и фрукты, а так-же занимаются  пчеловодством. У них есть и орендованный земельный участок в селе , где Мгер сеет пщеницу. Сельскохозяйственную продукцию Мгер с женой реализуют в городе Капан. Выручка от ихнего сельского хозяйства очень помогает Мгеру достойно содержать семью и помогать  родителям. 
Мгеру нужен кредит 800.000 Армянских драм для покупки новых сортов семян пшеницы,кортофеля и для покупки новых ящиков для пчел.
texts.en:
Mher is 38 years old.  He was born and grew up in Srashen village in the Kapan area.  Since his youth Mher together with his parents has worked in agriculture in his native village.  Mher is married and lives separately from his parents with his wife, two daughters who are 10 and 2 years old and a son who is 8 years old.  Mher works as a welder but since his salary is not big, he and his wife also have an agriculture business.  In their own garden Mher and his wife grow vegetables and fruits and also raise bees.  They also have a rented plot of land in the village where Mher plants wheat.  Mher and his wife sell their agricultural products in Kapan city.  Revenues from their agriculture business help Mher to properly support his family and to help his parents.  

Mher needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian dram to purchase new varieties of wheat seeds and potato seeds and to purchase new boxes for bees.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of wheat seeds, potato seeds, and new boxes for bees

loans.name: Santos Natividad

texts.es:
La  Señora Santos Natividad, tiene 53 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo en  la Comunidad del Triunfo de la Cruz en  el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Inicio su negocio hace dos años motivada por la necesidad de obtener ingresos que le  permitieran afrontar los gastos de su hogar. 
Comenta que fue escogida en su comunidad para la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos, lo que ella considero como una buena oportunidad.
Con el interés de realizar un pedido mayor de productos, ella ha solicitado su primer crédito el cual será invertido en la compra de: lociones, cremas aromáticas, desodorantes y acondicionadores para el cabello.
Su mayor deseo es tener más clientes y obtener mayores ganancias las cuales piensa invertir en surtir más su negocio
texts.en:
Santos Natividad is 53 years old, and she has three children.  She lives with her husband in the Triunfo de la Cruz community in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.

She started her business two years ago.  She was motivated by the necessity to get income that would allow her to pay for the household expenses.  She says that she was selected to sell cosmetics by catalog in her community.  She considered this to be a good opportunity.

Interested in making a larger order of products, she has requested her first loan.  She will use the loan to buy lotions, scented creams, deodorants, and hair conditioners.

Her greatest wish is to have more customers and to get more income.  She will use the income to stock her business more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (lotions, creams, and deodorants, etc.).

loans.name: Esthela Segunda

texts.es:
Esthela tiene 63 años vive con su esposo en Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora, sincera y honesta.

Esthela trabaja con su marido en la crianza de pollos, es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi ya que necesita comprar pollos para criar y posteriormente su engorde y venta, proceso que le ayudará a obtener un poco mas de ingresos lo cual le ayudará a mantener a su familia.

Su sueño es poder tener un galpón grande de pollos para poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esthela is 63 years old and lives with her husband in Otavalo, in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.  She is a hard-working, tenacious, sincere and honest woman.

Esthela works with her husband raising chickens.  This is the first loan she has requested from Fodemi and she needs it to buy chickens to raise, fatten and then sell.  This process will help her to make a little more income which will help her to support her family.

Esthela's dream is to own a large chicken shed so that she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale such as rice, beans, and brown sugar

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yobanna;  La socia tiene 28 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 10 meses; La socia trabaja en el centro comercial el Altiplano, ella se encarga de vender postres, la socia compra ingredientes y preparara, tortas, kekes, gelatinas, flanes, pudin, y desea comprar una vitrina, la socia desea en esta ocasión comprar una vitrina para exhibir los postres y comprar insumos para la elaboración de todos sus deliciosos postres y gelatinas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Yobana is a member of the Communal Bank “Ricchary Cusco” which is located in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 4 and 10 months). Yobana works at a shopping center in Altiplano where she sells desserts. She buys ingredients and prepares cakes, cupcakes, gelatins, flan, and pudding. Yobana also wants to buy a display case. On this occasion, she wants to buy a display case in order to showcase her desserts. She will also buy supplies for making all of her delicious desserts and gelatins.

Yobana is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a display case and ingredients for making desserts.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. После распада СССР её муж потерял свою работу, из-за этого ей приходилась обеспечить семью и она начала заниматься  бизнесом. Она занимается купле- продажей бытовой техники на местном рынке, у неё хороший опыт и она имеет много клиентов. От полученной прибыли она хочет обучить своих детей, то есть устроит их в ВУЗ-ах для того чтобы они стали хорошими специалистами в своем деле. Мунира запрашивает займ для покупки бытовой техники с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Munira is married and is a loving mother of two children. She is very hardworking and a good woman. After the collapse of the USSR her husband lost his job and because of this she had to provide for her family and she began to do business. She does buying and selling of household appliances on the local market, she has a good experience and a lot of customers. She wants to use the received profit to educate their children by enrolling them in a university so they can become good specialists in their field.

Munira is asking for a loan to purchase household appliances in order to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase of household appliances.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 59 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, así como amable y cordial, esta casado con Auria quien es ama  de casa. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos de 19, 18 y 15 años a quienes quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Jorge es la agricultura, tiene un terreno de 27 hectáreas, donde 15 hectáreas están sembradas con diferentes plantaciones como naranjas, piñas, y yuca, siendo su principal producto, el cual viene cultivando desde hace 18 años. Ahora por el volumen de su cosecha necesita el apoyo de al menos 5 peones a los que paga por día trabajado un jornal de 20 nuevos soles. Asimismo comenta que le gusta la vida de campo, conoce el trabajo, pues desde joven sus padres le enseñaron esta labor. Sin embargo el cansancio físico no le ayuda en el trabajo, pero le llena de satisfacción los ingresos económicos, ya que con ello puede darle una mejor educación a sus hijos. Tienes planes de ampliar e incursionar en la siembra de palma aceitera. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo para crecer  en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la siembra de yuca, tiene planeado sembrar al menos 2 hectáreas de yuca.
texts.en: Jorge, a 59-year-old, is an industrious and diligent, as well as kind and cordial man.  He is married to Auria, who is a housewife.  Together they inhabit their own house in company with their three children ages 19, 18 and 15, whom they love very much.  The activity that Jorge carries out is agriculture.  He has 27 hectares of land, where 15 hectares are sown with different plantations such as oranges, pineapples, and yucca, the latter being his main product, which he has cultivated for 18 years.  Now the volume of his crop requires the support of at least 5 laborers, who he pays a daily wage of 20 new soles for a days work.  He says that he likes life in the field.  He knows the work, since his parents taught him this work as a child.  Nevertheless the physical exhaustion does not help in the work, but he is full of satisfaction with the economic income, since with it he can give a better education to his children.  He has plans to expand and to begin sowing oil producing palms.  This it will be his 8th loan with the institution MFP.  He is thankful for the support that he receives to grow his business.  With the requested total of 2000 new soles, he will invest in sowing yucca.  He plans to sow at least 2 hectares of yucca.

loans.use: to hire laborers and to buy yucca seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on the capital

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is the resident of Beylagan town. He is engaged in butchery and he is the client of Normicro Beylagan branch since 2004. He started his business long ago getting loans. After borrowing funds from Normicro he considerable expanded the business. He also trades livestock. He needs new loan to expand the business more.

loans.use: To increase the volume

loans.name: Sauleone

texts.en: Sauleone is a mother of five children. Her husband's meager income is enough to meet their daily needs but there is practically nothing left for her children's education.  This prompted Sauleone to join the SPBD microfinance program so that she could start a business of her own. Her first small loan was used to start her popcorn business. It surprised her that she was able to sell a lot of popcorn in her village school. She used her second loan to pay her children's school fees, confident that she could pay back her loan from the earnings of her popcorn business. Now, she is planning to expand her popcorn business by buying more stock and a bigger stove and cooking equipment so that she can start supplying the different food stalls in the Apia town market with her tasty popcorn.

loans.use: To purchase a stove and cooking utensils and additional stock

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo is married and has a beautiful three year old girl. With the birth of his daughter, the household expenses increased, and his salary was not enough to cover all the debts. Gerardo decided to start selling nutritional products two years ago to increase his income. He began selling the products to his friends and neighbors but soon gained many more clients and made his business grow.

To be able to increase the quality and variety of products he offers, Gerardo is asking for a loan of $825 dollars, which he agrees to return in six months. With your help, you can raise the quality of life of this family and be part of the growth of this business, they will appreciate it.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Gerardo es casado y tiene una preciosa hija de 3 años de edad. Con la llegada de su pequeña, los gastos en su hogar se incrementaron y el salario que recibe resultó insuficiente para cubrir todas las deudas, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Gerardo decidió comenzar a vender productos nutricionales y complementos alimenticios hace dos años, inició sus ventas entre amigos y vecinos, afortunadamente ha logrado ganar muchos más clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder incrementar la variedad de productos y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, Gerardo solicita un préstamo de $ 825 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, se parte del crecimiento de este negocio, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Leongina

texts.es:
Leongina is 71 years old and married with three children: 2 daughters and a son, all married now. She and her husband work selling cow's milk and goat's milk. They have worked in this business since 1982; they both come from farm families, from whom they learned the business.

After marrying, they decided to start their own business, and so they bought a Dutch milk cow. Leongina used to travel to the city every day by bus to sell the milk. She tells the story of the difficult times she's had to get through just to keep the business going, how she didn't let those difficult times get the best of her, and how she and her husband fought together to overcome the difficulties. They succeeded in moving the business ahead and have gone on to increase their production, thanks to their dedication and their good management of their resources.

Currently, they own a well equipped facility and a small truck in which they deliver and sell their products.

Leongina is applying for a loan with which to buy the plot of land located in front of her business. She will use the land to grow crops she'll use to feed her cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Leongina tiene 71 años de edad ella está casada y tiene tres hijos; dos mujeres y un sólo varón todos ya casados. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de leche de vaca y cabra, desde el año 1982, ya que ambos provienen de familias que se dedicaban a la granja y de ahí aprendieron como desarrollar la actividad.

Después de casarse decidió independizarse y comenzó con la compra de una vaca lechera holandesa, la señora Leongina viajaba todos los días a la ciudad en colectivo para vender la leche. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que pasar por momentos difíciles para sostener el negocio no se dejaron vencer y lucho con su esposo, así lograron salir adelante y fueron aumentando su producción gracias a la dedicación y a la buena administración de ambos administración de sus recursos.

Actualmente, ya poseen un establecimiento bien equipado para un apropiado desenvolvimiento de su actividad, además una camioneta para realizar el traslado y la venta de su producto.

Solicita el préstamo para adquirir un terreno que está ubicado frente a su establecimiento, para poder cultivar alimentos para el cuidado de su ganado vacuno.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land

loans.name: Reina  De Los Angele

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria de los Angeles. I make and sell tortillas for a living. I work out of my small home business. I have three years of experience in this field. Thank God this business generates enough income for my family’s expenses. Our economic status has improved thanks to this business, giving our children the opportunity to pursue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Maria de los Angeles, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y de venta de tortillas, cuento con un pequeño negocio en mi casa de habitación, tengo tres años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que gracias a Dios me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia, gracias este negocio nuestra situación economica ha mejorado, dando a nuestros hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.

loans.use: Buying corn, sugar, and firewood.

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru:
Husan S. is 53 years old, he has a college degree in economics, is married and has 4 children. Currently, he is retired and his business is to rear and sells cattle. Husan has almost 15 years of experience in this. When he receives credit, Husan plans to buy two young cows to feed and resell. Husan feeds his cattle for 40-45 days and then sells it on a local market. With the profits received he plans to purchase new animals. The rest of the money will be spent on family needs of his wife and 4 children. The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Султанов Хусан, возраст – 53 года, образование высшее, специальность – экономист, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Султанов Хусан в настоящее время находится на пенсии и заниамется разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он имеет почти 15 летний опыт в этом виде деятельности. На полученный кредит Хусан планирует приобрести 2 бычка для откормки и продажи. Скот он откармливает в течение 40-45 дней, после чего продает его на местном рынке. На вырученные деньги он приобретает новый молодняк, а оставшуюся сумму денег использует на семейно-бытовые расходы, так как в семье у него имеется помимо его самого жена и четверо детей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of 2 cows

loans.name: Thi Hanh

texts.vi:
Mrs.Hanh, 25 years old, lives in N. Xa village, Bac Ninh. She is married and does business on wasted materials with her husband’s family. Every day, she buys wasted materials such as used plastic or metal goods from scrap-iron dealers. Her family has been doing this activity for 5 years and the income is very stable. This is also the main income of her family. Knowing about the Binhminh microeconomic program, she enthusiastically joins to borrow money to assist her daily business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hạnh 25 tuổi sống ở thôn Nghiêm Xá, Bắc Ninh. Chj lấy chồng và làm nghề cùng gia đình chồng là buôn bán phế liệu. Hàng ngày chị mua lại các thứ phế liệu như đồ nhựa cũ, kim loại từ những người thu mua đồng nát nhỏ lẻ. Công việc này gia đình chị đã làm được 5 năm và rất ổn định. Đây cũng là công việc tạo thu nhập chính cho gia đình. Được biết có chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh, chị đã hăng hái tham gia để có thêm vốn hỗ trợ cho công việc kinh doanh hàng ngày của chị.

loans.use: To assist in business

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi D., 47 years old, is one among the very first members of the TYM Fund. In 1992, she borrowed 20 USD to buy pigs. By doing business on pigs, her family life became better. Then, she used other borrowed money to invest in breeding poultries. In 2000, unfortunately, her husband passed away. Since then, her life became very difficult. Yet, being hard-working, she overcame the difficulties to raise her children to maturity. In 2004, her oldest son got married and is living separately. Since joining the TYM Fund, she is very reliable and is promoted to become the Local Manager by other women. Her current activity is selling groceries like fruits, candies, dried food. She wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more merchandises. Her current income is 180 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Đào, 47 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tham gia đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình Thương. Năm 1992, chị xin vay vòng 1 với mức vay 20USD mua lợn giống. Từ việc chăn nuôi lợn, kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển hơn, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi gà, vịt đẻ trứng. Năm 2000, chồng chị không may qua đời. Từ đó, những khó khăn chồng chất đè nặng lên vai chị, nhưng với phẩm chất chịu thương chịu khó vượt lên tất cả để nuôi con trưởng thành. Năm 2004 chị đã xây dựng gia đình cho con trai lớn và làm cho cháu ngôi nhà ra ở riêng. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay chị luôn đựoc chị em tín nhiệm bầu vào các chức dạnh Quản lý cụm. Hoạt động kinh doanh hiện tại của chị Đào là bán hoa quả, bánh kẹo, hàng khô. Chị đang làm đơn xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng bán. Mức thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị: 180USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fruits, and more merchandises

loans.name: Dios Es Amor, Group 2

texts.en:
Ana is a 53 year old woman who lives on the outskirts of the capital in a suburb called Los Alcarizzos. She lives with her two children, a boy and a girl. She and her husband divorced several years ago and since then she has been left to support the three of them on her own.

Right now she has a small little store that sells earrings, trinkets, beauty supplies and sandals. She is asking for this loan so that she can expand her supply and expand her business. She believes that with better and more inventory, she will be able to sell more and retain her customers.

In the little free time that she can find, Ana Josefa loves to go to her church, watch the local news, and maybe even catch one of the famously dramatic telenovelas that air every night.

From Ana Josefa, and from all of us here at Esperanza, we thank you for your interest and support in helping Ana achieve all of her dreams!

loans.use: to purchase jewelry, personal care products and sandals

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fidencio is 44 years old and is married to Mercedes Samudio, who is 49 years old. They have 3 children. Their oldest daughter is 19 years old, has finished high school and is now studying computation. Their son is 17 years old and finished secondary school and now works in a locksmith’s shop. Their younger daughter is in high school. Fidencio explains that all of his children are very responsible in their studies and in their work, a fact which fills his heart with happiness.

Fidencio is a blacksmith by profession. He worked as a blacksmith since he was 16 years old in various shops until he decided to work independently almost 18 years ago, when he was 27 years old. His specialty is iron bars, sliding doors, and garage doors. He also makes scaffolding for metal roofs.

Because of the good work he does, and the responsibility he shows by having jobs done on time, Fidencio has many orders. He constantly has work and orders, especially from architects.

Recently he has received many jobs, for which he would like to buy more materials, such as iron pipes, iron sheets, and other materials that he needs to do his job, like welding equipment and some tools that will help him to work more quickly. Fidencio is requesting the loan to purchase these things.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Fidencio tiene 44 años y esta casado con Mercedes Samudio de 49 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos, la hija mayor tiene 19 años a terminado el colegio y ahora sigue la carrera de Informática, un varón de 17 años que termino sus estudios secundarios y trabaja en una cerrajería, y una hija menor que esta asistiendo actualmente el colegio. Fidencio cuenta que todos sus hijos son muy responsables en sus estudios y en el trabajo, eso es algo que le llena de alegría el corazón.

Fidencio es herrero de profesión, trabajó como herrero desde los 16 años en distintos talleres hasta que decidió trabajar en forma independiente hace casi 18 años, cuando el tenia 27 años de edad. La especialidad de Fidencio son las rejas de hierros, portones corredizos y basculantes, además fabrica también estructuras para tinglados.

Gracias a la delicadeza de su trabajo y su responsabilidad en la entrega de los mismos, Fidencio posee muchos pedidos de trabajo. Es por eso que constantemente tiene trabajo y pedidos especialmente de arquitectos.

Actualmente ha recibido varios trabajos por lo que desea adquirir insumos como caños de hierro, chapas y otros tipos de insumos que necesita para realizar su trabajo, como un equipo soldador y algunas herramientas más que le ayuden a agilizar su trabajo. Fidencio solicita el crédito para la adquisición de los mismos.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools such as: iron pipe, sheet iron, welding equipment, and some other tools

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda started the business to help her husband because, at times, his income doesn't stretch to meeting all of their family's ever-increasing expenses. She started in February 2006 when her mother pushed her to sell jewelry in the days before Valentine's Day, a time when she could more easily move her products. That's how she started, first selling to neighbors and friends, then adding more customers, selling not only jewelry but also a well-known brand of beauty products and even used clothes from time to time.

Griselda is applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy jewelry so that she will have a better inventory and be able to offer a wider range to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Griselda inició el negocio para tener una entrada extra de dinero para ayudar a mi esposo ya que a veces no nos alcanza con lo que gana y nuestras necesidades son cada vez mayores. Comenzó en Febrero del 2006 cuando su mamá se animó a que vendiera joyería ya que se acercaba el día de San Valentín y podría colocar mas fácilmente los productos, fue así como inicio, primero vendiendo entre sus vecinas y amistades, después fue incrementando mas clientes, aparte de que también vendo productos de belleza de reconocida marca y a veces también vendo ropa usada.

Solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de un lote de joyería que le permitirá tener un mejor surtido para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Julia Lionila

texts.es:
Julia, a native of Huarochiri, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos.” Her business is selling fabric, and it is located in the district and province of Huaraz, Ancash state

With the previous loan S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles, which was repaid in 4 payments, she bought a good quantity of a variety of fabrics to stock her business. With the current loan also for 3000.00 she will buy a variety of stuffed animals and gifts to sell for Mother’s Day.

She is 49 years old, and is a single mother to 4 children. She has been able successfully raise her children and her income enables her to help her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Ella es la señora Julia, natural de Huarochiri, Lima, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica ala venta de telas, su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo anterior de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, ha comprado a mas cantidad de telas de distintas calidades par surtir su negocio, y con el préstamo actual también de 3000.00 ha comprado una variedad de peluches y regalos para venderlos por el día de madre.

Ella tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, ha logrado que todos su hijos tengan su propio, su ingreso le permite ayudar a su nietos.

loans.use: Buy items to sell in her fabric business

loans.name: Afoussatou

texts.fr:
Born in the north of Togo in Lama-Kara on May 12, 1966, Mrs. Afoussatou B. M. is married to Mr. Baba Ouro-Tagba who retails motorcycle spare parts. She has three children who are all enrolled in school. Her primary business activity is selling cereals (corn and dried beans) in the market at Agoè Assiyéyé.

She has already had one loan from WAGES and is requesting this second loan to buy 10 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of dried beans so as to stock up and be able to have a good turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née au nord du Togo à Lama-Kara, le 12 mai 1966, madame B. M. Afoussatou s’est mariée à monsieur OURO-TAGBA Baba qui est un revendeur des pièces détachées de moto. Elle a trois enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des céréales (maïs et haricot) dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé.

Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs et 04 sacs du haricot afin de refaire le stock et pouvoir bien vendre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of dried beans

Achat de 10 sacs de maïs et de 04 sacs du haricot

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina started her own business while facing the need to maintain her household and raise her 4 children—ages 11, 10, 7, and 6—on her own after her husband walked out on them. She started the business after being invited by a co-worker who sold jewelry because it was quite lucrative for her. Because of their financial necessity, she decided to invest her income in the purchase of merchandise. Little by little, she has been moving forward.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase merchandise. With your support, she will help her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina inició el negocio ante la necesidad de tener que mantener la casa y sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos de 11, 10, 7 y 6 años, sola ya que su esposo los abandono; ella inicio su negocio por invitación de una compañera, a que vendiera joyería ya que esto le dejaba buenos ingresos a ella, ante la necesidad económica que vivía ella decidió invertir sus ingresos en mercancía y poco a poco ha salido adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para compra mercancía, con tu apoyo ella hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Peang

texts.en:
Mrs. Peang R., 33, is a farmer in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and the mother of four children, three of whom attend school while the fourth assists Mrs. R.’s husband, Mr. Un Thy, in his firewood and pig-raising businesses. 

The problem facing Mrs. R. as a rice farmer is that she lacks sufficient funds to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. She is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose, with the rest  being used to purchase pesticides for the farm. Previously, she received a loan, now fully repaid, to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la  Región San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de comida y el negocio lo realiza en las cercanías de un paradero de transporte interprovincial. Los clientes son en su mayoría los chóferes y pasajeros que a diario visitan dicho Terminal. 

Con este crédito de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, servilletas y otros insumos como carne de pollo, de pescado, de cerdo, verduras, etc., los cuales necesita para la preparación de los platos que a diario oferta a los clientes.

Teresa tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer decidida, alegre, vive con su hijo, quien la apoya y la acompaña. Tiene como meta comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa belongs to the communal bank called "Maria Magdalena". She lives in the San Martin Region, Province of Mariscal Cáceres, Juanjuí district. She sells food and does business in the vicinity of an interprovincial transport station. The clients are mostly those drivers and passengers who visit the Terminal daily. With this credit of $675, which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, condiments, napkins and other ingredients such as chicken, fish, pork, vegetables, etc., which are needed to prepare the dishes that she offers on a daily basis to customers. Teresa is 58 years old. She is a determined and cheerful woman. She lives with her son, who supports her and keeps her company. She has the goal of purchasing land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: OUMAR B. EST UN ELEVEUR DE MOUTONS DEPUIS 1998. SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ENGRAISSER DES MOUTONS ET LES REVENDRE.
texts.en:
Oumar B. has been a sheep raiser since 1998. His business consists in fattening sheep and re-selling them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sheep fattening

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon S. is the leader of this group loan. All three entrepeneurs live in Sarikakeo Commune in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Khon S. is 43, and she goes throughout her village selling fish that her husband caught. Mrs. Khon S. also takes cares of her seven children. Two children help with the family's income by fishing and decorating houses for ceremonies or wedding parties. Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Mach Kheav, is 42, and has always been a fisherman. Khon requests a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets, and a second-hand fishing boat for her husband.

Mrs. Saroeun C. is 56 years old, and a rice farmer. She requests a loan for $300 to purchase fishing equipment.

Mrs. Seun S. is a 55-year-old widow. She makes mats and sells them from home. Seun requests a loan of $300 to purchase the raw materials to make mats.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets and a second-hand boat for fishing

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. sells food like chicken and cassava at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver in the ministry of education. She has two children, both of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock more food for sale at the restaurant. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en: Olufunke is 47 years old and she is a widow with three children. She hopes to pull her family out of poverty. Olufunke sells frozen foods like turkey, chicken, fish, etc. She also sells drinks. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says, "Thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn J. is 48 years old, married, and lives at Obay, Polanco Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a motor cab driver. They have 6 children and 2 are in school, one in College and one in High School. Her husbands income is not enough to support the children's school tuition. 

She searched out a loan institution that will not turn it's back in times of difficulty. Roselyn found Paglaum MPC and decided to be a member on May 24, 2006. She decided to start a piggery business and started buying and selling pigs. Now, she has regular hog buyers that provide her with a income stable.  

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000PHP loan for another venture, to buy vegetable for resale. She also wants to buy more hogs to increase her income aside from her vegetable vending. She plans that her children will finish College.

loans.use: to buy vegetable for resale

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Preciosa S., 60, lives in Antipolo, Dapitan City. She is a widow who has managed to raise her four children alone. This was a very difficult task, but she struggled to survive for the sake of her children.

She patiently looked for an institution that could help her. When she learned about Paglaum MPC, she wasted no time, and she became a member on May 29, 2008. She used her first loan of 3,000 PHP to buy two piglets and this is how she started her hog-raising business. She is grateful to God that, with the help of her children, her hog-raising business has done very well and she has buyers from many different places. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed feed and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes to make a concrete piggery for her pigs. She will continue using Paglaum MPC, because this organization really helps to improve the lives of the landless.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gulnafisa

texts.ru: Гулнафиса ранее торговала продуктами питания и уже получала займ на КИВА. Несколько месяцев назад она поменяла вид деятельности и совместно со своими 3 подругами она открыла свадебный салон в центре города Канибадам. Буквально в эти дни она и ее подруги отремонтировали помещение салона и выставили свадебные платья. Ее деятельность заключается в подготовке невест к свадебному торжеству и включает в себя весь спектр услуг: стрижка, маникюр, окраска волос, сдача платьев в прокат и так далее. Гулнафис уже имеет много свадебных платьев но хочет приобрести несколько новых моделей и поэтом подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Gulnafisa used to sell food and have already taken out loans at Kiva. A few months ago she has changed her business and together with three of her friends has opened a bridal store in the center of the city of Kanibadam. Just a few days ago she and her friends has finished remodeling the salon and has put out gowns for display. Her work consists of preparing the brides for the wedding ceremony and includes the entire range of services: hairstyling, manicure, hair coloring, renting out wedding gowns and etc. Gulnafisa already has many wedding gowns, but wants to get a few of new styles and this is why she applied at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new wedding gowns

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is a 51 year-old mother of three.  Her husband is a warehouse man in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.  Cecilia manages her business and her husband is far from the family.  She raised her three children; one in college, two have graduated, but only one is employed.  

Cecilia has been an active member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) for eleven years.  Cecilia is also the treasurer of their village; Lapaz, Hamtic, Antique, island of Panay.   Her husband's income, plus her income from her job as treasurer is not enough to sustain the needs of the family.  

She applied for this loan to buy one unit of cellphones and pre-paid phone credits in order to save extra money to provide for the educational needs of her child.  She hopes that in the future, her children will land jobs and have a better living.

loans.use: Buy cellphone and pre-paid phone credit.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina G. is a mother to three children and a 32-year-old wife to Forunato G.. She is a local of Culasi, Antique, Philippines, where the city is known as a center of commerce in the Northern part of the province. Her three children are all in elementary grades.

She started her business through loans from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.). She started selling fried chicken with a rolling cart around the City Plaza. It caught the taste of the public and she was able to buy additional push carts.

Now her dream is to buy a motorcycle for easy and fast transportation of her goods. In addition, she plans to use this loan to buy more ingredients to make fried chicken. She is optimistic that the business she has started will grow. The proceeds from her business will be used to send her children to school until they reach college and find jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle, and to buy ingredients to make fried chicken.

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité le commerce de perles et de bijoux, pour pouvoir gagner plus de bénéfices sur son activité elle s’approvisionne à Accra au Ghana et dans le marché de Cotonou au Bénin. Les autres femmes revendeuses de bijoux viennent acheter chez elle parce qu’elle leur fait un bon prix. Une partie de son stock est épuisée, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 sachets de perles, 20 sachets de bijoux. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman earns an income from commerce in pearls and gems. To be able to earn more profit from her business, she acquires supplies in Accra, in Ghana, and from the Cotonou marketplace in Benin. The other women jewelry retailers come buy their goods from her because she offers them good prices. Part of her inventory is exhausted. To resupply herself, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 30 bags of pearls and 20 bags of gems. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pearls and gems

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Mrs. Lenie A. is one of the thousands of members of Paglaum, and she is a member in good standing who joined in April 2004. She lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, is married, and blessed with four children, three in elementary and one who is one-year old. Mrs. A. is requesting a loan to help her and her husband cultivate their rice field. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, and to pay for the laborer needed to help with growing their crop. Mrs. A. is very inspired and thank to Paglaum MPC for giving her the opportunity to borrow money that helps her and her family improve their daily lives.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer/chemicals for rice production

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma K. is a mother of six children, three sons and three daughters who are all currently in school (senior high, junior high and the primary schools). She is fifty-seven years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell. Emma buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for over thirty-eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Timinandi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Timinandi sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en  moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Banankoro (4ème Région Administrative du Mali).
Timinandi est un groupe qui fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales, les condiments alimentaires etc.
Dans le but de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles ont décidées d’intégrer  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 6 sacs d’arachide en gousse, 3 sacs de riz et 300 kg d’oignon. L’oignon est frit et les gousses d’arachide grillées d’abord avant d’être vendus. Elles s’approvisionnent en arachide et oignon hebdomadairement à la foire du village, en riz dans les foires de Siribala, Dougabougou et Ségou. Les produits sont revendus à domicile et à la foire du village (chaque jeudi) à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour acheter du pétrole pour la lampe, du savon et pour aider les époux à subvenir aux charges familiales.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Pasos Firmes Group 2

texts.en:
Ana Luisa J. is 54 years old and runs her own business selling fresh produce, meat, and used clothing from her home in the sugar cane community (called a "batey") of La Gina, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Today, Ana Luisa is requesting a new loan - her seventh loan to date -- from Kiva and Esperanza International so she can buy more merchandise, including onions, eggplant, potatoes, salami, chicken, and used men's and women's clothing, for her store. When her loan is funded, Ana Luisa will travel by bus and/or motorcycle taxi to La Romana, the closest big city, to buy the used clothing for her business, and she will go out further into the countryside to buy her produce from local farmers.

Ana Luisa's independent business is certainly a success story in its own right. She has been able to expand her business steadily over time, and she owns one of the most vibrant home enterprises in the La Gina batey. For example, the loan she will take out today is over twice the size of her very first loan, and she has expanded her merchandise offerings from chicken and used clothing to a whole variety of food and clothing goods. This is no small feat, considering that bateys are often the most economically stagnant communities in the Dominican Republic. Geographically isolated, and populated mostly by Dominicans of Haitian descent, who face the greatest difficulties in securing citizenship rights, starting and expanding a business in a rural batey is no easy task. Furthermore, it is especially impressive that Ana Luisa is able to take out a loan of this size at this time of the year, since commercial activity in the batey generally slows down considerably during the sugarcane off-season.

Ana Luisa uses the revenues from her business to help support her three grandchildren who live with her and her husband. She helps to pay for their school uniforms and school supplies, and she hopes that her business will continue to fund their education in the future. Ana Luisa has six grown children of her own and 25 grandchildren!

Ana Luisa appears in the center of the photograph with her four fellow group members of the Pasos Firmes (Solid Steps) Bank of Hope.

loans.use: New food items and used clothing for general store

loans.name: Malagaleupolu

texts.en:
Malagaleupolu E. is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Salepouae. She is married and has four young children. To make a living, Malagaleupolu operates a business selling agricultural equipment. The main source of income for the business comes from selling plant seedlings and young crops to local farmers. Malagaleupolu has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 350 Samoa Tala (about $132) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Malagaleupolu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Malagaleupolu is requesting a loan from SPBD of 750 WST, which will be used to purchase general agricultural supplies and equipment. This will be the first loan she has taken out from SPBD.  Malagaleupolu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general agricultural supplies and equipment

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent M. is a resident of Barangay San Jose, Santiago City. He is a simple person trying to give his family sufficient support for them to live a progressive life. He believes that a business which is selling of different dry goods such as kitchen utensils, raincoats and other things could be a big help. He usually purchases his products in the city of Santiago proper and sells in their village and nearby villages by means of walking while carrying the products on his shoulders.

He strives to give his family a better living. He is just 21 years old and is very aggressive in developing his buying and selling business. He is now requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital. He believes that his patience in maintaining his business is a good step to start with. He just hopes that lenders will allow him to access the amount he is requesting to borrow.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Irma Maruja

texts.es:
La señora  Irma es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil casada y no tiene hijos, Irma estudio secundaria completa, vive en el centro poblado de Rosa Cami.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es socia fundadora, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, la señora  se dedica a la venta de ganado menor, en la ferias semanales de la zona.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ganado menor para engorde.

Su mayor deseo continuar trabajando y así poder ampliar su negocio.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado menor.

loans.name: Guadalope

texts.en:
Guadalope B. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Guadalope is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Guadalope owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Guadalope has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Guadalope joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guadalope has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Guadalope is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Guadalope from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario O., from the village of Magsaysay , Misamis Oriental, is a 32-year-old married father of an infant. To make a living, Dario owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from buying and selling fruits such as bananas and coconuts in the local community. In business for over two years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, he is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This will be Dario's second loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 41 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus cinco hijos en el sector Casablanca, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy joven y al comercio de animales desde hace tres años. Es propietario de 0.25 hectareas de terreno de cultivo y acostumbra a arrendar un terreno de igual área para sembrar maíz.

Además compra y cría animales menores (chivos, carneros, patos) para luego venderlos a vecinos que los comercializan en la ciudad de Chiclayo y en la frontera con Ecuador. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar con la que cuentan.

Hace poco cosechó el maíz que había sembrado pero descuidó su negocio de animales. Las pocas ganancias que obtuvo de la agricultura las piensa invertir en la nueva campaña de siembra, pero no puede seguir descuidando la principal fuente de ingreso familiar. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales para seguir criando y vendiendo.

Su mas grande anhelo es construir su casa de material noble. La suya esta construida de material rústico y la humedad de los sembríos vecinos está afectando la salud de sus hijos. El es un padre trabajador y siempre da lo mejor de sí para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Casablanca sector, Mórrope district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since he was very young and has sold animals for the past three years. He owns 0.25 hectares of arable land and he tends to lease a second plot of the same size to grow corn. In addition, he buys and raises small farm animals (goats, lambs, ducks) which he raises and then sells to neighbors who, in turn, sell them in the city of Chiclayo and on the border with Ecuador. This is the family's main source of income. A short time ago he harvested his corn crop but neglected the animal raising side of his business. The small profits he got from his crops he intends to reinvest in his next planting but he must not continue to neglect his main source of family income. For this reason, he has seen the need, for the first time, to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan. He is asking for 1000 new soles to buy animals to continue to raise them for sale. His greatest wish is to build a house of substantial materials. His is made of rustic materials and the dampness from the adjacent fields is affecting his children's health. He is a hard-working father who always gives his best to see his family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals to raise and sell.

location.town: Caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca - Morrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Irma Arcadia

texts.es:
la sra. Irma Arcadia Z. tiene 52 años de edad, cuenta con una pulperia en la cual vende muchos productos, sus clientes la prefieren ya que ella mantiene muy buenos precios y los productos son de buena calidad, ahorita necesita un credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son bastantes y a veces se le termina el producto rapido y no tiene que vender.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que gracias a su negocio esta podiendo sacar adelante a su familia.
fue muy grato estar con doña Irma.
texts.en:
Irma Arcadia Z., 52, has a general store where she sells a variety of products. Her customers prefer her because of her low prices and the high quality of her products. She needs funding to stock her store since her customers' demands are extensive and sometimes she runs out of product quickly and then has nothing to sell. She relates to us that she feels very happy since, thanks to her business, she is able to see her family get ahead. It was very pleasant to be with Irma.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, coffee, bread, cereals, fresh and powdered milk, cured meats, dairy products, pork, chicken, eggs, pills, batteries, candles.

loans.name: Agalua

texts.en:
Agalua L. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Uta. She is engaged and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Agalua owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Agalua has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Agalua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agalua has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Agalua is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Agalua plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Julieta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different beverages in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina P., 58 years old, owns and manages a small corn farm in Banga, a municipality of South Cotabato province in southern Mindanao. She has five children. Her eldest child is 24 years old and was not able to go to college because of financial difficulties. She would like to grow her business so that she will have enough income to support all of her family’s needs.

Catalina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase both the size of her harvest and income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en: Gerel is a nurse and a native citizen of Ulaanbaatar city. She and her 25-year-old daughter live in separate yurts on the same plot of land.  She heard about the benefit of an energy efficient stove from her co-worker and wanted to try it for herself. It’s been about eight days since she started using the stove. “I noticed that the Eco stove really keeps warm longer than the regular one. When we get up in the early morning, it’s warmer than before,” she said. As a native citizen of Ulaanbaatar, she is also worried about the dramatic increase of air pollution, and has recommended Eco products to her relatives and close friends.

loans.use: an energy efficient heating stove

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Regina cooks fufu to sell at Elmina, which she has been doing for quite some time now. Regina uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Regina will use the loan to purchase bags of cassava, plantain, meat and fish to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: Regina will use the loan to purchase bags of cassava, plantain, meat and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Mrs Maricel B. is from Mahayag, Zaboanga del Sur. She is 26-years-old and single. She has a business, called a LAPAKANAY that is made up of abaka. She earns approximately 4000 a month. This business serves as her main source of income, with which she gets her daily basic needs.

She joined PMPC to gain access for financial support and to engage in other business activities. She has a loan of 3000, taken from PMPC, which is used to expand her LAPAKANAY project. She plans that the additional capital generated from her business will help to improve her living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her lapakanay business.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 femmes du groupe Djiguignouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 7 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dibida, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguignouma qui se sont connus à travers des liens de voisinage, font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de  grains de céréales et des condiments alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 5 prêts précédents, elles  sont à leur  sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de grains de céréales sèches (petit mil, maïs, niébé, sésame) estimée à 12 sacs de 100 kg et un important stock de condiments alimentaires constitué de différentes variétés.  
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement auprès des producteurs du village et environs et des grossistes venant à la foire hebdomadaire de Fana. Elles effectuent leurs ventes dans le même marché de Fana, à domicile (au village), au comptant à crédit et en détail, à une clientèle essentiellement  composée  de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, Ségou et Koulikoro.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  20.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the Djiguignouma group are all married. They are on average 38 years of age, have seven children, and live in traditional extended families in Dibida, one of the villages within Fana, in the Dioila Prefecture, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They have known each other through neighborhood ties, and essentially are retailers of grain cereals and food condiments. Having correctly repaid their five previous loans, they are now requesting a sixth loan with which they will buy a large quantity (an estimated twelve 100-kilo bags) of dry cereal: millet, corn, niébé (black-eyed peas), sesame, and an important stock of various food condiments. They get their supplies mainly from local producers and from wholesalers coming to the weekly market fair in Fana.
