Sales are done in the same market in Fana, from their home in the village, either cash or credit and also retail, to a customer base essentially made up of retailers from large cities such as Bamako, Ségou and Koulikoro. They hope to achieve average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA each, which will be used to cover family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products

loans.name: Alitubeera Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Eron is a friendly single mother with one child aged 14 years. To support herself and her child plus the orphans in her care, Eron sells stationery in Kawuga, Mukono district.

With her persistence in the face of the many adversities that single mothers face, Eron has been able, against all the odds, to last in her business for eight years and fully support her dependents. In this period, she has been able to consolidate her business and she currently earns 100,000 shillings per week.

Eron needs this loan to expand her business by stocking her stationery shop with more books, reams of paper, pens and many other items as she also completes payment of her dependents’ school fees.

loans.use: To buy more books, reams of paper, pens and many other items as well as to pay school fees

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani D. is a 26-year-old woman living with her husband and four children. There are two daughters and two sons in her family.  She is hard-working and wants to be independent.

Sriyani is sewing clothes and continuing her business that she started three years ago.  Her husband and children help her with the business.  She is asking for a 40,000 LKR Loan from BRAC. 

She hopes to provide a more nutritious diet for her family through developing her business.  Also she wants to renovate the house and to pay the children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra R. Romero   es un Joven  de 22 años de edad la cual vive con su Madre en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja. 

Desde que Mayra termino el colegio  ella se dedicaba a ayudarle a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar  ya que no había podido conseguir un trabajo. Gracias al desarrollo del turismo Sostenible en la zona donde ella vive se abrieron varios hoteles que tenían que necesitaban personal. Gracias al Ingles que aprendió en el colegio hoy está trabajando como recepcionista en el Hotel Natural Lodge. Con este trabajo ella ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Debido a su horario y a lo alejado de su casa  ella tiene que caminar sola desde el lugar donde la deja el bus hasta su casa  a altas horas de la noche. Es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamo de de ¢666,000 (seiscientos Sesenta y seis mil colones) para la compra de una una motocicleta para transportarse hasta el hotel y así poder mantener su trabajo.


Mayra forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo. Pero ella destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito muchas personas sin recursos suficientes pueden alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mayra R. Romero is a young 22 year old woman who lives with her mother in a community called Caño Negro, located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This community is distinctive for being mountainous, and for being very close to the northern frontier of our country. Its principal economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the growth of basic grains, sugarcane, and oranges. Since Mayra finished high school, she worked helping her mother with household chores, as she had not yet found a job. Thanks to the development of sustainable tourism in the area where she lives, various hotels opened that needed staff. Thanks to the English that she learned in high school, today she is working as a receptionist in the Hotel Natural Lodge. With this work, she has been able to improve the lives of her family and herself. Due to her schedule and the distance from her house, she has to walk alone from the place where the bus lets her off to her house at all hours of the night. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of ¢666,000 (six hundred and sixty-six thousand colones) for the purchase of a motorcycle so she can transport herself to the hotel and so continue with her job. Mayra is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, one of the 100 member organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This would be her first loan. However, she emphasizes that thanks to this type of organization and related credit facilitations, many people without sufficient resources can reach their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for Mayra's commute

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas K. is 61 years old and married to Kimoi Kipsang. They have four children: Jepkemoi (29 years old, female, a primary school leaver); Albert (25 years old, male, a primary school leaver); Kibet (22 years old, a primary school leaver); and Miriam (14 years old, in high school).

Silas runs a kiosk which he started seven years ago. From this he gets a monthly profit of Ksh 1,000. He earns additional income from farming.

Silas has borrowed a loan of Ksh 10,000. He plans to use Ksh 5,000 to buy two sacks of maize, Ksh 3,000 to buy two sacks of rice, Ksh 1,100 to buy a bale of wheat flour and Ksh 900 to buy 50gm packets of Omo (a brand name detergent). All the above items will be for sale in his shop.

Silas was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He does his business at Ngolong in Kabernet, Kenya which is a cold place. His customers are faithful. If this loan boosts his business, he will use the extra profit to expand his business and educate his children.

Silas dreams and hopes of buying a plot of land and owning a car. He describes himself as hardworking and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Karim Konaté est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec ses  femmes et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans son village N’godiarrala.  N’godiarrala est un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région(Sikasso) de la  République  Mali.
Ayant abandonné l’école depuis le premier cycle fondamental (système éducatif Malien), Monsieur  Konaté a tenté plusieurs activités économiques telles la vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tasses, mais finit par opter pour l’achat vente de céréales, appris auprès d’un de ses grand frères. Il est à sa dixième année d’expérience dans cette activité et dispose d’un magasin de vente.
Monsieur Konaté est à son quatrième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés .
Il veut acheter avec ce prêt, 1000kg de maïs, 500kg d’arachide et 500kg de mil et effectue sa vente à clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Konaté compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 .000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir son magasin et  assurer les dépenses de la famille (santé,scolaire,.nourriture).
texts.en:
Mr. Karim Konaté is a married man of 38 and the father of three children. He lives with his wives and children in a big traditional family in his village of N’godiarrala, a village in the county of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba, in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Having left off at the end of basic school (Malian education system,) Mr. Konaté tried out several money-earning activities such as selling clothing, shoes, dishes, but finally opted for buying and reselling cereals, which he learned how to do from his older brothers. He has an experience of 10 years now and owns his own shop. Mr. Konaté is on his fourth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. All his preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. He wants to use this loan to buy 1000 kg of maize, 500 kg of peanuts, and 500 kg of millet. He sells to a clientele composed of both retailers and individual consumers. With this loan, Mr. Konaté expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA. He proposes to use this profit to enlarge his store and to cover family expenses (health, school fees, food).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for resale

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Mrs. Vanny E. is 45 years old and is a villager who lives in Prambei Mom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Sok Chann, is a construction worker and he can receive a small salary to support his family. Because her husband's work place is far from their home, Mrs. Vanny E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to provide her husband with transportation. This couple has four children; one is a construction worker and two are students while the youngest one is 2 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rogelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Rogelio de  labora para el MINSA, desde hace 12 años como tecnico de ETV,  tiene 2 hijos ambos estudian su primaria en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina, su esposa  se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los niños.    

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para comprar un solar que esta contiguo a su terreno y esto vendra a darle mayor valor  a su casa y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, es importante mencionar que don Rogelio es un excelente cliente lo ha demostrado en sus creditos anteriores.
texts.en:
Rogelio has worked for the ministry of public health and for the past 12 years as a technician for a television company. He has two children, both of whom are studying at Mauricio Cajina School. His wife is in charge of the household chores and caring for the children. He is requesting his eighth loan to purchase a plot that is adjacent to his land to add more value to his home and in this way improve the living conditions for his family. It is important to mention that Rogelio is an excellent client, which he has demonstrated in his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land adjacent to his home

loans.name: Juana Domitila

texts.es: Juana Domitila tiene 54 años de edad. Esta no es primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos, pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Pues siempre está trabajando fuertemente para mejorar su condición económica pues trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana a las 6 de la tarde,  hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho empeño a logrado salir adelante. Por las mañanas vende su queso y cuajada en su vivienda, por lo que sus vecinos recurren a su casa en busca de estos productos. El deseo de Juana es incrementar su negocio cada día más. Este financiamiento es para la compra de leche, cuajada, queso, crema, leche agria.
texts.en:
Juana Domitila is 54 years old. This is not her first experience with loans since they have been a great help to her. She constantly works hard to improve her economic situation. She works from 7 in the morning until 6 at night. She has had her business for more than 6 years. With a lot of determination, she has succeeded in getting ahead. In the mornings she sells cheese and curd out of her home. Her neighbors turn to her to purchase these products. Juana’s goal is to increase her business more each day. This loan is for the purchase of milk, curd, cheese, cream, and yogurt-like fermented milk.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marble

texts.en:
Marble is married with five children and all her children have attended school.  None of her children currently goes to school, they all finished their education. She also takes care of additional family members.  

Marble changed her business enterprise from selling cold drinks to a shoe business. She has been in this business for a few months and she is now proud of this business. She buys bales of second-hand shoes from shops in Nabugabo and Owino market and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale.  Besides this shoe business she also sells piped water and hires out her sewing machine at   2000 per day. 

Marble owns a stall   in Kawempe where she sells her shoes.  Her business challenges include defaulters, ever increasing prices of second-hand shoes, and transportation of bales of shoes from Nabugabo to her stall in Kawempe. She works seven days a week.  

Marble is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she can get enough profit to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT because she could get loans without any collateral and the loans are timely. She resides in and   owns a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and son Amgaabazar, 8, in an apartment they bought last year with a mortgage. Her husband works in a lemonade factory as a sales representative. 

Tuya used to work in a supermarket as a salesperson. In 2008, she decided to rent a place and open a small grocery shop.  Since then, she has been running her business quite successfully. But most of her profits of around 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks go to cover the rent at the moment. So she decided to build her own small shop and also, at the same time, increase her working capital and profit. Building work is 75% complete. The reason she is asking for the loan is to complete the building project before the wintertime and to move the business in.

loans.use: To complete the building project before the wintertime

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es:
Santos tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y su ultimo hijo en el sector Valle de los Incas del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente mango y limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Como la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura; por un lado se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino y también se dedica a la siembra de árboles frutales, específicamente de mango y limón.

La crianza de animales le provee de ingresos permanentes ya que comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas y adicionalmente suele vender sus ovejas a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. En cambio la agricultura solo le genera ingresos durante las temporadas de cosecha.

Santos desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales brindándoles una mejor alimentacion, esto le permitirá vender mas leche, ya que la producción de sus vacas aumentará y además venderá sus ovejas a un mejor precio ya que estas desarrollarán de mejor manera. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. En la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Santos, 56, is married and lives with his wife and youngest child in Valle de los Incas, Tambogrande district, an agricultural area that produces primarily mangoes and lemons. It’s part of Piura province, Piura region and is located over three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. Like most of the men in the area he’s involved in farming-related activities. On the one hand he raises cattle and sheep but also grows fruit trees, specifically mango and lemon. Raising animals for sale provides a permanent source of income because he sells the milk his cows product and sells his sheep to merchants that always come by the area he lives in. On the other hand, farming only produces income during harvest time. Santos wants to improve his animals giving them better nutrition so that he can sell more milk since his cows will produce more. He will also be able to sell his sheep for better prices because they will develop better. To reach his goal he has thought it advisable to request his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa Santos is a hard working man who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman to expand his cattle-raising business. In the area where he lives he is quite well known and esteemed by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for improved cattle and sheep raising.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth L. is a widow who lives in Prk. 1, Brgy. Tiling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food-vending business. Ruth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use as revolving capital for her food-vending business so that she can continue to save up for her future security and to uplift her living conditions. Ruth L. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Fund operations

loans.name: Julio Andres

texts.es:
Julio Andrés Z. S.
Julio es de 33 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos varones, es tejedor, actualmente elabora cortes típicos, en la actividad tiene ocho años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para ampliación de capital de trabajo y compra de material para tejeduría, el solicitante ha llenado los requisitos, la cual es factible la autorización del mismo.
texts.en:
Julio Andrés Z. S.
Julio is 33 years old, married and has 2 sons. He is a weaver and currently works in traditional pieces. He has 8 years of experience with this work. He is requesting his first loan for expanding his capital for work and to buy material for weaving. He has met the requirements for the loan, which was possible with his own authorization.

loans.use: To buy materials for weaving

loans.name: Duncan Samwel

texts.en:
Duncan has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 20 years. He is 65 years old and married to Peris Wanjiru. They have six children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to plant vegetables on his farm.

In the future, Duncan hopes to own a large tract of land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime,  vive en la ciudad de la Paz, en la zona de Tembladerani, la casa donde vive es del Papa de su esposa donde cuenta con dos ambientes que son sus dormitorios, cuenta con una sala comedor y una cocina.  Tiene dos hijos a los cuales aun mantiene ya que aun están estudiando en primaria,  don Jaime es de profesión chofer con una experiencia de 20 años en su actividad, el trabaja todos los días a excepción de los días miércoles día en que se dedica a su familia. Su esposa aporta también en la economía familiar vendiendo ropa en un puesto ubicado por el centro solo por la noche. El crédito será destinado al equipamiento de accesorios y mantenimiento del vehículo, para así poder brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Jaime lives in the Tembladerani área of the city of La Paz.  The house where he lives belongs to his wife’s father where he has two bedrooms, a dining room, and a kitchen.  He has two children who he still supports since they are still in elementary school.  Jaime is a driver and has 20 years of experience in the business.  He works every day except Wednesday, which he dedicates to his family.  His wife also contributes to the family finances, selling clothing at a place in the center only at night.  The loan will be used for accessories and service for the vehicle so that he can provide better service.

loans.use: To buy accessories and to service his car

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. is married and has seven dependants. Araba sells cooked banku (a local dish prepared from milled maize) and serves it with soup in Elmina. Her husband is a fisherman. Araba uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Araba will use her loan to expand her banku business. She wishes to buy land with her additional income.

loans.use: To expand her banku business

loans.name: Ana Guillermina

texts.es:
Ana de 53 años, confecciona y cose ropa en su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Desde pequeña ella aprendió a coser para tener una oportunidad de trabajar independientemente. Inicio cosiendo y confecciona ropa a sus vecinos y amigos poco a poco pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser y ahora ya tiene un número definido de clientes. En la actualidad tienen su taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja sola de lunes a viernes haciendo ropa por pedido y enmendándola.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser  para ser más productiva. En el futuro quiere tener distintas maquinas de coser y contratar personal para tener más pedidos.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old.  She makes and sews clothes in her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil which is called Duran.  The area is noted for its deteriorating ecosysetm.

Ana learned to sew from an early age so that she would be able to work independently.  She began sewing and making clothes for her neighbors and friends.  She was eventually able to buy her own sewing machine and now she has a fixed number of customers.  She currently has her sewing and dressmaking workshop in her home.  She works alone from Monday through Friday, making clothes to order and also mending clothes.

She will use her loan to buy a new sewing machine so that she can be more productive.  In the future she would like to have a number of different sewing machines and to hire staff so that she can fill more orders.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac C. is 34 years old and married to Caroline Kulei. They have been blessed with two children who are four years and three years old. Isaac supports four people including his brothers' child, his children and wife. His wife also supplements his income from her small grocery shop.

Isaac runs a carpentry workshop and has been in this business for almost 20 years. From this business, Isaac gets an average monthly income of Kshs 20,000.

He has borrowed his sixth loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying his previous loans on time. Isaac intends to use the Kshs 20,000 to purchase timber for his workshop and Kshs 20,000 to stock his new mini-hardware shop.

He plans to use his profits to expand his business and save for future use. His dream is to have a big workshop and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his workshop

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es: Yuly, de 37 años, es una luchadora madre soltera de 3 hijos: Luisa, de 9, Katy, de 3 y Alexandra, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ella vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo de está emprendedora mujer, es la venta de helados y chocotejas (una especie de dulces a base de chocolate); según afirma está excelente mujer, sus ventas son muy buenas, ya que en el lugar no existe muchas tiendas, y el calor del lugar es impresionante. Pero no solo eso es la actividad de Yuly, también se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos, los que en cada cosecha los comercializa a los intermediarios que visitan constantemente la zona. Pero aún le falta mucho, como adquirir una refrigeradora, con la que pueda mantener en buena temperatura los helados y chupetes que vende, por ello está pensando adquirir una propia, “ya le falta poco”, afirma. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasta con el trabajo que desempeñara junto a los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, planea completar el dinero que ahorró para la compra de una refrigeradora, con lo que podrá dinamizar sus ventas, de helados.
texts.en:
Yuly, who is 36 years old, is a hardworking single mother of three: Luisa 9, Kay 3, and Alexandra 2. She lives in her own home located in the Palomar Union community (central Peruvian forest). This businesswoman's work is that of selling ice creams and chocotejas ( a type of candy based of chocolate). According to this accomplished woman, her sales are plentiful since there are no other stores around and the heat in the area is astonishing.
Yuly also grows coffee and bananas and sells them to buyers who frequent the area. However, she still has a long way to go. She needs to buy a freezer to keep her ice cream and popsicles cold and she affirms that "she is lacking a small amount." This is her first loan with MFP and is very enthusiastic about the work she will carry out with the other members of her communal bank. With the requested loan she plans on buying the freezer to be able to increase her ice cream sales.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Rifaat

texts.ar:
رفعت في عمر 38 سنة يعمل في اشتراكات المولدات الكهربائية له في عمله اربع سنوات متزوج يحب عمله وقد لقي دعم 
كبير من محيطه العملي حيث ان زبائنه هم اكثرية اهل قريته يريد وقد اثر بشكل ايجابي عليه قرضه الاول من المجموعة
في زيادة مدخوله ما يميزه هي المصداقية في التعامل والصدق في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى
شراء شبكات جديدة للمولد وشراء مولد جديد
texts.en: Rifaat, who is 38 years old and married, has four years of experience working in the distribution of generator-powered electricity. He very much enjoys his work and is distinguished by his credibility and integrity. Rifaat also receives considerable support from his customers, most of whom hail from his home village. The last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive impact in enabling Rifaat to achieve higher revenues. Accordingly, he would now like to seek another loan to purchase a new generator and new grids.

loans.use: To purchase new electric generator and new electric grids

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Shanta T..  She is married and has 3 children ages 23, 20 and 15.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supoorts her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Shanta plans to boost the economic condition of her family and she thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates, or join our BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of 3 school-aged children. He is an experienced furniture maker; he has owned a furniture making shop for almost twenty years. He is the main income provider of his family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory. This will be his second Kiva loan and he is very thankful for the results. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business operation. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Angel Ramón

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar encontramos a don Ángel, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  hijo de  cinco años el  mismo que este año empieza a estudiar en escuela. La mujer  es comerciante.

El se dedica al trabajo en una piladora de maní en tosagua pero en su casa tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo, en la cual venden todo tipo de productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, en ella trabaja su esposa todos los días y el cuándo esta en su casa desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en el centro de Tosagua y algunos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta todo del Banco. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca más.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, every 15 days, La Inmaculada (the Immaculate) Community Bank meets. This place is known as being very dynamic, where the majority of its inhabitants are farmers or raise animals because this area has so much vegetation.

Here we find Angel. He is 30 years old and married with a son who is five years old. The boy will start school this year. Angel's wife is a salesperson.

Angel works for a peanut sheller in Tosagua, but the has a grocery store out of his home, where he sells all sorts of items such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent. His wife works in the store every day, and he works there when he is home, from 6 am to 8 pm, and sometimes later. He buys the merchandise in Tosagua, but some things are delivered to his house.

This loan will be used to stock the store more. He is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausage, and other basic items. He has been with the community bank for four loan cycles and he is completely pleased with the bank. His goals are to move forward in his business and for his store to grow more.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausage, and other basic items

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. is a "banku" (fermented dough) seller in Jukwa near Abura. "Banku" is made from corn and cassava dough. She prepares the banku several times a week and sells it afterwards in front of her house with fried fish. For the three years the business went well but she is hoping for a breakthrough with the help of the loan. 

Ekua will use the money to buy more corn in order to prepare larger quantities of banku. Ekua is married to a farmer and takes care of five dependents. Therefore she will use most of her newly earned profit to take care of her family. She went to school herself and wants her children to enjoy the same privilege but learning materials and school fees cost money. That’s why she aims to assist her husband more in these payments. With a growing business she knows this will be possible.

loans.use: to buy more corn to prepare larger quantities of "banku".

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah T. R. is 45 years old, married to Nkunai, and they have three children. He is a farmer who plants crops and later sells the harvest at a profit for a monthly income of Ksh 4,000. He has been a farmer for the past five years. 

Jeremiah learned about KADET through an advertisement done by KADET in his local radio station. He was curious and enquired more and later joined as a client. He has applied for his second loan of Kshs 30,000 with KADET with which he plans to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds that he gets as profit by planting more farm produce for resale.

He is an honest man who believes that supported financially he can be able to achieve more.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sab

texts.en:
Mrs. Sab was born in 1983 and she is a wedding beautician and a pig breeder. She earns enough profit to support her family. 

Since business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to fulfill this purpose, Mrs. Sab is applying for a loan to buy five more piglets, pig food, and to build a pigsty. Her husband, Mr. Phorlla, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He will sell some of the rice and rest of the rice will support his family. Through this activity, they support a child who is attending a local public school. Her husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy five piglets, pig food, and to build a pigsty.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en: Glady A., 25 years old, is currently in a business of selling clothes.  She plans to use her loan to stock more clothes.  She is married to a teacher, and they have two children.  One goes to school.   Glady's future goal is to build a house for her mother.

loans.use: to stock more clothes.

loans.name: Oyunzul

texts.en: Oyunzul T. is 36 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  Her husband is a taxi driver. They live in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Oyunzul manages a clothing trading business at her older sister's booth at a trading center. She started her business in 2007. In order to supplement her family earning, she began a porcelain trading business in 2009. She also offers barter trading for her customers. She is planning to have her own booth in the future. She is a patient and diligent woman who says, "One will succeed if she has a big dream." She is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory

loans.name: Juana Cristina

texts.es:
Juana Cristina es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó el quinto años de educación secundaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, al tejido de cortes típicos, lleva un año de experiencia en este trabajo, inició gracias al apoyo de su familia.

Debido a la necesidad de contar con mas capital de trabajo, decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar hilo de diferente clases y colores, esto para producir mas volumen de tejidos, espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande y prospero, para que así pueda seguir mejorando su condicion de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Cristina is 20 years old and single.  She studied up to the fifth year of high school.  Her business is weaving and she weaves traditional clothes.  She has one year of experience in this line of work.  She started out in her business thanks to the support of her family.

Owing to her need for more working capital, Juana Cristina decided to request a loan that she could use to buy different types and colors of thread so that she could produce more woven products.  She hopes, in the future, to see her business increase and become prosperous so that she can continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy threads

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina sells women’s clothing outfits from a rented space in the local mall. Marina is married with two children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in the town of Novaya Kahovka. She launched her business 18 years ago in the volatile perestroika times to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Currently, Marina has 70,000 UAH in inventory. Monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 UAH. 

Marina is requesting a loan of 17,500 UAH to purchase assorted of merchandise for sale at her mall outlet. She believes that the loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase selection of merchandise for the fall season. Marina realizes that at all stages in her business development, it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to keep a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: to purchase assorted of merchandise

loans.name: Kouélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de riz à la devanture de sa maison, Akouélé a 48ans. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des condiments (riz, huile haricot, mais…) Notons qu’elle a commencé en 2005. Elle est mère de 02enfants et son mari est enseignant et fondateur d’école. Elle vend aussi des tomates, piment et des épices.
texts.en: Akouélé is 48 years old and has sold rice from her home since 2005. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase condiments (rice, vegetable oil, and corn...). She has two children and her husband is a teacher and founder of a school.  She also sells tomatoes, pepper and spices.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetable oil and corn

loans.name: Bayarbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarbaatar, 37, lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Baasarsuren, works in a pawn shop. His daughter, Maralmaa, is a student in secondary school. 

In 2003, he graduated from the National University of Mongolia as a lawyer. Since his childhood, he has always been interested in fashion design. However, he is not a professional designer. He has been designing and sewing dresses lately. Sometimes he needs to hire some workers to support his business when he has a high work load. Now he would like to renovate his work shop and to buy new textiles and fabrics for his tailoring business. 
The loan that Mr. Bayarbaatar is taking will be devoted for these reasons.

loans.use: to renovate his work shop and to buy new textiles and fabrics for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, aged 28, is a single lady who does dressmaking. She has been doing the business for two years and earns a monthly profit of KES 18,000.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan funds to buy materials for making dresses.

Lucy intends to use the expected profits to open another dressmaking shop and hopes to own a piece of land in future.

loans.use: To buy materials for making dresses

loans.name: Harapan Baru 15 Group

texts.en: To rent a place for a business is quite expensive in Jakarta. So, using the house as a place to run the business is the cheapest way, that's what Wati does. Wati is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and her children (4) in Cilincing. She sells snacks and drinks like es campur and palu butung. To expand her business she needs more ingredients and she requested 3,000,000 Indonesia Rupiah. She prepare expansion especially for this Ramadhan time, she believe this time she can increase her income. Her focus is for her children education, she want to send all of them to college.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, flour, eggs, ice, etc.

loans.name: Heremakono  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe HEREMAKONO IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the “Heremakono IV” group are all married women averaging 31 years of age with three children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Nogonlon, a village in the rural community of Banco, Doila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their activities at the beginning of the winter season. They cultivate rice and peanuts [ground nuts], among others. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, Awa, the first person standing on the right, plans to purchase farm inputs [such as fertilizers] and small tools as well as pay the costs of labor and weeding to maintain 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres] of rice. 

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 80,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, weeding and small tools

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 38 years old and married to Alice. They are blessed with two children between six and four years old. He has been running a timber yard for the past three years, making a monthly profit of KES 50,000. He has been loaned KES 20,000, which he plans to use to add more stock of timber to sell. With the anticipated profit made from the business, he plans to transport more timber from Tanzania and sell here in kenya.

loans.use: to purchase more timber  to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 36 years. He is 54 years old, married to Hannah, and they have five school-going children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees for his children. In future, Charles hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his childrren

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old a business lady; she is married to Patrick. They are blessed with two children aged 17 and 12. She has been running a mobile clinic for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 40,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy medicine and open a permanent clinic. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a mini-shop in the future, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy medicine and use the rest to open a permanent clinic.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 28 years old and has 2 children who are 8 and 6. One of them is in school. She is married and her husband drives  a motorcycle taxi. She sells vegetables in the market which has allowed her to support her family. She would like a loan to purchase to increase her capital which she will use to buy more vegetables. Consolee will use the profits to meet the needs of the family and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and only child. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a home electrician for the past seven years. He works upon the requests of his clients and has one employee helping him with the work. He is the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools for his business. He plans to take more projects and has to be equipped with the needed supplies so as to be meet the needs of his clients. Elie feels positive about his future work.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing new tools for his business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa, 53 años de edad, es una humilde comerciante y zapatera, originaria de la ciudad de Granada, ella solo estudio la primaria por condiciones de pobreza no siguió estudian se dedico a trabajar, ella es madre de 5 hijos todos  independientes. Inicio su experiencia de comerciante vendiendo ropa y zapatos con el apoyo de su hermana quien el enseño a vender y le presento clientes para que ella fuera adquiriendo su propia clientela, ella vende en los pueblos aledaños de la ciudad de Granada, luego adquirió experiencia en la elaboración artesanal de zapatos de cuero para hombre, ahora ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la elaboración y venta de zapatos de varón, ella vende sus zapatos en las ciudades de Masaya y León. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar materia prima tales como cuero, suelas, mostasia, rollal, vaquetas, para elaborar zapatos. Con la compra de esta materia prima podrá tener mas material para elaborar y producir mas zapatos y logra una de sus metas que es expandirse en mas ciudades y poder comprar una maquina semi industrial para coser zapatos que le gustaría comprar en lo futuro, ya que etas son un poco caras y necesita ahorrar lo suficiente para poder adquirirla.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 53, is a humble businesswoman and cobbler, a native of the city of Granada.  She only went to elementary school.  For reasons of poverty she didn't continue studying, she worked.  She is the mother of five children, all of them on their own.

She began her business experience selling clothes and shoes with the help of her sister, who taught her to sell and introduced her to customers so she could acquire her own clientele.  She sells in the towns near the city of Granada.  Later she acquired experience making handcrafted leather shoes for men.

Now, she and her husband work making and selling men's shoes.  She sells her shoes in the cities of Masaya and León.

She requested the loan to buy materials such as leather, soles, beads, shoe polish, and calfskin to make shoes.  With the purchase of these items she will be able to have more material to make and produce more shoes, and realize one of her goals, which is to expand into more cities and be able to buy a semi-industrial machine to sew shoes.  She would like to buy this machine in the future, since they are somewhat expensive and she needs to save the necessary amount to be able to get it.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, soles, beads, shoe polish, and calfskin, to make shoes.

loans.name: 08.07.11- Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Mrs Hiền has a manufacturing business making stone furniture. Hiền has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make stone furniture to sell.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 11 Đông Vệ solidarity group. In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Hiền hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase material to make stone furniture to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, D. 30 años es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía D. sus 2 hermanas en L. ciudad D. Huancavelica.  Sus padres le encomendaron el cuidado D. sus hermanas, quienes salieron del campo para buscar un mejor futuro en L. ciudad; ahí donD. comenzó Alexander a forjar su futuro. Estudio educación en un instituto, con el tiempo descubrió que su vocación es ser ingeniero civil, por ello se esforzó y postuló a L. universidad del estado, ya le faltan dos años para terminar su carrera y lo que más le gusta es poder ver su sueño realizado. Su actividad económica es el servicio D. Internet y fotocopias que abrió cerca D. L. universidad, ahí obtiene buenas ganancias, pues los estudiantes, son los que más hacen uso D. estos servicios. “Mi tiempo lo tengo que compartir con el estudio, durante las mañanas estoy en L. universidad y durante las tardes en el negocio. Me turno con mis hermanas para no tener que cerrar”, afirma. Ahora su mayor deseo es terminar sus estudios y así ser un profesional. Éste es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Alexander, D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. papeles, y una máquina cortadora, para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 30, is a dutiful son. He lives with his two sisters in the city of of Huancavelica. His parents charged him with the care of his sisters so that they could leave the countrysiD. in search of a better future in the city. It is here that Alexander has started to forge a future of his own. He studied education at an institute and then discovered that he wanted become a civil engineer for his vocation. For this reason, he strived to advance to the state university. He lacks two years before finishing his degree. What he enjoys most is seeing his dream become a reality. Alexander has a business providing Internet and photocopying services near the university. He is able to generate good earnings because the students make use of these services. “I devote the time that I have to my studies. During the mornings, I am at the university and then manage the business in the afternoons. I take turns managing the business with my sisters so that it can always stay open,” he says. Now his greatest wish is to finish his studies and become a professional.

This is his second loan with MFP. Alexander hopes to have everyone’s support so that he can follow through with his plans. He promises to complete his payments. In addition, he is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Alexander will invest the money he requested in the purchase of paper and a cutting machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy paper and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Luz Edilia

texts.es: La señora Luz Edilia a sus 47 años de edad, trabaja en una miscelánea que le compró a una cuñada con el fin de salir de sus problemas de salud mental debido al estado de depresión que tenia la señora Luz Edilia por la muerte de su hija menor. Gracias a este negocio, la señora Luz Edilia ha podido salir adelante y ocupar su tiempo en labores productivas. Para la temporada de fin de año, la señora Luz Edilia desea ampliar su surtido con mercancía de navidad como adornos, arbolitos, luces, entre otros productos. Con lo anterior la señora Luz Edilia espera incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera contribuir con la educación profesional de su hijo de 18 años y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luz Edilia is 47 years old. She works in a miscellany shop that she bought from a sister-in-law with the goal of overcoming mental health problems from the depression she had due to the death of her youngest daughter. Thanks to this business, Luz Edilia has been able to move forward and occupy her time with productive work. For the end of year season, Luz Edilia wants to expand her inventory with Christmas merchandise such as ornaments, Christmas trees, and lights, among other products. With these items, Luz Edilia hopes to increase her earnings, and in this way contribute to the professional education of her 18-year-old son and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of Christmas merchandise such as ornaments, Christmas trees, and lights

loans.name: Basilisia Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Basilisa maricela cuenta con 45 años de edad y está casada con el señor Genaro con quien tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 estudian Abelardo y Carlos, cursan tercer año de prepa y sexto año de primaria, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, se dedica a la venta de agua en garrafón desde hace mas de 5 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida, también contar con una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más botes de agua y refrescos.
La meta que tiene doña Basilisa es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es construir un pequeño local para poner un deposito de refrescos, y así tener más variedad y surtido, ya que podrá mejorar sus ingresos, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a Fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo”.
texts.en:
Basilisia Maricela is 45, and married to Genaro.  They have 4 children: Abelardo and Carlos are in the 3rd year of high school and sixth year of primary school while the other two are married.  
She has sold large bottles of water for more than 5 years.  She tells us that she decided to begin since she wanted a way to get her children ahead and offer them a good quality of life.  She also wanted to have more income to support them with their studies.  She will us the loan to buy more bottles of water and soft drinks.

Basilisia’s goal is to have her business grow and what she really wants is to build a small stand from where she can sell soft drinks.  She could then have more variety and supply and improve her earnings and continue supporting her children in their professional studies.
“I thank the Foundation Realided and the Kiva donors for having confidence in me and offering me their support”.

loans.use: to buy more bottles of water and soft drinks

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut is a diligent and responsible housewife who resides in the Baray district. She cultivates rice during the rainy season as well as raising hogs in addition to farming. Typically, she can earn a profit of $1.50 per day from her hog-raising business. She works really hard in order to provide her children with basic necessities, especially education. She wants them to finish high school. Ut says that she is taking out this loan to buy a plow because it’s necessary for her farming business. In the future, she aims to improve her agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy a plow.

loans.name: Kely Tatiana

texts.es:
Kely tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive con su madre. La localidad donde residen es una localidad situada a orillas del mar llamada Puerto Malabrigo, es una zona dedicada a la extracción artesanal e industrial de pescado, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella trabaja en una panadería ubicada en su vivienda elaborando y comercializando diversos productos. Lleva tres años en el negocio y lo administra junto con su madre.  Ellas dependen de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos y salir adelante.

Kely desea reparar una de las máquinas con las que cuenta para realizar su trabajo y así poder seguir asegurándose el sustento y calidad de vida, es por ello que ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Kely tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Este es su primer crédito con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Kely is 21 years old, is single, and lives with her mother.  The town where they live is a town located on the seafront of Puerto Malabrigo.  It is a zone dedicated to the artisan and industrial extraction of fish.  It is located in the region of La Libertad, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works in a bakery located in her home producing and selling various products.  She has been working there for three years and she manages it together with her mother.  They depend on this business to cover their costs and come out ahead.

Keli wants to repair a machine which she uses to do her job and in that way ensure their livelihood and quality of life.  Because of this she has seen fit to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that will help her achieve her goal.

Keli has good references from her neighbors and acquaintances.  She is a hard-working and responsible person.  This is her first loan with our institution.

loans.use: to repair bakery machinery.

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum, es feriante y lleva abarrotes, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, siente que ha progresado, en todo este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas, aprendió valores como la puntualidad, la responsabilidad, y lo mas importante le enseñaron a tener una buena administración en su negocio, toda las enseñanzas lo transmite a sus hijos, recuerda que con mucho esfuerzo empezó, pero Finca le ayuda a no desmayar y seguir adelante, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, lo que desea es poder seguir ahorrando para poder comprar un camión.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank Llamkasum.  She travels and sells groceries and has been a member of Finca Perú for 12 years.  She feels like she has progressed and learned many things in all this time, such as values like punctuality and responsibility, but most importantly how to apply good business administration.  She is passing all of her training on to her children.

She remembers how hard it was to get started but Finca helped her not to give up and continue to get ahead.  The loan will be used to buy groceries.  Her goal is to save enough to buy a truck.

loans.use: To purchase sugars, rice, cooking oil, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Argentine

texts.en: Argentine is 35 years old. She has spent 11 years running a boutique from which she sells different items. Argentine wants the loan to buy more items to add in the boutique such as rice, sugar, soaps and cooking oil to sell. She plans to use the profits for buying a house. She dreams to have a very prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tubehoneza Sub Group B

texts.en: Godelive is a group leader; aged 32 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 12 years. The group is called TUBEHONEZA means “GOOD LIVING” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more banana,cassava and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more banana,cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary W. was born 45 years ago. She is married and has four children. She is a dedicated member of the Catholic Church. She is a farmer and grows tea, vegetables, beans, maize, coffee and she has dairy cows. Every month she is able to sell her farm produce of about USD125 from sale of milk, vegetables and tea leaves. Her income is not enough to meet all her family needs, therefore, she is would like to take a loan to supplement her current earnings.  She wants to buy chicken and goat manure to increase land productivity. Also she will be able to maintain her animals by buying Dairy feeds to possibly increase milk production. She believes the loan will increase out put and this will lead to improved earnings and later change the standard of living.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy manure, animal feeds and agrochemicals

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is an IDP from Agdam district, occupied by armenian forces. She fled to Baku in 1993. She started her business in 2000 with her own money. In 2004 she borrowed three loans from Normicro Baku branch totaling $1400. Now she would like to borrow $1000.

loans.use: To increase business goods

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: At twenty nine years old, Susitina is just starting her family.  She has a one year old daughter and a husband who works part-time as a taxi driver.  Besides having good baking skills, she recently started an elei printing business (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics) using a small loan from the SPBD microfinance program. Her business is steadily growing and she is planning to expand it by purchasing more textiles and additional stencils to increase the variety of her designs. She is looking forward to a time when she becomes really successful with her elei printing business so she can also invest in her other passion – baking.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials (stencils, paint, glitters) for her elei printing business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is an enterprising young woman with a great desire to better her situation. She is a single mother with a four year old child. Four years ago, she decided to open her own business in order to earn an income while still having time for her son. Drawing on her knowledge of work as a beautician, she prepared a small space in her home as a beauty parlor. Little by little she has become know amongst her neighbors for her good service, and this has helped to gain additional clients.

She now asking for a $550 loan to expand her beauty parlor. She will use the loan to pay to remodel and to purchase supplies that she uses for hairdressing. She has agreed to pay the loan in 6 months. You can help Maria to do great things by giving this business the boost that it needs to continue growing. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es madre soltera de un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso y disponer de tiempo para no descuidar a su hijo, ella inició su propio negocio hace cuatro años, aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene de estilista, acondicionó un pequeño lugar en su casa para acondicionarlo como estética. Poco a poco fue dándose a conocer entre sus vecinos y la buena calidad de servicio que ofrece la ha ayudado a mejora continuamente e incrementar sus clientes.

Ahora necesita ampliar su local para lo que solicita un préstamo de $550 dólares que, además de la remodelación, empelará en la compra de insumos que utiliza en su estética, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mari puede hacer grandes cosas, decídete a darle el impulso que necesita este negocio para continuar creciendo, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Remodeling and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Ivonne B. manufactures cabinetry and other furniture. Her shop is located at the rear of her home. She tends to clients from eight in the morning to six in the afternoon. She manufactures chests of drawers in laurelwood and pine. She has five years of experience in this business and works alongside her husband.

Purpose of the Loan

She would use the loan to buy more lumber. The demand for chests of drawers has increased, and she would like to meet client orders. Her funiture is well finished, and the demand is growing.

About the Applicant

Our friend Ivonne is 33. She has three children, who attend school. Her husband helps her in the business, and she would like the loan in order to meet client orders and expand her business. In addition to her cabinetry business, she runs a small store where she sells household supplies, and she would use part of the loan to stock the store with more staples. Her one-story house is of cane and has an earthen floor. Ivonne told us that her dream is to increase her business and build a more secure cement block house for her family and business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Ivonne tiene taller de ebanistería. Ubicado en su domicilio en la parte de atrás de la casa. Su atención a los clientes es de 8: AM a 18: PM labora todos los días de la semana. Su producción es elaborar cómodas, en madera de laurel y pino. Su experiencia es desde hace 5 años. Trabaja junto con su esposo.

Uso del Préstamo

Ivonne solicita crédito para comprar mas madera. Su demanda de cómodas ha crecido y necesita cumplir con sus clientes. Sus productos tienen un buen acabado por lo que le están solicitando mas cómodas.

Información Personal

Nuestra amiga Ivonne tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, ellos están estudiando. Su esposo la ayuda en el negocio e indica que le gustaría mucho que sea considerada con un crédito. Para así de esta manera cumplir con sus clientes y poder seguir creciendo con su negocio. Adicional a este negocio de Ebanistería Ivonne posee una pequeña Tienda donde vende víveres y también necesita invertir para surtirla con más productos. Su casa es de caña y tiene piso de tierra. Ivonne nos dice que su sueño es incrementar mas sus negocios y de esta manera poder construir su vivienda de cemento para dar mayor seguridad a su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: I am 39 years old and married with one child. My husband used to work for one of the government department in the town area. Unfortunately, when he got sick of asthma, he resigned from his job. We have struggled so hard to find a better life not only for us, but for our child as well. We have saved over the years, and we bought a taxi.  I drive during the week days, but on the weekends my younger brother drives. This is my first loan with SPBD and I am confident that my business will do well in future.

loans.use: To buy parts for her taxi

loans.name: Khakverdi

texts.en: Khakverdi Q. is a 46 years old farmer who keeps a sheep herd in a  small southern village of Azerbaijan. He has twelve years of experience in animal breeding and sales. He sells sheep to the local bazaar traders for meat production. He is married and has two children. Everything is going well in his business and it brings him good enough money to keep his family in good condition. However to keep animals in a good herd is impossible because of the shortage of income. Khakverdi has applied for a 1200 USD loan. He is going to expand his sheep herd and purchase 15 sheep for estimated price 60 USD each, and for the rest of the amount, 300 USD, he will build a good shed to keep the  animals safe and warm during the  winter season.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and build a sheep shed

loans.name: Alimahmad

texts.ru:
Alimahmad I. is 46 years old, has completed high school, is married, has five children. Alimahmad is planning to use his loan to buy cattle and feed for fattening. Mr. I. has been doing this type of activity for the last 13 years. After completing fattening he will sell the cattle every 40-45 days and use the money he makes from sales to purchase more animals. The main buyers of his cattle are the citizens of the city Kurgan-Tyube and surrounding regions. This type of activity is the main source of income for the family. The client is planning to return the loan within the next 12 month.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ибрагимов Алимахмад, возраст – 46 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. На полученный кредит Алимахмад хочет приобрести крупный рогатый скот и корм для его откорма. Этим видом деятельности он заниается уже в течение 13 лет. После откорма скота через каждые 40-45 он будет продавать их и на вырученные деньги приобретать новый молодняк. Основными его покупателями являются жители города Курган-Тюбе и близлежащих районов. Этот вид деятельности является основным источникам полученя дохода для содержания семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of calves and feed for fattening of cattle

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy belongs to the local bank Las Mercedes. She works making recycled cardboard tubes that are used to make fireworks. Her business is located in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a master roll and a bag of powder to make fireworks. Judy is 48 years old, married, and works with her husband. They have 3 children, and both Judy and her husband work to provide them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judy pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a la producción de tubos de cartón reciclado para ser utilizados en la pirotecnia (producción de juegos artificiales). El negocio está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagará en 6 meses, comprará un rollo de guía y una bolsa de pólvora para la producción de juegos artificiales. Judy tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. Tienen 3 hijos y tanto Judy como su esposo trabajan para educarlos.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Señora Nelly is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women) located at Jr La Habana Mz G Lt. 6 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 68 years old, has nine children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business of buying and selling clothes.

Presently she continues selling second-hand clothing and with the earnings that she has obtained, she bought a motorcart that is driven by her son. In her business, she has to travel constantly to the residents living on the banks of the Ucayali river. With the help of her kids, she gets the physical labor done and they also help her at home.

With the loan of 1200 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest in second-hand clothes, sandals, shoes, and beauty accessories.

Nelly, despite her age and being in a little bit of bad health, continues working because she says that she has some energy and that it makes her feel more alive. It gives her a lot of pleasure and satisfaction to make the trips for her business, because she knows many places and people.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelly pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. La Habana Mz. G Lt. 6, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 68 años, 9 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de ropa.

En la actualidad sigue vendiendo ropa de segunda y con las ganancias obtenidas compró un motocarro, que es manejado por su hijo, por cosas de su negocio tiene que viajar constantemente a los caseríos del las riberas del rió Ucayali. Con la ayuda de sus hijos realiza esa faena y también la ayudan en la casa.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa de segunda mano, sandalias, zapatos y accesorios de belleza.

Nelly, a pesar de su edad y estando un poco mal de salud, continúa trabajando por que dice que tiene energías para rato y eso la hace sentirse mas viva. Le da mucho placer y satisfacciones los viajes que realiza porque conoce mas lugares y personas.

loans.use: second-hand clothes and other products

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.es:
For 2, 5, and 3 years respectively Ruth, Flor and Paulina have belonged to the communal bank "Ccatarisun," a Quechua expression that means "Let's Move Up."

Ruth is a single mother of a four-year-old daughter; she is 23 years old. Ruth is a computer technician, and she also sells groceries out of her home. Ruth occasionally works at a business selling computers.

Flor is a single mother of two children, and is 32 years old. Flor has a bar in her home, an activity that she has performed for a year. Also, Flor sells cosmetics by catalog. With this loan, Flor will make a down payment on a mototaxi.

Paulina is married, 50 years old, and has five children, three of whom live with her. A nurse by profession, Paulina sells clothing and shoes on credit to her friends and family, products that she brings from the city of Lima. Paulina also sells cosmetics and jewelry from cosmetics. Paulina will use the loan to open a phone center.

Ruth, Flor and Paulina need loans for 600, 1500 and 1000 soles ($1125 total), money they will invest in purchasing soft drinks, noodles, sugar, vegetable, and in making down payments for a motor taxi and a phone center.

Ruth, Flor, and Paulina dream of having a computer sales business, a wholesale grocery store, of purchasing a car, and that their children will grow up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth, Flor y Paulina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2, 5 , 3 años respectivamente.

Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 4 años, Ruth es técnica en computación, Ruth tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Ruth trabaja eventualmente en empresas de venta de computadoras.

Por otro lado Flor es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Flor tiene un bar en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 1 año. Además Flor vende cosméticos por catálogo. Flor con el préstamo que obtendrá pagará la inicial de una mototaxi.

Mientras que Paulina es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, de profesión enfermera, Paulina vende zapatos y ropa a crédito a amigos y familiares, sus productos los trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Paulina vende cosméticos, joyas por catálogos. Paulina con el préstamo que obtendrá abrirá un locutorio.

Ruth, Flor y Paulina necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1500 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, fideo, azúcar, verduras, para la inicial de su mototaxi y locutorio.

Los sueños de Ruth, Flor y Paulina son tener una empresa de venta de computadoras, una tienda de abarrotes por mayor, comprar un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, and down payments on a motor taxi and phone center.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has 2 children. She started the business to get extra income to pay for her children's schooling because she couldn't count on her husband to pay for it. She was unemployed and unable to count on financial help from anyone else so she decided to start her own business to meet household expenses. She began a little more than a year ago with a rented food stand outside her house that she now owns.

Maria is applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies and new utensils. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María del Carmen es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio para conseguir ingresos extras para pagar los estudios de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Se encontraba desempleada y no contaba con apoyo financiero de nadie por lo que decido iniciar su propio negocio para poder conseguir ingresos y sacar adelante los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace un poco más de un año con un puesto de comidas que rentaba afuera de su casa y actualmente ya es suyo.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses necesita para comprar mercancía y utensilios nuevos. Con tu apoyo podrá seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Yasemeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasemeen B., wife of Mr. I., is a mother of four daughters. Yasmeen and her husband have a business where they embroider and stitch clothes. Their monthly income is $100. Yasmeen would like apply for a loan to buy one more sewing machine and train her girls.

Her loan group includes: Naseem B. and Bilquis B. want to start a seasonal wheat business; Zubaida B. wants to buy a goat; Hanifan B. wants to start milk business. This is a loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mahinou

texts.fr: Mrs. Mahinou D. was born around 1970 and lives in Enagnon, a slum neighborhood of Cotonou. Married to Houinsavi Akpovo, a carpenter, she is the mother of his three children of whom two are in school and the third is an apprentice. Having lived in this neighborhood for 7 years, she sells smoked fish, jewelry, and various other products. On October 10, 2006 she came in and requested a first loan of US$ 75 which allowed her to take care of some financial difficulties with her business. She has made a lot of progress with her little business and for her fourth loan, she is requesting the amount of US$ 250 to bolster her capital which is somewhat improved at present. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerDame D. Mahinou est née vers les années 1970 et réside à ENAGNON un quartier bidonville de Cotonou. Mariée  à AKPOVO Houinsavi, menuisier de son état, elle a eu avec ce dernier trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés et le troisième en apprentissage.
